description.text:
Who we are?

Besedo is a fast-growing tech company offering content moderation tools and services to online marketplaces around the world. Every year, we review and moderate over 500 million pieces of user-generated content and block 40 million fraud attempts.

Besedo has headquarters in Stockholm (Sweden) and employs over 400 employees in 6 offices in different continents. Implio is our all-in-one SaaS moderation platform that combines state-of-the-art AI (deep learning, NLP, computer vision) with a powerful user interface for human moderation and statistics. The result is an easy-to-use content moderation solution that leads classified, dating and sharing economy sites from all around the world to love and trust.

Learn more about Implio in this video, and about Besedo on our website.

Come and make the internet better and safer with us!

Job Description

Are you an experienced MLOps looking for a new challenge and opportunity to learn in a great working environment? If you are a highly-motivated individual with a passion for large SaaS applications and AI at scale, we have the perfect job for you!

About This Position

We also offer a flexible work arrangement that accommodates a hybrid schedule, allowing you to balance your time effectively between home and our office. You will work with a team of talented Machine Learning Engineer DevOps and Developer who are passionate about their work and like to have fun in the

process.

Your mission

Role

As an MLOps Engineer and a member of the Data Science team, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our machine learning lifecycle. You will be engaged in an array of daily tasks that involve:

Collaborating with Data Scientists to convert experimental models into scalable production services, adopting practices such as A/B testing, Canary releases, and moreEnsuring seamless and automated deployment of models using CI/CD pipelinesImplementing monitoring solutions for models' performance, and designing fallback plans for retraining and redeploymentStrategically managing resources (computational power and storage) to balance the performance of models, systems, and pipelines with costeffectiveness and efficiencyDesigning, building, and maintaining Machine Learning (ML) pipelines to facilitate ML workflows, from data acquisition and processing to model deployment and monitoringImplementing robust data validation strategies and methodologies to ensure data quality and reliability in ML models Staying updated with recent advances in MLOps, and identifying and implementing new technologies that can improve and optimize our machine learning system

You will be working in close collaboration with stakeholders: Data Scientists, DevOps, Front-end/Back-end Developers and Product Owner, to come up with the very best solutions.

What it‚Äôs like working with us?

At Besedo, we all come from different cultures and backgrounds, but we share a common set of values:

We like to get things done ‚úîÔ∏èWe support each other to reach our goals and grow as professionals ü§ùWe love to learn, share and have fun together üéâWe strive to offer a great work environment:üè†Work from home friendly (office space is also available in Paris)üíª Choice of laptop and desk setupüçè Great health insurance and benefits

Preferred Experience

‚úÖ We are looking for someone having worked for 3+ years or more as an MLOps, Engineer or in a related field and who has the following experience and skills:

Proficiency in Python, and a strong understanding of Machine Learning libraries and frameworks such as PyTorch (preferred)Demonstrable experience with data structures, algorithms, and software designHands-on experience with building, deploying, and maintaining machine learning models in a production environmentPractical knowledge of containerization technologies (Docker) and orchestration systems (Kubernetes)Familiarity with CI/CD tools and version control systems (Git)

‚úÖ As a Person, You Are

Passionate about solving problems in an elegant and principled mannerEnthusiast about team work, learning and teachingDetail-oriented, outgoing and a good communicatorFluent in English (French is not mandatory)

üéØ Extra Points If You Have Experience With

Proficiency in Distributed Computing on different environments and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure)Experience with Workflow Orchestration tools, such as Prefect or Airflow

description.text:
RemotePermanent or Full-time ContractorCompetitive package

About Us

ClickOut Media is not just a company - it's a thriving ecosystem of diverse talent from around the globe. As a proudly remote-first organisation, we've cultivated an environment where creativity flourishes, collaboration is core, and innovation knows no bounds. With over +850 team members and more than 200 assets, our startup culture fuels our growth, making us a leading force in multi-channel marketing. We specialise in delivering best-in-class SEO & Content solutions to esteemed clients worldwide.

What Makes Us Different

At ClickOut Media, we thrive in the most competitive search verticals, operate across every major language, and conquer platforms you've probably never even heard of. Our dynamic approach, combined with our fast-paced environment, sets us apart in the industry. We're not just here to meet expectations; we're here to exceed them, every single time. Our relentless pursuit of excellence has been the cornerstone of our continuous success.

Job Description

We're looking for a talented and detail-oriented SEO Content Editor to join our growing team of gambling content specialists. You'll play a key role in shaping and optimising content across English-language gambling projects, including but not limited to those covering casinos, sports betting, esports, and crypto betting.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with freelancers and internal teams (including Editors, SEO, Design, Product, and Affiliation) to publish high-quality, SEO-optimized, and user-focused content that aligns with brand and business goals.Edit and optimize content for search intent, readability, and SEO best practices - including title tags, internal linking, metadata, alt text, and imagery.Audit existing content to identify outdated articles, content gaps, and new opportunities to improve authority and rankings.Regularly update and enhance existing articles to maintain accuracy, freshness, and SEO performance.Commission, brief, and manage content creation from both staff and freelance writers using keyword research, search trends, and competitor analysis.Contribute to ongoing content strategy by identifying trending topics and new keyword opportunities to grow organic traffic.Support the Head of Content with content planning, publishing workflows, and managing the editorial calendar to ensure timely delivery.Stay informed on the latest SEO developments, gambling industry news, and content best practices - using insights to enhance the quality and relevance of published content.Collaborate closely with the wider content and SEO team to maintain consistency, voice, and quality across all published material.

Qualifications

Fluent in the English language, with excellent grammar, spelling, and punctuation skills.Proven experience as an Editor, Content Manager, or similar role within the iGaming industry - ideally with exposure to esports, casinos, and affiliate content.Good to intermediate understanding of SEO, including keyword research, on-page optimization, and familiarity with tools like Ahrefs, Semrush, or similar.Comfortable using WordPress to upload, edit, and publish content.Solid understanding of online gambling terminology, products, player intent, and current industry trends.Strong attention to detail and a high standard for content accuracy, formatting, and SEO compliance.Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.Effective communication and collaboration skills, working well across teams (e.g., writers, SEO, design, and product).A genuine interest in online gambling, esports, and betting ‚Äî and a desire to stay informed on market developments.Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to contribute ideas and improve workflows and content strategy.Strong problem-solving skills in fast-paced and changing editorial environments.

Preferred Qualifications

Ability to QA and refine AI-generated content while ensuring compliance with quality and tone.Understanding of plagiarism and originality tools (e.g., Copyscape, Grammarly, Originality.ai).Familiarity with crypto betting, blockchain gambling platforms, or Web3 technologies.Working knowledge of Google Search Console, Google Analytics, or similar performance tracking tools.Familiarity with brief templates and systems to streamline and standardize large-scale content production.Understanding of odds formats, betting systems, and user personas within betting ecosystems.

Benefits & Rewards

A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shineAn entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)Build an organization that continues to diversify its portfolioPersonal responsibility with a ton of autonomy33 free paid daysMarket-leading remunerationAn international team with over 35 nationalitiesFully Remote working (work fully remotely and option for weekly coworker space)Additional benefits for permanent employees are available depending on the location

What do we mean by "Fully Remote"

Clickout Media offers you an unparalleled working experience. We are registered in Malta, but you don't have to be. Wherever you are based, and whether you are employed, operate B2B, or are a career freelancer, we will always find a way to work with great people.

Engaging with a worldwide workforce, ClickOut Media brings together world-leading experts in the fields of Tech, SEO, Content, and Product. Our remote approach gives absolute flexibility to our people and exemplifies our philosophy of autonomy and trust.

Diversity is a given to us, and this unique approach allows us to deliver and have respect for the wide variety of people, experiences, and cultures we bring together.

Our Recruitment Process Is As Follows

ApplyHave an introduction call with our recruitment teamDo a testHave a technical interview

Equal Opportunities

ClickOut Media is an equal-opportunity employer welcoming applicants from all backgrounds.

description.text:
Job Highlights:Contract: Independent ContractorSchedule: Between 9:00 am to 4:00 pm, Ambler, PA, USA, Eastern Time
Job Overview:We are looking for a part-time virtual assistant to help modernize and maintain our existing website. This role will initially require monthly updates to keep our site fresh, functional, and aligned with industry trends. After an initial period, the update frequency will shift to a quarterly schedule while still ensuring our website remains visually appealing and optimized for performance.
Responsibilities:Website Modernization: Implement updates to enhance the look, feel, and user experience of our site, including layout improvements, updated visuals, and mobile responsiveness.Content Updates: Modify website content as needed to reflect the latest company offerings, partnerships, and industry trends.SEO Optimization: Perform quarterly SEO audits and updates to improve search rankings and ensure our website remains competitive in organic search results.Performance Monitoring: Identify and resolve technical issues affecting site speed, navigation, and overall functionality.Collaboration: Work closely with our team to ensure updates align with our branding and business objectives.
RequirementsThis is a part-time, remote position, with working hoursProficiency in website design and maintenance (WordPress, HTML, CSS, or relevant CMS platforms).Strong understanding of SEO best practices and tools like Google Analytics, SEMrush, or Yoast.Experience in UX/UI enhancements to improve visitor engagement.Detail-oriented with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.Prior experience in the parking technology or related industries is a plus but not required.
BenefitsIndependent Contractor Perks:Permanent work from homeImmediate hiringSteady freelance job
Please note that since this is a permanent work-from-home position and an ‚ÄúIndependent Contractor‚Äù arrangement, the candidates must have their own computer and internet connection. They will handle their own benefits and taxes. The professional fees are on hourly rates and the rate depends on your performance in the application process.
ZR_26635_JOB

description.text:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

We're seeking a data science leader for our Discovery, Pricing and Negotiation (Offer Management) domains. This role will focus on guiding teams to leverage AI, Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Data Engineering to provide our buyers and sellers with a great experience.

About The Role

Key ResponsibilitiesStrategic Vision & Implementation: Define and execute the technical strategy for Discovery and Offer Management. Lead multiple engineering teams (backend, frontend, data science) within the Discovery and Offer Management organization(s)Drive architectural decisions for scalable, high-performance systemsEstablish engineering excellence standards, processes, and best practicesLead AI initiatives to enhance functionalities beyond well established ecommerce patterns and approaches Address unique data challenges of customer-generated content in a C2C marketplaceCreate data acquisition flywheels by incentivizing customer engagementTeam LeadershipEstablish strong relationships with direct reports and commercial stakeholdersMentor team members and lead by example through excellent communicationCollaborate with other VPs and C-level executives on company-wide initiativesRepresent engineering perspective in strategic business decisionsDrive alignment between engineering execution and business objectivesTechnical InnovationImplement advanced AI solutions including image recognition and conversational commerceEnsure system reliability, scalability, and performance at global scaleAddress data sparseness challenges specific to C2C platformsDrive innovation in discovery and offer management domains 



Who You Are

Leadership Experience8+ years of engineering leadership experience, including 3+ years at VP/Director levelProven track record building and scaling engineering organizations (20+ engineers)Experience managing multiple teams and engineering managersDemonstrated success in high-growth, fast-paced environmentsProven track record implementing AI-driven search and discovery solutions or Strong AI/ML background with demonstrated ability to innovate and adaptTechnical SkillsDeep expertise in AI/ML, particularly in search, recommendation systems, and computer visionExperience with image recognition technologiesUnderstanding of conversational commerce and natural language processingExperience with modern cloud infrastructure and microservices architecturePlatform or marketplace experience strongly preferredLeadership & CommunicationExceptional communication skills - ability to explain complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholdersProven experience building and scaling technical teamsStrong stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration skillsExperience in fast-paced, high-growth environmentsIndustry BackgroundE-commerce or marketplace platform experience preferredUnderstanding of C2C business models and associated data challengesExperience with customer-generated content and data quality challengesProven ability to balance technical excellence with business prioritiesExperience with global, multi-market product development



What we offer üéÅ

A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalities

Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

Significant investment in your learning and growth

Competitive Compensation And Benefits Package
As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

Research indicates that people from underrepresented backgrounds‚Äîincluding women, people with disabilities, and other marginalized communities‚Äîoften hesitate to apply for roles unless they meet every single requirement.

At Vestiaire Collective, we believe that talent comes in many forms, and we're committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. Your unique perspective could be exactly what our team needs, so we encourage you to apply even if you don't tick every box.

Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employer 
Beware of Scams
Vestiaire Collective only contacts candidates via official emails ending in @vestiairecollective.com or no-reply@hire.lever.co . We never use WhatsApp, Telegram, or similar apps for job offers, nor will we ever request payments or banking details.

If you receive a suspicious message, please report it to talentacquisition@vestiairecollective.com

description.text:
About Eneba
At Eneba, we‚Äôre building an open, safe and sustainable marketplace for the gamers of today and tomorrow. Our marketplace supports close to 20m+ active users (and growing fast!), provides a level of trust, safety and market accessibility unparalleled to none. We‚Äôre proud of what we‚Äôve accomplished in such a short time and look forward to sharing this journey with you. Join us as we continue to scale, diversify our portfolio, and grow with the evolving community of gamers.
About the Role
We‚Äôre hiring a Head of Performance Marketing to lead our user acquisition efforts and help drive Eneba‚Äôs next stage of growth. Today, performance marketing is managed by several teams reporting directly to the co-founder. You‚Äôll step in to lead, organize, and scale these teams‚Äîstarting with influencer marketing and Google Ads, with the potential to expand your scope over time. This is a hands-on and strategic role where you‚Äôll drive meaningful growth through paid media and influencer partnerships, combining data-driven optimization with creative marketing tactics. You‚Äôll be managing significant marketing budgets and helping Eneba scale its reach in a competitive, fast-growing gaming marketplace.
About the Team
You‚Äôll report directly our Co-founder and CMO and work closely with:
- Influencer Marketing and Paid Media teams (initially direct reports)- SEO, Affiliates, Social Media, and Content teams (collaborative partners, possible future reports)- Data & Analytics teams (for real-time performance tracking and experimentation)
Responsibilities
Own and lead Eneba‚Äôs influencer strategy and paid media performance across key global markets.Manage large-scale marketing budgets efficiently, optimizing for spend vs. payback ratios.Scale the influencer marketing function, both strategically and operationally, across YouTube, Twitch, TikTok, and other platforms.Lead and develop the Paid Search team (Google Ads), driving efficient user acquisition at scale.Drive a data-led, experimental growth approach, constantly iterating on campaigns and creative tactics.Partner cross-functionally with Product, Analytics, Creative, and Content teams to align marketing and business goals.Develop creative, hackish strategies tailored to a low LTV product, optimizing across acquisition channels.Mentor and grow a high-performing marketing team, eventually expanding your leadership scope.
Must-have Requirements
Experience in B2C (eCommerce, D2C, SaaS) companies managing significant paid media budgets and driving strong year-over-year growth.Strong influencer marketing leadership experience (minimum 2+ years), managing large budgets and long-term partnerships.Good understanding of Google Ads performance optimization, even if not hands-on daily.Proven people manager, leading and motivating multi-functional teams.Highly data-driven, with a creative growth mindset and a track record of building scalable user acquisition strategies.Comfortable working in fast-growth, high-pressure environments; self-driven and hungry to prove success.
Nice-to-have Requirements
Experience with affiliate marketing, SEO, PR, and social media growth tactics.Exposure to international growth, ideally in English-speaking markets like the US, UK, or Australia.Hands-on experience working with low LTV digital goods or gaming marketplaces.
What's in it for you?
Full ownership of performance marketing in a high-budget environment, with the autonomy to shape teams and strategy.The opportunity to scale one of Europe‚Äôs top gaming marketplaces and drive millions in revenue growth.Work across multiple products (digital goods marketplace and play-to-earn projects).A dynamic and fast-paced growth culture where your leadership makes an immediate impact.
What it‚Äôs like to work at Eneba
*Opportunity to join our Employee Stock Options program.*Opportunity to help scale a unique product.*Various bonus systems: performance-based, referral, additional paid leave, personal learning budget.*Paid volunteering opportunities.*Work location of your choice: office, remote, opportunity to work and travel.*Personal and professional growth at an exponential rate supported by well-defined feedback and promotion processes.
*Please attach CV's in English.*To find out about how we handle your personal data, make sure to check out our Candidate Privacy Notice https://www.eneba.com/candidate-privacy-notice

jobs.description:
About Eneba
At Eneba, we‚Äôre building an open, safe and sustainable marketplace for the gamers of today and tomorrow. Our marketplace supports close to 20m+ active users (and growing fast!), provides a level of trust, safety and market accessibility unparalleled to none. We‚Äôre proud of what we‚Äôve accomplished in such a short time and look forward to sharing this journey with you. Join us as we continue to scale, diversify our portfolio, and grow with the evolving community of gamers.
About the Role
We‚Äôre hiring a Head of Performance Marketing to lead our user acquisition efforts and help drive Eneba‚Äôs next stage of growth. Today, performance marketing is managed by several teams reporting directly to the co-founder. You‚Äôll step in to lead, organize, and scale these teams‚Äîstarting with influencer marketing and Google Ads, with the potential to expand your scope over time. This is a hands-on and strategic role where you‚Äôll drive meaningful growth through paid media and influencer partnerships, combining data-driven optimization with creative marketing tactics. You‚Äôll be managing significant marketing budgets and helping Eneba scale its reach in a competitive, fast-growing gaming marketplace.
About the Team
You‚Äôll report directly our Co-founder and CMO and work closely with:
- Influencer Marketing and Paid Media teams (initially direct reports)- SEO, Affiliates, Social Media, and Content teams (collaborative partners, possible future reports)- Data & Analytics teams (for real-time performance tracking and experimentation)
Responsibilities
Own and lead Eneba‚Äôs influencer strategy and paid media performance across key global markets.Manage large-scale marketing budgets efficiently, optimizing for spend vs. payback ratios.Scale the influencer marketing function, both strategically and operationally, across YouTube, Twitch, TikTok, and other platforms.Lead and develop the Paid Search team (Google Ads), driving efficient user acquisition at scale.Drive a data-led, experimental growth approach, constantly iterating on campaigns and creative tactics.Partner cross-functionally with Product, Analytics, Creative, and Content teams to align marketing and business goals.Develop creative, hackish strategies tailored to a low LTV product, optimizing across acquisition channels.Mentor and grow a high-performing marketing team, eventually expanding your leadership scope.
Must-have Requirements
Experience in B2C (eCommerce, D2C, SaaS) companies managing significant paid media budgets and driving strong year-over-year growth.Strong influencer marketing leadership experience (minimum 2+ years), managing large budgets and long-term partnerships.Good understanding of Google Ads performance optimization, even if not hands-on daily.Proven people manager, leading and motivating multi-functional teams.Highly data-driven, with a creative growth mindset and a track record of building scalable user acquisition strategies.Comfortable working in fast-growth, high-pressure environments; self-driven and hungry to prove success.
Nice-to-have Requirements
Experience with affiliate marketing, SEO, PR, and social media growth tactics.Exposure to international growth, ideally in English-speaking markets like the US, UK, or Australia.Hands-on experience working with low LTV digital goods or gaming marketplaces.
What's in it for you?
Full ownership of performance marketing in a high-budget environment, with the autonomy to shape teams and strategy.The opportunity to scale one of Europe‚Äôs top gaming marketplaces and drive millions in revenue growth.Work across multiple products (digital goods marketplace and play-to-earn projects).A dynamic and fast-paced growth culture where your leadership makes an immediate impact.
What it‚Äôs like to work at Eneba
*Opportunity to join our Employee Stock Options program.*Opportunity to help scale a unique product.*Various bonus systems: performance-based, referral, additional paid leave, personal learning budget.*Paid volunteering opportunities.*Work location of your choice: office, remote, opportunity to work and travel.*Personal and professional growth at an exponential rate supported by well-defined feedback and promotion processes.
*Please attach CV's in English.*To find out about how we handle your personal data, make sure to check out our Candidate Privacy Notice https://www.eneba.com/candidate-privacy-notice

description.text:
About the Company:eTraining Inc. is a forward-thinking eLearning company dedicated to delivering high-impact workplace safety training and certification programs. With over 14 years of experience, we help mid-to-large companies elevate their safety standards through engaging, effective online education. We operate as a fully remote team and take pride in our open, collaborative, and no-micromanagement culture, where motivated professionals are trusted to take ownership and drive results.
About the Role:We are seeking a highly motivated, experienced  E-learning Head of Growth with a strong background in lead generation and funnel optimization. This role is key to driving qualified leads, increasing brand visibility, and supporting course sales through multi-channel marketing efforts. The ideal candidate will thrive in a remote, entrepreneurial environment and excel at building scalable systems, collaborating cross-functionally, and using data to inform strategy.This is a Full-Time remote position.

We are looking for an E-learning Head of Growth specifically with these requirements:Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.3-5+ years of B2B marketing experience, ideally in eLearning, online training, or course-based businesses.Proven success in generating qualified leads and driving course/program sales.Expertise in building and optimizing full marketing funnels (lead magnets, landing pages, email flows).Proficiency with ABM (Account-Based Marketing) and multi-channel outreach.Strong copywriting skills for landing pages, email sequences, and conversion-focused content.Skilled in content strategy - including content calendars, blogs, LinkedIn, webinars, and SME-driven content.Hands-on experience with HubSpot Marketing Hub, Klaviyo, Google Analytics, LinkedIn, and SEO best practices.Familiarity with light website editing, CMS updates, and A/B testing tools.Comfortable analyzing and reporting on key marketing KPIs, campaign performance, and lead quality.A plus: experience using AI tools for content creation, SEO, or funnel optimization.Strong project management skills; able to take initiatives from strategy to execution with minimal oversight.Bonus: industry knowledge in safety training or certification.

Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):Own and manage the marketing funnel, developing lead magnets, landing pages, and email flows to attract and convert high-quality leads.Manage or directly execute paid media buying, and evaluate media buyers to ensure ROI-positive ad spend.Identify and recruit Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to collaborate on authority-building content like blogs, webinars, and podcasts.Research and identify where our ICPs (VPs of Safety at mid-to-large companies) spend time online, and ensure our presence in those spaces.Take ownership of the marketing technology stack (HubSpot, Klaviyo, Google Analytics, etc.), ensuring smooth integration and accurate lead tracking.Lead conversion rate optimization efforts on key landing pages, crafting compelling copy, running A/B tests, and improving funnel performance.Regularly meet with sales and operations stakeholders to align on campaigns, monitor lead quality, and support course launch initiatives.Act as a strategic liaison between sales and operations to ensure marketing aligns with business needs and supports growth.Gather market feedback to inform campaign strategy and help shape new course development.
Growth Opportunities/Perks:Be the first dedicated marketer in a well-established, 14-year-old company - with full ownership over the marketing function.Huge potential for growth in title, compensation, and bonus opportunities as the business scales.Work in a collaborative, remote-first culture that values independence, trust, and results.Paid training and 3+ weeks of vacation annually.Covered travel expenses for company-related events or meetings.Flexibility in how you work - as long as you're driving results, you‚Äôll have room to manage your own schedule.The chance to make a real impact and grow alongside a company investing heavily in marketing for the first time.
This Position Is Perfect For You If‚Ä¶
You‚Äôre resourceful and solutions-oriented.You love figuring things out, whether it‚Äôs optimizing a funnel, troubleshooting tech issues, or navigating new tools and strategies.
You communicate clearly and collaborate with ease.You‚Äôre confident working cross-functionally with sales and operations, and you keep the team aligned through thoughtful communication.
You‚Äôre driven by results and always looking to improve.You focus on outcomes, not just activity. You seek feedback, analyze performance, and continuously test and iterate to drive better results.
You‚Äôre highly independent and can self-manage.You‚Äôre comfortable owning your role from end to end, managing your time, and consistently delivering without micromanagement.Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.
Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

description.text:
The Company
TaskHuman is organizing the world‚Äôs human expertise, making coaching in 1000+ skills instantly accessible to you in a multitude of forms. Whether you connect live with a specialist on a 1:1 video call, message directly in-app, join a group session, or learn via coach-generated content, our value of human connection is the foundation of every interaction at TaskHuman.
The Opportunity
We‚Äôre looking for a hands-on, technically fluent Growth Marketer to drive rapid experimentation and growth loop execution to scale our acquisition and engagement programs. You will be instrumental in executing our growth strategy launching high-impact growth initiatives with speed and autonomy.This is a role for someone who loves to ship, test, and refine. In our B2B2C environment, your user activation and engagement work directly drives client success, making every conversion and retention win doubly important.
Responsibilities:
Design, implement, and optimize lifecycle-based growth programs across user onboarding, activation, re-engagement, and retention.Launch and scale growth loops and automated campaigns, using event-based triggers and conditional logic.Own the execution and iteration of experiment-driven campaigns, partnering with Product, Analytics and Data Science to rapidly test hypotheses and analyze funnel performance.Partner closely with BI/Analytics team to define success metrics, interpret campaign performance data, and translate insights into actionable optimizations for future campaigns.Operate and manage the marketing tech stack including Iterable, to support fast, self-serve execution across journeys and nudges.Collaborate with engineering and data teams to integrate rich custom event payloads into user workflows, enabling highly personalized, metadata-driven messaging experiences.Maintain execution velocity by owning backlog delivery of growth marketing experiments, ensuring rapid test cycles and continuous campaign optimization.Partner with internal teams including Product, Design, Customer Success, and Coaching Experiences to ensure aligned messaging, go-to-market enablement, and thematic consistency across touchpoints.Guide the structure and QA of AI-generated content for use in dynamic emails and in-product experiences.
Requirements:
3-6+ years experience in growth marketing, lifecycle marketing, or CRM/automation roles, preferably in a startup or fast-paced growth environment.Strong technical fluency with tools and systems like Iterable (or Braze), and event-driven trigger frameworks.Deep experience executing event-based lifecycle automations using custom user properties, branching logic, and dynamic content blocks.Familiarity with working inside JSON-based data structures for dynamic & personalized messaging.Track record of executing growth experiments and interpreting performance through funnel, cohort, and lifecycle metrics.Highly autonomous and self-directed, able to move quickly and make tradeoffs in ambiguous or fast-changing environments.Strong communicator and collaborator across technical and non-technical teams.Experience and appetite for working in a fast-paced technology and innovation environment are highly preferred.Genuine interest in the mission of TaskHuman and being a part of something bigger than any one person or business group.Experience operating in a B2C, B2B2C, or marketplace product environment
TaskHuman provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

description.text:
Headquartered in Silicon Valley, we are a newly established start-up, where a collective of visionary scientists, engineers, and entrepreneurs are dedicated to transforming the landscape of biology and medicine through the power of Generative AI. Our team comprises leading minds and innovators in AI and Biological Science, pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We are dreamers who reimagine a new paradigm for biology and medicine.

GenBio AI is building the AI-Driven Digital Organism (AIDO) and the AIDO Virtual Lab, a platform where researchers can design, perturb, and observe biological systems entirely in silico using biological foundation models. We are looking for a Research Engineer specializing in LLMs and generative models to help us prototype, train, and productionize the AI components that power AIDO and the AIDO Virtual Lab. You‚Äôll work at the intersection of biology, machine learning, and user-facing tools, building core capabilities for autonomous agents, multimodal simulation, and model finetuning.

Key Responsibility

Build, refine, productionize, and serve generative models and workflows for biological simulation and experiment orchestrationWork at the intersection of science, product, and engineering to identify problems, implement solutions, and measure their impact on AIDODevelop APIs and pipelines for model serving, distillation, and tool integration with AIDO‚Äôs foundation modelsDesign, implement, and evaluate LLM-based agents to collaborate with users and other agents to plan virtual experiments, run studies, and synthesize knowledgeSupport on-demand finetuning and model adaptation of foundation models with specialized datasetsWork at the intersection of science, product, and engineering to prototype end-to-end research workflows and the tools to support themContribute to system robustness by improving uncertainty quantification, observability, and traceability in generative workflowsMaintain close attention to efficiency and scalability of models to ensure simulations are cheap, fast, and reproducibleAutomate everything



Qualifications

Ph.D. or equivalent practical experience in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Experience in life sciences or healthcare is a plus2+ years of experience developing, deploying, and evaluating LLMs or generative models (transformers, diffusion models, VAEs, autoregressive architectures, etc.)Proficiency with major deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch, HuggingFace Transformers & Accelerate, or Megatron-LM/DeepSpeedStrong programming skills in Python, and modern web development frameworks, and familiarity with GPU-accelerated tools (e.g., CUDA, cuDNN, Triton)Familiarity with resource management and scheduling systems (e.g., SLURM, Kubernetes) and associated automation frameworks (e.g. Kubeflow, Argo Workflows, Apache Airflow, Metaflow)Ability to work in a fast-moving research environment, balancing rigor with rapid prototypingProficiency in back-end frameworks like Django, Flask, or Node.js, and database technologies (e.g., PostgreSQL, MongoDB)Expertise in cloud computing (GCP, AWS)Familiarity with version control systems like Git and CI/CD pipelines. 



Preferred Qualifications

Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Experience in life sciences or healthcare is a plusExposure to distributed training, model distillation, and serving infrastructure.Experience with multimodal or multiscale modeling (text, sequence, structure, image)Familiarity with biological data modalities (DNA, RNA, protein, cell imaging), associated bioinformatics tools, and their unique challengesHands-on experience with agentic systems (LangChain, AutoGPT, custom planner-executor loops)Strong understanding of RESTful APIs, authentication, and deployment pipelinesStrong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate across research, engineering, and product teamsInterest in building tools that democratize access to biology and empower both expert researchers and newcomers



Join us as we embark on this journey to redefine the future of biology and medicine.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

description.text:
Position Title: Manager of Business Development RepresentativesLocation: EMEAEmployment Type: Full-TimeOnsite, Remote/Flexible, or Hybrid: Remote/FlexibleDepartment: MarketingHiring Manager: VP Demand Generation & Revenue MarketingTravel: Minimal (Up to 5%)
COMPANY SUMMARY:
Here at Aprimo, our mission is to empower the marketing organizations of today to build the brands of tomorrow. Aprimo is a pioneer of the marketing resource and digital asset management space, and we deliver an innovative, industry-leading SaaS solution that changes the way companies like Affinity Petcare, Nomad Foods, Laborie, and Pret A Manger work, create, collaborate, and learn in order to deliver exceptional brand experiences at scale.
Aprimo helps enterprises unleash the power of their content by providing a marketing automation software and digital asset management software that manages the behind-the-scenes activities involved in marketing. Our product allows companies to manage content planning, creation and distribution all in one place, store content and media in a shared repository, and receive in-depth insights into how content performs.
Founded in 1998, Aprimo has five offices internationally, including Chicago headquarters, and offers a flexible work-from-home/remote-work policy.
Named a Leader in Digital Asset Management (DAM) and Marketing Resource Management by Gartner and Forrester in 2025 and winner of the 2021 Tech Cares Award for our work with Aprimo HELPS, we build on the power of our people to make an impact both in our industry and in our communities.

POSITION SUMMARY:
We are seeking a Manager of EMEA Business Development Representatives (BDR) to join our team and drive the success of our outbound BDR efforts. This is a first-line management role, not a manager-of-managers position, making it perfect for a hands-on leader eager to roll up their sleeves and make an impact.

WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
Manage & Lead BDR Team: Oversee and motivate a high-performing outbound BDR team, setting clear goals and benchmarks for success.Player-Coach Leadership: Lead by example by demonstrating best practices in prospecting, cold calling, and account engagement.Develop & Execute BDR Playbooks: Create, refine, and implement playbooks and strategies that drive consistent results and pipeline growth.Coach & Mentor: Provide individualized coaching and mentorship to help BDRs improve their skills in communication, prospecting, and closing qualified opportunities.Hands-On Engagement: Actively participate in team activities, from shadowing calls to refining messaging, ensuring alignment with overall sales and marketing strategies.Analytics & Performance: Leverage tools like Salesforce, Salesloft, Chorus, Cognism, Zoominfo, and other martech solutions to track performance metrics, analyze results, and identify areas for improvement.Collaboration: Partner closely with sales and marketing leadership to align goals, share insights, and optimize the lead-to-opportunity process.Additional responsibilities and duties as required

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS & WHY YOU‚ÄôRE A GREAT FIT FOR THE ROLE:
Proven Leadership: A minimum of 3 years of experience directly leading a BDR team, with demonstrated success in managing a high-performing outbound teamSaaS experience: Prior experience in a SaaS environment is required, ideally within a B2B MarTech or Digital Asset Management companyExpertise in Tools & Processes: Advanced knowledge of Salesforce, Zoominfo, LInkedIn Sales Nav, Salesloft, Cognism, Chorus (or similar tools), and BDR workflows are required.Sales Skills: Exceptional phone, communication, and sales abilities to drive prospecting success are required.Player-Coach Mentality: Ability to model success, working alongside the team to inspire performance is required.BDR Playbook Development: Experience designing and refining effective playbooks and prospecting strategies is required.Data-Driven Approach: Skilled in analyzing metrics, identifying trends, and implementing improvements based on data.Coaching & Mentoring: Proven ability to develop team members‚Äô skills and foster a collaborative, high-energy environment. Ability to do call-coaching is critical to this role.Fluency in English, both written and spoken.

APRIMO CULTURE & WHY YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE WORKING HERE:
Aprimo offers a forward-thinking, progressive and employee-first culture that is based in both collaboration and flexibility with team members who are friendly, intelligent and enthusiastic people that are committed to the product and mission here at Aprimo.With 5 offices worldwide and teams spread throughout the US, EMEA and Philippines, our multicultural teams work cross-departmentally and across continents and cultures towards a shared goal.We offer a diverse environment that promotes DEI efforts, values multiple perspectives and fresh thinking and which includes Aprimo HELPS, an employee resource group (ERG) that is dedicated to giving back to our local communitiesThrough its relaxed environment, Aprimo embodies a more casual ‚ÄúSilicon Valley‚Äù atmosphere.We have a casual dress code that allows employees to express themselves as individuals and which fosters a creative and free-thinking approach to problem solving and business solutions. And it also allows us to wear hoodies and shorts during internal meetings.Flexible work schedules and all positions allowing for either entirely remote or hybrid working arrangements create a deeply rewarding work-life balance.With flexible work schedules, employees can attend to personal matters, such as stepping away to pick up their children from school or to get a much-needed haircut.In a recent internal survey, 89% of staff cited work-life balance as being one of the most rewarding aspects of working at Aprimo!Part of the key to our success is that team members are not only successful at collaboration and open communication, but that they are also given a great deal of autonomy and freedom in their own individual roles.Our culture is not a micro-managing environment ‚Äì rather, employees are encouraged to be self-starters, to voice new ideas, and to exercise ownership in their individual roles.As such, individual team members can leave a lasting impact and footprint within the organization ‚Äì in fact, our average employee tenure is 7.7 years.Aprimo employs a ‚Äúchoose your own adventure‚Äù approach to career advancement.Staff members are not siloed into roles and for many of our teams there is no set ladder that one needs to climb to achieve growth and promotion.Rather, we emphasize an organic approach to career development in which employees can and do frequently transition into newly created roles within their own teams or transition into other departments based on their interests in exploring new skills and responsibilities.For additional learning and development, we recently rolled out Udemy, which is an online learning platform that employees have access to and which features over 200,000 courses on a wide variety of business topics.Ranked #1 in AI Metadata & Search by Forrester, Aprimo sits on the cutting-edge of technology and is paving new paths forward by incorporating AI (artificial intelligence) into our product offerings.We offer generative AI in a secure environment built for brand safety and governance. Our AI-powered content operations platform, with industry leading digital asset management (DAM) software at its core, helps to optimize the creative process and improve the user experience with better search, recommendations, categorization and summarization.Our AI empowers marketing teams to automate tasks, analyze data, and personalize content, ensuring scalability without sacrificing productivity.AI automatically identifies asset characteristics and transforms them into words a human would search for. Translation, image alterations, personalization, and more are all streamlined by AI.With our platform, marketers can efficiently produce a larger volume of content, engage customers on a personalized level, curate relevant materials, and make data-driven decisions to drive their content strategies forward.Our AI offers up to 72% increase in discoverability and productivity, up to 61% reduction in production time, and up to 66% faster time to market.

APRIMO BENEFITS WE OFFER:
Target Compensation: On-Target Earning ranging from GBP or Euro equivalent of $130,000 - $175,000 USD depending on job related knowledge, skills, and level of experience. This is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, or other law.Competitive benefits coverage that begins on the first day of employment

jobs.description:
Position Title: Manager of Business Development RepresentativesLocation: EMEAEmployment Type: Full-TimeOnsite, Remote/Flexible, or Hybrid: Remote/FlexibleDepartment: MarketingHiring Manager: VP Demand Generation & Revenue MarketingTravel: Minimal (Up to 5%)
COMPANY SUMMARY:
Here at Aprimo, our mission is to empower the marketing organizations of today to build the brands of tomorrow. Aprimo is a pioneer of the marketing resource and digital asset management space, and we deliver an innovative, industry-leading SaaS solution that changes the way companies like Affinity Petcare, Nomad Foods, Laborie, and Pret A Manger work, create, collaborate, and learn in order to deliver exceptional brand experiences at scale.
Aprimo helps enterprises unleash the power of their content by providing a marketing automation software and digital asset management software that manages the behind-the-scenes activities involved in marketing. Our product allows companies to manage content planning, creation and distribution all in one place, store content and media in a shared repository, and receive in-depth insights into how content performs.
Founded in 1998, Aprimo has five offices internationally, including Chicago headquarters, and offers a flexible work-from-home/remote-work policy.
Named a Leader in Digital Asset Management (DAM) and Marketing Resource Management by Gartner and Forrester in 2025 and winner of the 2021 Tech Cares Award for our work with Aprimo HELPS, we build on the power of our people to make an impact both in our industry and in our communities.

POSITION SUMMARY:
We are seeking a Manager of EMEA Business Development Representatives (BDR) to join our team and drive the success of our outbound BDR efforts. This is a first-line management role, not a manager-of-managers position, making it perfect for a hands-on leader eager to roll up their sleeves and make an impact.

WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
Manage & Lead BDR Team: Oversee and motivate a high-performing outbound BDR team, setting clear goals and benchmarks for success.Player-Coach Leadership: Lead by example by demonstrating best practices in prospecting, cold calling, and account engagement.Develop & Execute BDR Playbooks: Create, refine, and implement playbooks and strategies that drive consistent results and pipeline growth.Coach & Mentor: Provide individualized coaching and mentorship to help BDRs improve their skills in communication, prospecting, and closing qualified opportunities.Hands-On Engagement: Actively participate in team activities, from shadowing calls to refining messaging, ensuring alignment with overall sales and marketing strategies.Analytics & Performance: Leverage tools like Salesforce, Salesloft, Chorus, Cognism, Zoominfo, and other martech solutions to track performance metrics, analyze results, and identify areas for improvement.Collaboration: Partner closely with sales and marketing leadership to align goals, share insights, and optimize the lead-to-opportunity process.Additional responsibilities and duties as required

CANDIDATE QUALIFICATIONS & WHY YOU‚ÄôRE A GREAT FIT FOR THE ROLE:
Proven Leadership: A minimum of 3 years of experience directly leading a BDR team, with demonstrated success in managing a high-performing outbound teamSaaS experience: Prior experience in a SaaS environment is required, ideally within a B2B MarTech or Digital Asset Management companyExpertise in Tools & Processes: Advanced knowledge of Salesforce, Zoominfo, LInkedIn Sales Nav, Salesloft, Cognism, Chorus (or similar tools), and BDR workflows are required.Sales Skills: Exceptional phone, communication, and sales abilities to drive prospecting success are required.Player-Coach Mentality: Ability to model success, working alongside the team to inspire performance is required.BDR Playbook Development: Experience designing and refining effective playbooks and prospecting strategies is required.Data-Driven Approach: Skilled in analyzing metrics, identifying trends, and implementing improvements based on data.Coaching & Mentoring: Proven ability to develop team members‚Äô skills and foster a collaborative, high-energy environment. Ability to do call-coaching is critical to this role.Fluency in English, both written and spoken.

APRIMO CULTURE & WHY YOU‚ÄôLL LOVE WORKING HERE:
Aprimo offers a forward-thinking, progressive and employee-first culture that is based in both collaboration and flexibility with team members who are friendly, intelligent and enthusiastic people that are committed to the product and mission here at Aprimo.With 5 offices worldwide and teams spread throughout the US, EMEA and Philippines, our multicultural teams work cross-departmentally and across continents and cultures towards a shared goal.We offer a diverse environment that promotes DEI efforts, values multiple perspectives and fresh thinking and which includes Aprimo HELPS, an employee resource group (ERG) that is dedicated to giving back to our local communitiesThrough its relaxed environment, Aprimo embodies a more casual ‚ÄúSilicon Valley‚Äù atmosphere.We have a casual dress code that allows employees to express themselves as individuals and which fosters a creative and free-thinking approach to problem solving and business solutions. And it also allows us to wear hoodies and shorts during internal meetings.Flexible work schedules and all positions allowing for either entirely remote or hybrid working arrangements create a deeply rewarding work-life balance.With flexible work schedules, employees can attend to personal matters, such as stepping away to pick up their children from school or to get a much-needed haircut.In a recent internal survey, 89% of staff cited work-life balance as being one of the most rewarding aspects of working at Aprimo!Part of the key to our success is that team members are not only successful at collaboration and open communication, but that they are also given a great deal of autonomy and freedom in their own individual roles.Our culture is not a micro-managing environment ‚Äì rather, employees are encouraged to be self-starters, to voice new ideas, and to exercise ownership in their individual roles.As such, individual team members can leave a lasting impact and footprint within the organization ‚Äì in fact, our average employee tenure is 7.7 years.Aprimo employs a ‚Äúchoose your own adventure‚Äù approach to career advancement.Staff members are not siloed into roles and for many of our teams there is no set ladder that one needs to climb to achieve growth and promotion.Rather, we emphasize an organic approach to career development in which employees can and do frequently transition into newly created roles within their own teams or transition into other departments based on their interests in exploring new skills and responsibilities.For additional learning and development, we recently rolled out Udemy, which is an online learning platform that employees have access to and which features over 200,000 courses on a wide variety of business topics.Ranked #1 in generative AI in a secure environment built for brand safety and governance. description.text:
üíª Job Title: AI Leadü§ë Salary: up to ~‚Ç¨200k (flex for the right candidate)üìà Equity: up to 0.5% (valued at $625k)üìç Location: fully remote anywhere in Europe (quarterly team get togethers)üîê Company: Cyber Security SaaS start-up building AI agents to identify and resolve cloud vulnerabilitiesüë• Team: ~20 (aiming for 35+ by year end)üí∏ Funding: $30m+ Series A
Are you looking for the next big thing and want to work on novel products? üöÄ
üëâ If you‚Äôve led AI research, built prototypes that turned into products and want to architect the future of intelligent security, this could be your defining role at a well-funded start-up, operating at the intersection of AI and cybersecurity.
We‚Äôre searching for an AI leader to set the vision, shape the research agenda and turn cutting-edge ideas into real-world impact. Working closely with the CTO, you'll own the end-to-end AI strategy, drive innovation with LLMs and agent systems, guide a growing team of top talent and translate research into breakthrough product capabilities that protect organisations worldwide.
This role is for someone who thrives at combining deep technical expertise with strategic leadership, and is eager to define the standards of how AI transforms security.
ü´µ What you'll do:Define the AI vision: Develop and own the long-term strategy for applying machine learning and generative models to solve complex security problems.Turn research into products: Build prototypes of new techniques, validate them and work with engineering to transform them into customer-facing features.Establish evaluation standards: Design systems and benchmarks that measure the performance of LLMs, agents and AI-driven workflows in real-world security contexts.Raise the technical bar: Provide architectural guidance, review implementations, and ensure quality across all AI-related initiatives.Build and grow the team: Hire, mentor and lead AI talent, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.
‚úÖ Must have requirements:Deep LLM, NLP, GenAI and Agentic AI expertise - you must have hands-on experience with modern transformer architectures, autonomous agent systems, fine-tuning techniques, evaluations and agent frameworksA track record of guiding teams and shaping AI direction at leading research labs, major tech companies or fast-moving startups (think DeepMind, OpenAI, Anthropic, Microsoft, Google or similar)Ability to move quickly from research phase to working prototypes to scalable production systems.Experience applying AI research to practical business challenges and measuring success through user and market impact.Strong engineering foundation with a software development background (ideally in Python) and the ability to design, review and critique complex architectures.Security consciousness - understanding of vulnerability management
üëç Bonus points for:Cybersecurity domain knowledge or experience applying AI to security challengesAdvanced academic credentials (PhD or equivalent) with publications in respected conferences/journals.Familiarity with AI safety, benchmarking, and responsible deployment practices.

description.text:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Growth team helps maximize the potential of each Voodoo product within the ecosystem. Our Growth team is split into several job expertise such as user acquisition, ad monetization, video ads, playable ads, and influencer marketers. Being part of the Growth Team at Voodoo requires a lot of operational excellence and creativity in order to constantly adapt ourselves to stay ahead of the rest of the market.

Our core team mission in the Playable Ads team is to create engaging and interactive advertising experiences that captivate audiences and drive conversions. We work with playable developers and coordinators that turn a game into a HTML interactive ad experience. Your main mission will be to produce high-performing ads by creating and uploading them to our different networks.

Role

We are looking for talent interested in creating something bigger. To succeed in this role, you will need to have a good understanding of the casual mobile game market and mobile advertising, as well as the Playable Ads marketing. You will join a high-performing team and your goal will be to coordinate the creative production of playables with internal and external teams, improve performance and drive innovation.

Analyze performance of playables in order to have clear learnings to be further pushedBenchmark the market and networks to provide interesting findings for IdeationCreate Playables briefs, relying on performance and game feel experience; also provide art direction and assetsManage your own portfolio of games and E2E playables production and uploadTrack performance of playables and define strategies to keep improving itCollaborate with cross-functional teams (Product, User Acquisition, Video, Analytics, etc.) to ensure optimized ideation for production and playables strategy alignment among stakeholdersConstantly identify and propose improvement opportunities for the processes and for the playables development

Profile

You have at least 3 years of experience in the Creative Production segmentYou have exceptional project management skillsYou have strong ability to develop detailed playables briefsYou show strong interest and knowledge of the mobile apps industry and know how to benchmark and brainstorm innovative ideasYou have a good eye for design and is capable to articulate design decisionsYou have previous experience in a creative or art direction role working with third party providers. Technical background in playables is highly appreciatedYou have entrepreneurial mindset and can adapt to a high-paced environmentYou are fluent in English

Benefits

Competitive salary Premium healthcare (SideCare) for you and your family 100% borne by VoodooSwile Lunch voucherGymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)Wellness activities in our Paris officeUnlimited vacation policyRemote daysChild daycare facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouges)

description.text:
Company Overview

team.blue is the market leader in enabling digital success for small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) across Europe, catering to over 3 million customers in 25+ languages. Our mission is to make online business success simpler, by providing our customers with all the tools and resources they need to excel online and remain ahead of the curve.

Position Overview

We are looking for a highly skilled Applied AI Lead Engineer to technically lead our Applied AI Engineering team in the development of AI products across the team.blue group. The ideal candidate will be responsible for leveraging LLMs to build exceptional products and experiences. This role requires an applied engineering mindset, strong programming skills, and up-to-date knowledge of the latest AI developments.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and launch reliable and high-performing multimodal AI products and systems that integrate text, image, voice, and video Implement agentic AI systems using tools such as MCP servers and APIs Build end-to-end AI-powered software applications integrating Large Language Models (LLMs) and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines Integrate AI solutions into existing environments and workflows, ensuring seamless operation and performance optimization Conduct research on the latest AI developments and apply them to improve our systems Technically mentor teammates on product thinking and contribute to a culture of continuous learning Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and deliver innovative AI solutions


Ideal Profile:

6+ years of experience in Software Engineering including as a lead, and ideally in full stack/backend product-focused software engineering Proven hands-on experience (3+ years) using Gen AI/LLM technologies in production (e.g. LLMs, Vector databases, RAG, AI agents) and with prompt engineering techniques Strong proficiency in backend development with Python (leveraging frameworks like FastAPI, Flask), microservices architecture and event-driven architecture(eg. KafKa, SSE, WebSocket) Practical experience developing, deploying and scaling RAG systems and AI agents, in a production environment. Demonstrated expertise in implementing and integrating AI solutions into existing environments. Knowledge of LLMOps, CI/CD pipelines, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) Strong problem-solving skills with excellent communication and documentation skills Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams 


Nice to have Skills:

Experience building multi-hop RAG systems with self-consistency and chain-of-thought prompting Experience with LLM inference and serving (vLLm, LiteLLM, TensorRT-LLM) Deep understanding of current AIOps & MLOps practices, deploying and monitoring real-time inference models and ETL pipelines Experience with AI/ML R&D Experience with distributed data tools (eg. Spark, Dask, Apache Beam) Experience with cloud platform technologies


"Come as you are"

Everyone is welcome here. Diversity & Inclusion are at our core. Far above any technical competence, we value respect, openness, and trusted collaboration. We do not tolerate intolerance.

ESG

‚ÄúAt team.blue, our commitment to caring for the environment and each other is at the heart of everything we do. Our latest impact report showcases our ongoing ESG efforts and ambitious sustainability goals. Interested in learning more about our dedication to making a positive impact? Check it out here.‚Äù

The most trusted digital enabler

team.blue is a leading digital enabler for companies and entrepreneurs. It serves over 3.3 million customers in Europe and has more than 3,000 experts to support them. Its goal is to shape technology and to empower businesses with innovative digital services.

Click here to read more about team.blue

description.text:
About us
At Eneba, we‚Äôre building an open, safe and sustainable marketplace for the gamers of today and tomorrow. Our marketplace supports close to 20 million active users (and growing fast!), providing a level of trust, safety, and market accessibility unparalleled to none. We‚Äôre proud of what we‚Äôve accomplished in such a short time and look forward to sharing this journey with you.
About the Role
We‚Äôre hiring a PR Growth Partner to lead the development of omni-channel campaigns that drive both brand trust and business outcomes. This is a hybrid PR and growth role ‚Äî not just about generating awareness, but building campaigns that deliver tangible, measurable impact.
You‚Äôll join the Brand Authority team within the Content division and work cross-functionally with Influencers, Partnerships, Product, SEO, and Newsletters to bring compelling, creative narratives to life. From product launches to strategic collaborations, you‚Äôll own the entire campaign lifecycle ‚Äî from ideation and forecasting to rollout and reporting.
About the Team
You‚Äôll report directly to the Content Marketing Manager and collaborate closely with:
Product Leads, Partnerships, Influencers, Newsletters, SEO, and ContentExecutive Team and external consultants on strategic communication projectsInternal writers and designers to shape narratives and briefs
Responsibilities
Own the full lifecycle of PR Growth Campaigns ‚Äî from strategy and narrative development to execution and analysisLaunch creative, trust-focused initiatives across channels like Influencers, Product, Newsletters, SEO, Partnerships, On-site banners, and paid mediaTranslate product or business milestones into compelling stories and angles with measurable bottom-line impactForecast campaign results, define KPIs (e.g. GMV, ROAS, new users), and iterate based on insights from tools like Mixpanel and GABuild and maintain strong media relationships, securing coverage in high-value outlets and platformsDevelop cross-functional campaign roadmaps and briefs that guide internal and external collaborators toward unified executionContribute to Eneba‚Äôs B2B positioning project in collaboration with the executive team and external advisorsHelp build a scalable playbook for trust-based and milestone-driven communication campaigns
Requirement
Must-Have
4+ years of experience in PR, communications, or growth-related marketing roles, ideally within B2C or B2B eCommerce, SaaS, or digital productsHands-on exposure to B2B comms, brand positioning, and internal-external alignmentTrack record of launching creative, multi-channel campaigns that go beyond awareness and deliver measurable business resultsStrong creative thinking and growth hacking mindset ‚Äî you see what others miss and bring bold ideas to lifeExcellent storytelling and narrative-building skills; you know how to package product features or business milestones for multiple audiencesStrategic planning and performance analysis capabilities ‚Äî from roadmap creation to post-launch reportingDeep understanding of how to coordinate XFN marketing (Influencers, SEO, Product, Partnerships, Newsletters, etc.)Comfortable owning high-level initiatives while executing hands-onFamiliar with performance tools like Mixpanel, GA, or similar analytics platforms
Nice to Have
Experience working in gaming, digital marketplaces, or trust-first consumer productsExisting relationships with media and editorial outlets relevant to our target marketsFamiliarity with localization strategy, landing page messaging, and visual storytelling
What‚Äôs in It for You?
Full ownership of high-visibility, cross-functional campaigns with measurable business impactA chance to shape Eneba‚Äôs trust narrative and drive results in both B2C and B2B segmentsDirect involvement in company-wide strategic initiatives ‚Äî including future partnerships and long-term positioningJoin a strong, autonomous marketing team with the resources and freedom to innovatePotential to grow into a leadership role managing newsletters, PR, and campaign contributors
What it‚Äôs like to work at Eneba
Opportunity to join our Employee Stock Options programOpportunity to help scale a unique and fast-growing productAccess to performance-based bonuses, referral bonuses, additional paid leave, and learning budgetsPaid volunteering opportunitiesWork where and how you want ‚Äî remote, office-based, or a mix of bothClear feedback and promotion processes supporting fast personal and professional growth

Product Leads, Partnerships, Influencers, Newsletters, SEO, and ContentExecutive Team and external consultants on strategic communication projectsInternal writers and designers to shape narratives and briefs
Responsibilities
Own the full lifecycle of PR Growth Campaigns ‚Äî from strategy and narrative development to execution and analysisLaunch creative, trust-focused initiatives across channels like Influencers, Product, Newsletters, SEO, Partnerships, On-site banners, and paid mediaTranslate product or business milestones into compelling stories and angles with measurable bottom-line impactForecast campaign results, define KPIs (e.g. GMV, ROAS, new users), and iterate based on insights from tools like Mixpanel and GABuild and maintain strong media relationships, securing coverage in high-value outlets and platformsDevelop cross-functional campaign roadmaps and briefs that guide internal and external collaborators toward unified executionContribute to Eneba‚Äôs B2B positioning project in collaboration with the executive team and external advisorsHelp build a scalable playbook for trust-based and milestone-driven communication campaigns
Requirement
Must-Have
4+ years of experience in PR, communications, or growth-related marketing roles, ideally within B2C or B2B eCommerce, SaaS, or digital productsHands-on exposure to B2B comms, brand positioning, and internal-external alignmentTrack record of launching creative, multi-channel campaigns that go beyond awareness and deliver measurable business resultsStrong creative thinking and growth hacking mindset ‚Äî you see what others miss and bring bold ideas to lifeExcellent storytelling and narrative-building skills; you know how to package product features or business milestones for multiple audiencesStrategic planning and performance analysis capabilities ‚Äî from roadmap creation to post-launch reportingDeep understanding of how to coordinate XFN marketing (Influencers, SEO, Product, Partnerships, Newsletters, etc.)Comfortable owning high-level initiatives while executing hands-onFamiliar with performance tools like Mixpanel, GA, or similar analytics platforms
Nice to Have
Experience working in gaming, digital marketplaces, or trust-first consumer productsExisting relationships with media and editorial outlets relevant to our target marketsFamiliarity with localization strategy, landing page messaging, and visual storytelling
What‚Äôs in It for You?
Full ownership of high-visibility, cross-functional campaigns with measurable business impactA chance to shape Eneba‚Äôs trust narrative and drive results in both B2C and B2B segmentsDirect involvement in company-wide strategic initiatives ‚Äî including future partnerships and long-term positioningJoin a strong, autonomous marketing team with the resources and freedom to innovatePotential to grow into a leadership role managing newsletters, PR, and campaign contributors
What it‚Äôs like to work at Eneba
Opportunity to join our Employee Stock Options programOpportunity to help scale a unique and fast-growing productAccess to performance-based bonuses, referral bonuses, additional paid leave, and learning budgetsPaid volunteering opportunitiesWork where and how you want ‚Äî remote, office-based, or a mix of bothClear feedback and promotion processes supporting fast personal and professional growth

description.text:
About BeReal

At BeReal, we are dedicated to authenticity in social media. By encouraging users to share unfiltered moments, we foster genuine connections and celebrate real life. We are now an international team of 70+ and have 40M+ monthly active users. Backed by Voodoo, our team is fully focused on scaling BeReal into an iconic social network used by hundreds of millions.

Role

As Head of Growth - you will be responsible for scaling BeReal worldwide, reporting to the CEO and working closely with Voodoo‚Äôs central growth team.

You will build and lead a team of 5+ people to cover all growth activities. The ideal candidate is a data-driven leader with a structured mindset, a passion for growth, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic and entrepreneurial environment.

Build the growth strategy to scale BeReal‚Äôs user base. Drive the execution of all user acquisition channels (including paid UA, product-led growth, offline activities, partnerships, PR, content production, influencer marketing, organic growth, community management, ASO and app store relationships.) Partner with cross-functional teams and product teams to ensure execution of the growth strategy and leverage resources effectivelyConduct systematic data analysis and leverage key metrics to measure channels performances, drive decision-making, prioritize growth initiatives and new opportunities.Stay up-to-date with industry trends and competitors‚Äô growth strategies to identify innovative activations

Profile

You have at least 5-8 years of experience, and a proven track record in driving growth for consumer-facing digital product, preferably in social media or mobile appsYou already have leadership experiences with the ability to inspire and manage a team of 5+ peopleYou understand the mobile growth ecosystem in detail as well as branding performance You are a data-driven, growth hacker with an entrepreneurial mindset and can adapt to a high-paced environmentYou can demonstrate excellent teamwork and collaboration skillsYou are fluent in English (fluency in French is a plus)

Benefits

Competitive salary upon experienceSwile Lunch voucherGymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)Premium healthcare coverage SideCare, for your family 100% borne by VoodooWellness activities in our Paris office
