description.text:
Fully RemotePermanent or full-time ContractorCompetitive package

About Us

ClickOut Media is not just a company - it's a thriving ecosystem of diverse talent from around the globe. As a proudly remote-first organisation, we've cultivated an environment where creativity flourishes, collaboration is core, and innovation knows no bounds. With over +850 team members and more than 200 assets, our startup culture fuels our growth, making us a leading force in multi-channel marketing. We specialise in delivering best-in-class SEO & Content solutions to esteemed clients worldwide.

What Makes Us Different

At ClickOut Media, we thrive in the most competitive search verticals, operate across every major language, and conquer platforms you've probably never even heard of. Our dynamic approach, combined with our fast-paced environment, sets us apart in the industry. We're not just here to meet expectations; we're here to exceed them, every single time. Our relentless pursuit of excellence has been the cornerstone of our continuous success.

Job Description

We are excited to be on the hunt for a talented and motivated individual to join our team as an Content Manager (Web 3) who will be involved in all aspects of delivering Content.

In this role, you will be responsible for auditing and ensuring the global quality of all content across our projects. This role is pivotal in leading and executing SEO strategy, managing large-scale global campaigns, and overseeing all content within WordPress. The ideal candidate will be a key point of cross-team communication, working closely with RMs and editors and reporting directly to the hiring manager.

Strong Web3 knowledge and experience managing content across international audiences is essential.

Responsibilities

Audit all content across Provider SEO sitesLeverage Web3 knowledge to inform and level-up content strategyDevelop and enforce editorial guidelinesHelp manage SEO strategy and executionOversee content management and site updates in WordPressCoordinate communications between Key StakeholdersMaintain high standards for content quality and consistencyRegularly report to the hiring manager

Qualifications

Proven experience with large international and/or Web3-focused campaignsDeep understanding of Web3, blockchain, or project ecosystemsExceptional content management and editorial skillsSignificant experience developing and implementing SEO strategiesAdvanced proficiency with WordPressStrong cross-team and remote communication skillsCapability to manage multiple projects and priorities

Nice To Have Requirements

Further experience in the project or Web3 industryFamiliarity with web analytics and reportingPrevious experience managing or leading teams

Benefits & Rewards

A brilliant opportunity to grow your career & work with a fun, fast-paced & growing company, prepared to let you shineAn entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day (we more than welcome and support people with their own projects)Build an organization that continues to diversify its portfolioPersonal responsibility with a ton of autonomy30 free paid daysMarket-leading remuneration and bonuses availableAn international team with over 35 nationalitiesFully Remote working (work fully remotely and option for weekly coworker space)Additional benefits for permanent employees are available depending on the location

What do we mean by "Fully Remote"

Clickout Media offers you an unparalleled working experience. We are registered in Malta, but you don't have to be. Wherever you are based, and whether you are employed, operate B2B, or are a career freelancer, we will always find a way to work with great people.

Engaging with a worldwide workforce, ClickOut Media brings together world-leading experts in the fields of Tech, SEO, Content, and Product. Our remote approach gives absolute flexibility to our people and exemplifies our philosophy of autonomy and trust.

Diversity is a given to us, and this unique approach allows us to deliver and have respect for the wide variety of people, experiences, and cultures we bring together.

Our Recruitment Process Is As Follows

ApplyHave an introduction call with our recruitment teamDo a testHave a technical interview

Equal Opportunities

ClickOut Media is an equal-opportunity employer welcoming applicants from all backgrounds.

description.text:
GNO Partners was founded by Gal and Ouriel, who built and exited two successful Amazon brands. We help Amazon FBA sellers scale profitably using our proven system.

We are a Done With You consultancy, meaning we don't manage client accounts - we set the strategy, analyze their brand, and teach them how to execute using our resources.

Why Join Us?

Fully remote Amazon consulting agency.High-performance culture: hard work, speed, over-delivery, and trust.Competitive Compensation: Total OTE of $210,000-250,000+. Base Salary: $100,000+ Performance-Based Earnings: $100,000-$150,000+, based on performance, with no cap on earnings.Work with a team that lives and breathes Amazon while having fun doing it.


Who We're Looking For:

We are seeking a Senior Amazon Brand Manager who deeply understands Amazon FBA, enjoys strategizing for brand growth, and can tackle complex challenges with precision and speed.Key Skills & Experience:

Organic Ranking Mastery: Product launches, ranking strategies, and algorithm insights.Amazon PPC Expertise: Strategy + execution, proven hands on experience managing minimum $50K+/mo budgets.Brand Management: Experience managing Private Label brands generating a minimum of $10M in annual revenueLogistics & Backend: Strong grasp of COGs, fees, inventory, and profitability (P&L) optimization.Amazon Catalog Troubleshooter: Proven expertise in diagnosing and resolving complex catalog issues.


Responsibilities:

Lead weekly strategy calls with clients, ensuring project progress.Solve Amazon challenges and guide clients through key projects.Track progress and provide clear next steps.Offer daily support via Slack & Email.Continuously improve our consulting systems.Attend weekly training and team meetings.


Qualifications:

Full-time, remote.3+ years Amazon FBA experience, managing brands $10M+ in revenue minimum.PPC expertise: Managed $50k monthly ad budgets minimum.Seller Central pro: Navigate and optimize quickly.Strong project management & client communication skills.Positive, proactive, and client-focused personality.Fluent in English.Ambitious and driven, with a relentless work ethic to maximize earning potential


If you're an Amazon expert, you're driven, strategic, and thrive in high-growth environments, we want you on our team!

description.text:
Job Title: Financial Services Specialist ‚Äì AI TrainerJob Type: Contract (Part-time or Full-time)Location: Remote
Job Summary:Join our customer‚Äôs team as a Financial Services Specialist ‚Äì AI Trainer and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of AI-assisted financial operations. You‚Äôll leverage your sector expertise to ensure AI-generated content is both accurate and compliant, helping refine cutting-edge technology used across banking, investment, and accounting domains.
Key Responsibilities:Source and curate credible financial documents, including reports, compliance guidelines, and customer communications.Design and author realistic financial scenarios and queries to simulate industry workflows.Assess and evaluate AI outputs for accuracy, adherence to regulatory standards, and professional language.Deliver actionable feedback to enhance AI training materials, ensuring continuous improvement in quality and compliance.Collaborate with AI development teams to identify content gaps and optimize training datasets.Maintain meticulous records of evaluations and contribute to best practices for AI content review.Ensure all data handling and content review processes align with financial industry compliance requirements.
Required Skills and Qualifications:Minimum 3 years‚Äô experience in banking, investment, accounting, or financial advisory roles.Exceptional written and verbal English communication skills, demonstrating a keen eye for clarity and professionalism.Deep understanding of financial industry processes, documentation standards, and regulatory frameworks.High attention to detail with a proven track record of accuracy in reviewing and verifying information.Strong compliance awareness, especially regarding documentation and communication in financial services.Ability to adapt complex financial concepts for AI understanding and training purposes.
Preferred Qualifications:Previous experience in AI training, content evaluation, or data annotation roles.Familiarity with machine learning concepts, especially in the context of natural language processing for financial services.Experience working in a fully remote, collaborative environment.

description.text:
L'entreprise

ESCP Business School Paris est l'√©cole de commerce de renomm√©e mondiale, fond√©e en 1819, qui forme les leaders responsables de demain. Ancr√©e au c≈ìur de Paris, elle propose une p√©dagogie innovante et multiculturelle, s‚Äôappuyant sur un r√©seau de six campus europ√©ens. Reconnue pour l‚Äôexcellence de ses programmes en management, elle favorise l‚Äôengagement, l‚Äôouverture internationale et l‚Äôaccompagnement personnalis√© des talents tout au long de leur parcours.

Description Du Poste

Lanc√©e en 2024 par ESCP Business School, ESCP Extension School est une structure de formation innovante et inclusive. Sa mission : accompagner les actifs ‚Äì en poste, en mobilit√© ou en reconversion ‚Äì dans leur mont√©e en comp√©tences, face aux grandes transformations du monde professionnel.

ESCP Extension incarne l‚Äôengagement d‚ÄôESCP Business School √† d√©mocratiser l‚Äôacc√®s √† une formation de haut niveau et √† r√©pondre aux enjeux de soci√©t√©, par une p√©dagogie r√©solument tourn√©e vers l‚Äôaction et l‚Äôimpact.

Sous La Responsabilit√© De La Direction De L‚ÄôExtension School, Vous Serez Charg√© De D√©finir, Mettre En ≈íuvre Et Piloter La Strat√©gie Marketing Et Communication Afin De Renforcer La Visibilit√© Et L‚Äôattractivit√© De L‚ÄôExtension School En France Et √† L‚Äôinternational. description.text:
OPENING FROM KRAKEN TECHNOLOGIES FRANCE üá´üá∑ - ALL LOCATIONS

Help us use technology to make a big green dent in the universe!

Kraken powers some of the most innovative global developments in energy.

We‚Äôre a technology company focused on creating a smart, sustainable energy system. From optimising renewable generation, creating a more intelligent grid and enabling utilities to provide excellent customer experiences, our operating system for energy is transforming the industry around the world in a way that benefits everyone.

It‚Äôs a really exciting time in energy. Help us make a real impact on shaping a better, more sustainable future.

Kraken Customer

What we do: build the most AI-driven, innovative, forward-thinking platform for energy management. From optimizing resources to delivering cost-effective, exceptional customer experiences through advanced Customer Information Systems (CIS), billing, meter data management, CRM, and AI-driven communications, Kraken is powering the next wave of innovation in the energy industry.

Why we do it: future energy will not look like energy as we know it today. We need to not just think about our future, but build for it. Now.

Our mission is to provide cheaper, greener energy to the French market.

Octopus Energy France is a fast-growing energy company recognized as an ESS (social economy). **We offer a better experience to our customers through transparency, honesty and simplicity. We want to do better for the planet, through real, long-term investment in renewable energy production and a low-CO2 future that's better for our customers' wallets. We want to revolutionize the energy business through our people, our platform and our use of data.

Our focus is on customer satisfaction, and receiving positive reviews is important to us - we have the best score among French energy suppliers on Google Reviews and Trust Pilot.

Kraken technologies

Kraken Technologies is a company within Octopus Energy Group who are licensing the Kraken platform and operating model to clients across the world. Current clients are both the Octopus Energy retails businesses around the world as well as external clients such as Good Energy, Origin, EDF, E.ON & Queensland Energy - with many more expected to join over the next few years!

Our team

All technology is written and maintained by a multi-discipline engineering team of around 450 people globally. This includes server-side, client-side and mobile engineers working closely with UX experts, copywriters and designers.

We follow a Kanban-like approach, using Google docs and Asana to specify and manage work; Github, CircleCI and Terraform Enterprise as part of an immutable-infrastructure, continuous delivery pipeline; and Loggly, Sentry and Cloudwatch to measure performance and monitor production.

Some of our coding conventions are open-source.

Octopus is a great place to learn, work with some talented engineers and level-up your skills.

Our technology

On the server-side, we mainly use Python. Most of our websites are powered by Django and the Django-REST-framework. We also use Pandas, Numpy and Jupyter for analysis and forecasting, plus Celery, RabbitMQ, SQS and Airflow for background processing.

We use AWS heavily, employing most of the "Hashistack" (eg Packer, Consul, Terraform) as part of a continuous deployment pipeline. See, for example, Django, ELB health checks and continuous delivery.

Client-side, we use React, Redux and SASS; our mobile apps are built using native code or React Native.

What You'll Do

We have lots of difficult design challenges to solve. The French energy market is complicated, outdated and process-heavy - there's an awful lot of domain modelling that we need to get right. Strong attention to detail is essential.You will be working in a multi-disciplinary software engineering team; solving design challenges; domain modeling; solving technical problems; engineering solutions for smart meters, writing robust fault-tolerant software primarily in Python and Django, Celery, and async processingWe have lots of difficult design challenges to solve. The energy market is complicated, outdated, and process-heavy - there's an awful lot of domain modeling that we need to get right. Strong attention to detail is essential.We have difficult technical problems to solve. With the advent of smart meters, we'll soon be processing millions of meter readings a day. There's a great opportunity for disruption in the energy market. The big suppliers still dominate but are not exactly popular. The energy landscape is changing as we move to more disaggregated forms of generation, with less predictability, more dynamism, and smarter technology. Octopus Energy was the first UK supplier to introduce a "tracker" tariff whose prices track the daily wholesale prices: http://www.cleanenergynews.co.uk/news/efficiency/octopus-offerstransparency-with-wholesale-price-tariff You'll be working for a company that‚Äôs fighting climate change. Our parent company is the largest investor in solar generation in the UK and is funding wind and anaerobic digestion. As a supplier, we're helping people to use greener technology and renewable energy, all helping move the world towards a lower carbon future.

It would be helpful to have experience/expertise in the following (in rough priority order):

Python (minimum 7 y.e.)Django (or equiv. web framework)Fluent in French, and lever B2 at least in EnglishDomain modellingHTTP and REST APIsWriting robust and fault-tolerant softwareCelery and async processingPostgres

Plus Experience In The Following Would Be a Bonus

AWSTerraform, Packer, ConsulReact and ReduxThis is a full remote position. We are therefore looking for senior developers. We need people working remotely to have a very good level of autonomy and strong technical abilities. If you are not senior, we may have space for you but it will not be in a remote position. 

Kraken is a certified Great Place to Work in France, Germany, Spain, Japan and Australia. In the UK we are one of the Best Workplaces in Glassdoor with a score of 4,7. Check out our Welcome to the Jungle site ( FR / EN ) to learn more about our teams and culture.

If this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from  you.

Are you ready for a career with us? We want to ensure you have all the tools and environment you need to unleash your potential. Need any specific accommodations? Whether you require specific accommodations or have a unique preference, let us know, and we'll do what we can to customise your interview process for comfort and maximum magic!

Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

description.text:
About Voodoo

Founded in 2013, Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps with a mission to entertain the world. Gathering 800 employees, 7 billion downloads, and over 200 million active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. Our portfolio includes chart-topping games like Mob Control and Block Jam, alongside popular apps such as BeReal and Wizz.

Team

Our Growth team is a transversal entity aiming to maximize and deliver the potential of any mobile product. It combines user acquisition, creative content production, monetization, and the tech capabilities required to turn applications into global hits. With over 150 experts, we operate at the forefront of mobile marketing and ad tech across consumer and social apps.

Role

Voodoo is looking for an User Acquisition Manager to own user acquisition activities on a portfolio of consumer and social apps. Leading you own portfolio of Apps, you will leverage your expertise and creativity to turn great mobile products into global hits.

Plan and manage UA campaigns for multiple appsAnalyze the performance of our campaigns, identify the most relevant signals, and increase the ROAS of our appsWork closely with our Product and Creative teams to coordinate efforts and share feedbackUse our suite of internal growth tools and interface with our Tech team to continuously improve themDeepen your UA expertise and share best practices with other teams to keep our organization at the forefront of growth innovationLead transversal projects

Profile

You have experience in performance marketing and paid acquisition, in application or gaming companiesYou have a successful track record with ROAS strategies on mobile games and/ or appsYou‚Äôre intimately familiar with user acquisition platforms (Facebook Ads, AdMob, AppLovin, TikTok, DSPs, etc.) and MMPs (Appsflyer, Adjust, etc.)You‚Äôre well-versed with experimentation methodologies and processesYou have experience with influencer marketing and ASOYou‚Äôre a hacker: you‚Äôve already tried innovative organic/ viral tacticsYou speak and write English fluentlyYou wish to work in an environment that values candor, freedom, and responsibility

Benefits

Competitive salary Premium healthcare (SideCare) for you and your family 100% borne by VoodooSwile Lunch voucherGymlib (100% borne by Voodoo)Wellness activities in our Paris officeUnlimited vacation policyRemote daysChild daycare facilities (Les Petits Chaperons rouges)

description.text:
Paris Office

At EF Language Abroad, we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we've helped millions of students discover new places, embrace diverse cultures, and gain fresh perspectives.

We offer immersive short-term and long-term language courses and programs across different languages in the countries where they‚Äôre spoken. Together, our global staff help students from around the world develop the language skills they need to achieve their dreams.

Are you ready for a dynamic role in a truly international environment? Are you passionate about digital marketing and strongly goal-oriented?

As the Head of Marketing you will be at the heart of our mission to connect with more learners, working in a dynamic atmosphere while shaping our digital future.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Unleash your creativityAnalyze dataDesign targeted campaigns

The everyday working language in our Paris office is French, however, this role requires excellent command of the English language as well to communicate with Global Leaders and Stakeholders. Full fluency (speaking, reading, writing) in both languages is required. Please submit your CV in English. CVs in French will not be considered. 

Your key responsibilities will include: 

You will drive a high-performing marketing team and own the marketing strategy, balancing performance marketing, brand storytelling, and offline activation to drive demand and revenue growth.

Manage a team of 10+ marketers, fostering a culture of growth, creativity, performance, and data-driven decision-makingDevelop and execute innovative digital strategies to enhance brand awareness and engage our audience in new ways.Manage paid campaigns, SEO/SEM, email marketing, and social media to turn traffic into leads and followers into brand ambassadors.Work closely with product, sales, and global marketing teams to align your vision with our objectives.Use data to measure performance, refine strategies, and exceed expectations.Ensure our content and messaging resonate with the local audience while maintaining the brand‚Äôs global identity.Oversee marketing budgets, ensuring optimal allocation of resources.Collaborate with agencies, media, and influencers to expand our reach.Stay ahead of market trends, customer feedback, and competitor actions.Organize events, webinars, and sponsorships to bring the EF brand to life.Define and execute a full-funnel marketing strategy that combines performance marketing, brand building, and offline activations to drive business growth.Own the lead generation and customer acquisition strategy, ensuring an optimal marketing mix across paid digital, organic, brand, and partnerships.

What we are looking for: 

5-10 years of experience in marketing, both digital and offlineMinimum 5 years of experience leading a teamPassionate about marketing and cutting-edge concepts in digital marketingData-driven and results-oriented ‚Äì you love both spreadsheets and creative ideasA natural leader, you are comfortable in a dynamic and collaborative environmentExperienced in creating engaging campaigns and generating leadsStrong understanding of the French digital marketProven ability to lead multi-channel marketing strategies (performance, content, CRM, social, offline, and brand activations).Strong analytical mindset, able to connect marketing activities to lead generation and revenue impact.Experience in high-growth, competitive industries (e.g., travel, education, consumer services).Deep understanding of the French media landscape, including digital, influencer marketing, and traditional media.Fully fluent in French, used daily in the officeFully Fluent in English, required for global meetings

What EF offers: 

Work in the heart of Paris Opportunities to travel internationallyDiscounts on EF programs for Staff and Staff Friends and FamilyFree use of EF Hello: a premium Language Learning AppTuition Reimbursement for continued EducationBe part of a mission-driven company that transforms lives through educationTeam events, kick-offs, and Holiday Parties

At EF Language Abroad we are dedicated to our mission of opening the world through education, harnessing the power of language learning to deepen the connection between people across the globe.

Ready to open the world through education? Apply now!

About EF Education First

Openness to the world and cultural understanding are key qualities for a successful journey. Since 1965, we have helped millions of learners travel, discover new cultures, and live unique experiences.

Our immersive educational programs‚Äîfocused on languages, travel, cultural exchange, and academic learning‚Äîturn dreams into international opportunities.

By joining EF, you become part of a multicultural community active in over 50 countries, with hundreds of schools and offices worldwide. Our mission is to open the world through education. No matter your background or passions, we welcome you and hope you will share this vision with us.

EF is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer, committed to inclusion and belonging, regardless of origin, gender, age, religion, parental status, identity, or experience.

Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, with regional headquarters in Boston, London, S√£o Paulo, Tokyo, Zurich, and more.

EF is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults. All positions are subject to criminal background and/or reference checks, as applicable.

jobs.description:
Paris Office

At EF Language Abroad, we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we've helped millions of students discover new places, embrace diverse cultures, and gain fresh perspectives.

We offer immersive short-term and long-term language courses and programs across different languages in the countries where they‚Äôre spoken. Together, our global staff help students from around the world develop the language skills they need to achieve their dreams.

Are you ready for a dynamic role in a truly international environment? Are you passionate about digital marketing and strongly goal-oriented?

As the Head of Marketing you will be at the heart of our mission to connect with more learners, working in a dynamic atmosphere while shaping our digital future.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to:

Unleash your creativityAnalyze dataDesign targeted campaigns

The everyday working language in our Paris office is French, however, this role requires excellent command of the English language as well to communicate with Global Leaders and Stakeholders. Full fluency (speaking, reading, writing) in both languages is required. Please submit your CV in English. CVs in French will not be considered. 

Your key responsibilities will include: 

You will drive a high-performing marketing team and own the marketing strategy, balancing performance marketing, brand storytelling, and offline activation to drive demand and revenue growth.

Manage a team of 10+ marketers, fostering a culture of growth, creativity, performance, and data-driven decision-makingDevelop and execute innovative digital strategies to enhance brand awareness and engage our audience in new ways.Manage paid campaigns, SEO/SEM, email marketing, and social media to turn traffic into leads and followers into brand ambassadors.Work closely with product, sales, and global marketing teams to align your vision with our objectives.Use data to measure performance, refine strategies, and exceed expectations.Ensure our content and messaging resonate with the local audience while maintaining the brand‚Äôs global identity.Oversee marketing budgets, ensuring optimal allocation of resources.Collaborate with agencies, media, and influencers to expand our reach.Stay ahead of market trends, customer feedback, and competitor actions.Organize events, webinars, and sponsorships to bring the EF brand to life.Define and execute a full-funnel marketing strategy that combines performance marketing, brand building, and offline activations to drive business growth.Own the lead generation and customer acquisition strategy, ensuring an optimal marketing mix across paid digital, organic, brand, and partnerships.

What we are looking for: 

5-10 years of experience in marketing, both digital and offlineMinimum 5 years of experience leading a teamPassionate about marketing and cutting-edge concepts in digital marketingData-driven and results-oriented ‚Äì you love both spreadsheets and creative ideasA natural leader, you are comfortable in a dynamic and collaborative environmentExperienced in creating engaging campaigns and generating leadsStrong understanding of the French digital marketProven ability to lead multi-channel marketing strategies (performance, content, CRM, social, offline, and brand activations).Strong analytical mindset, able to connect marketing activities to lead generation and revenue impact.Experience in high-growth, competitive industries (e.g., travel, education, consumer services).Deep understanding of the French media landscape, including digital, influencer marketing, and traditional media.Fully fluent in French, used daily in the officeFully Fluent in English, required for global meetings

description.text:
We provide the DevOps automation platform built to empower developers. From cloud infrastructure provisioning to production deployment, Qovery streamlines every step, enabling faster delivery, simplified workflows, and significant time savings.

ü§© Why is your role important?

As Qovery‚Äôs first Product Marketing Manager, you will lay the foundation for how our story is told to the world. You‚Äôll shape the way we position ourselves in a crowded DevOps and cloud market, crafting messaging that cuts through the noise and resonates with both developers and business buyers. This role is pivotal in giving clarity to our narrative, enabling the sales team, and helping our users understand the real value of choosing Qovery.

üöÄ What will your job look like

As our first Product Marketing Manager, you‚Äôll be both strategist and builder. Your mission will be to:

Define positioning and messaging that makes Qovery‚Äôs value clear to developers, platform teams, and business stakeholders. Enable our sales team with the right tools (battlecards, one-pagers, pitch decks) to communicate our story with clarity and impact. Shape our go-to-market strategy for new features and product launches, ensuring we stand out in a crowded DevOps/CloudOps market. Collaborate with Product and Engineering to translate complex technology into simple, compelling narratives. Lead market research and competitive analysis to keep us ahead of industry trends and sharpen our differentiation. Support demand generation with content and campaigns that attract and educate prospects. Embody Qovery‚Äôs Culture: Collaborate in a caring, transparent, and innovative environment, building authentic relationships with customers and colleagues.

This is a role for someone who thrives in an early-stage environment: you‚Äôll have freedom to experiment, influence strategy directly, and set the standards for Product Marketing at Qovery.

üí° About you

We‚Äôre looking for a Product Marketing Manager who is equal parts storyteller and strategist. Someone who can dive deep into our product, empathize with developers and platform teams, and translate technical complexity into messages that resonate.

Here‚Äôs What Will Help You Succeed

Experience in B2B SaaS ‚Äî ideally in DevOps, Cloud, Platform Engineering, or a technical developer-focused product. A builder‚Äôs mindset ‚Äî you‚Äôve shaped Product Marketing in a growing company before, or you‚Äôre eager to take on that challenge for the first time. Strong communication skills ‚Äî you can switch seamlessly between writing clear, concise copy and building narratives for executives, customers, and sales teams. Analytical and curious ‚Äî you like to dig into customer insights, market research, and data to inform positioning and strategy. Collaborative by nature ‚Äî you work well with Product, Engineering, Sales, and Marketing, and know how to bridge technical and commercial worlds. Hands-on and proactive ‚Äî in a small team, you‚Äôre comfortable rolling up your sleeves and making things happen.

Most importantly, you share our values: ownership, transparency, and a developer-first mindset.

üéØ What You‚Äôll Get at Qovery

Competitive Compensation.Comprehensive Benefits.Flexible Work Setup: Remote-first culture; work from anywhere with a reliable internet connection.Learning Opportunities: Professional development and growth supported from day one.Innovative Environment: Join a high-growth startup pushing boundaries in cloud technology.Authentic Culture: Collaborate with a team that values care, innovation, and customer success.

üí• Our Talent Acquisition Process

We‚Äôve designed a streamlined process to ensure a great candidate experience. Typically, it takes 3-4 weeks:

Initial Call: Meet with Marie or Ludwig to discuss your experience, motivation, and career goals.Hiring Manager Interview: A 60-minute deep dive into your sales skills and collaboration experience.Workshop/Case Study PresentationFinal Round: Meet with a co-founder and leadership to discuss alignment with Qovery‚Äôs values and mission.Reference Checks: Validate performance, integrity, and alignment with our needs.

We‚Äôre committed to keeping you informed throughout the process, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience.

We are passionate about simplifying the complexities of cloud infrastructure for software development. We provide an Internal Developer Platform that streamlines the path to production, offering solutions like testing, ephemeral environments, and a focus on continuous software improvement.

As a growing company co-founded by experienced professionals, we are committed to innovation and excellence in the tech world.

We‚Äôre committed to keeping you informed throughout the process, ensuring a smooth and transparent experience.

We are passionate about simplifying the complexities of cloud infrastructure for software development. We provide an Internal Developer Platform that streamlines the path to production, offering solutions like testing, ephemeral environments, and a focus on continuous software improvement.

As a growing company co-founded by experienced professionals, we are committed to innovation and excellence in the tech world.

description.text:
About the Client
We are sourcing on behalf of a boutique recruitment company based in Dubai that prides itself on delivering high-touch, efficient, and tailored hiring solutions. As the team continues to grow, they‚Äôre looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to help streamline operations, manage day-to-day admin tasks, and support candidate coordination. This is a great opportunity to work behind the scenes with a close-knit team that values precision, professionalism, and people-first service.
About the Role
This Virtual Assistant position is designed to provide comprehensive remote administrative, organizational, and communication support to a recruitment firm operating in Dubai. The role is suitable for professionals at the mid-level who are adept at managing a variety of business tasks using digital tools and platforms. The Virtual Assistant will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth operation of daily recruitment activities, supporting consultants and management, and maintaining high standards of professionalism and efficiency. The position requires working hours aligned with the UAE business day (9:00 AM to 5:00 PM Gulf Standard Time), offering flexibility in location while demanding reliability and responsiveness during these hours.
Key Responsibilities
Manage and coordinate calendars, schedule interviews, and organize meetings for recruitment consultants and management, ensuring all appointments are accurately tracked and confirmed.Prepare, format, and proofread recruitment documents, including candidate CVs, job descriptions, interview feedback, and client proposals, maintaining confidentiality and attention to detail.Handle email correspondence, respond to inquiries, and manage communication between candidates, clients, and internal team members in a timely and professional manner.Maintain and update applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment databases, ensuring data integrity and compliance with privacy regulations.Conduct initial candidate screening via email or phone, gather required documentation, and coordinate next steps in the recruitment process.Assist with the preparation and distribution of marketing materials, job postings, and social media updates to support candidate sourcing and employer branding initiatives.Generate regular reports on recruitment metrics, candidate pipelines, and client activity using spreadsheets and reporting tools.Support invoicing, billing, and basic bookkeeping tasks related to recruitment placements and client accounts.Coordinate travel arrangements, visa documentation, and logistics for candidates and staff as needed, particularly for international placements.Continuously identify opportunities to improve administrative processes and implement best practices for remote support in a recruitment environment.
Required Experience & Skills
Demonstrated experience as a virtual assistant, administrative assistant, or similar remote support role, preferably within the recruitment, HR, or professional services sector.Advanced proficiency with digital productivity tools such as Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Calendar), and cloud-based file management systems (e.g., Dropbox, Google Drive).Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) such as Bullhorn, Greenhouse, or Workable, and the ability to quickly learn new recruitment software platforms.Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to draft professional correspondence and interact effectively with diverse stakeholders.Strong organizational and time management skills, with proven ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple deadlines, and maintain accuracy under pressure.High level of discretion and confidentiality when handling sensitive candidate and client information.Experience with basic bookkeeping, invoicing, and financial record-keeping using tools like QuickBooks, Xero, or similar platforms is advantageous.Proactive problem-solving abilities and a customer-service mindset, with a focus on anticipating needs and delivering solutions.Adaptability to work independently in a remote environment, demonstrating self-motivation and accountability.
Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, Communications, or a related field is preferred but not mandatory.Professional certification in office administration, virtual assistance, or HR support is an asset.Prior experience supporting recruitment or HR functions is highly desirable.Reliable high-speed internet connection and a dedicated workspace suitable for confidential work.
Tools & Technologies
Productivity: Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, Dropbox, Google DriveCommunication: Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Slack, WhatsApp BusinessRecruitment: Applicant Tracking Systems (Bullhorn, Greenhouse, Workable), LinkedIn RecruiterReporting & Analytics: Microsoft Excel, Google SheetsBookkeeping: QuickBooks, Xero (if applicable)Social Media: LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter (for job postings and employer branding)
This Virtual Assistant role offers the opportunity to make a significant impact on the efficiency and success of a dynamic recruitment firm serving the Dubai market. The position provides exposure to international recruitment operations, the chance to develop advanced administrative skills, and the flexibility of remote work while maintaining a structured schedule. Success in this role will be measured by the ability to deliver timely, accurate, and proactive support that enhances the productivity of the recruitment team and contributes to positive client and candidate experiences.
By applying to this position, you are granting us permission to process your CV and keep your profile on file for consideration for this and future opportunities.

Demonstrated experience as a virtual assistant, administrative assistant, or similar remote support role, preferably within the recruitment, HR, or professional services sector.Advanced proficiency with digital productivity tools such as Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint), Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Calendar), and cloud-based file management systems (e.g., Dropbox, Google Drive).Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) such as Bullhorn, Greenhouse, or Workable, and the ability to quickly learn new recruitment software platforms.Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to draft professional correspondence and interact effectively with diverse stakeholders.Strong organizational and time management skills, with proven ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple deadlines, and maintain accuracy under pressure.High level of discretion and confidentiality when handling sensitive candidate and client information.Experience with basic bookkeeping, invoicing, and financial record-keeping using tools like QuickBooks, Xero, or similar platforms is advantageous.Proactive problem-solving abilities and a customer-service mindset, with a focus on anticipating needs and delivering solutions.Adaptability to work independently in a remote environment, demonstrating self-motivation and accountability.
Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, Communications, or a related field is preferred but not mandatory.Professional certification in office administration, virtual assistance, or HR support is an asset.Prior experience supporting recruitment or HR functions is highly desirable.Reliable high-speed internet connection and a dedicated workspace suitable for confidential work.
Tools & Technologies
Productivity: Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, Dropbox, Google DriveCommunication: Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Slack, WhatsApp BusinessRecruitment: Applicant Tracking Systems (Bullhorn, Greenhouse, Workable), LinkedIn RecruiterReporting & Analytics: Microsoft Excel, Google SheetsBookkeeping: QuickBooks, Xero (if applicable)Social Media: LinkedIn, Facebook, Twitter (for job postings and employer branding)
This Virtual Assistant role offers the opportunity to make a significant impact on the efficiency and success of a dynamic recruitment firm serving the Dubai market. The position provides exposure to international recruitment operations, the chance to develop advanced administrative skills, and the flexibility of remote work while maintaining a structured schedule. Success in this role will be measured by the ability to deliver timely, accurate, and proactive support that enhances the productivity of the recruitment team and contributes to positive client and candidate experiences.
By applying to this position, you are granting us permission to process your CV and keep your profile on file for consideration for this and future opportunities.

description.text:
Job Title: Healthcare Specialist ‚Äì AI TrainerJob Type: Contract (Part-time or Full-time)Location: Remote
Job Summary:Join our customer's team as a Healthcare Specialist ‚Äì AI Trainer and help shape the next generation of healthcare AI. In this pivotal remote role, you'll leverage your healthcare expertise to improve the accuracy and compliance of AI-driven solutions by curating, evaluating, and refining real-world data and medical workflows.
Key Responsibilities:Source and curate authentic healthcare documents, including patient forms, administrative records, and clinical protocols.Design realistic, context-driven queries that mirror everyday healthcare scenarios for robust AI training.Critically review AI-generated outputs to ensure compliance with healthcare standards, accuracy, and proper use of medical terminology.Deliver clear, actionable feedback to data science teams to continually enhance model performance.Collaborate cross-functionally to align AI solutions with evolving healthcare documentation and regulatory requirements.Maintain thorough documentation of review processes and insights to support transparency and quality assurance.Champion best practices for data privacy and security in handling confidential patient and institutional information.
Required Skills and Qualifications:Minimum 3 years‚Äô professional experience in healthcare administration, clinical roles, or health information management.Advanced written and verbal communication skills, with a passion for clarity and accuracy.Demonstrated knowledge of healthcare workflows, processes, and documentation standards.Meticulous attention to detail and strong organizational abilities.Proven ability to provide constructive, structured feedback in a fast-paced, remote work environment.Awareness of healthcare compliance, privacy, and regulatory requirements.Tech-savvy mindset and adaptability to evolving AI tools and platforms.
Preferred Qualifications:Experience collaborating with AI, machine learning, or digital health technology projects.Certification in Health Information Management (RHIA, RHIT) or equivalent credentials.Exposure to healthcare data privacy regulations (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR).

Ultra-organis√©, rigoureux, capable de suivre plusieurs projets en parall√®le.  Excellente communication, fran√ßais impeccable, anglais professionnel.  Connaissance des fondamentaux e-commerce / DTC (CAC, AOV, LTV, CR, MER).

 Tu sais auditer un export Meta et proposer des actions concr√®tes.  Tu sais construire des BP √† partir d'exports bruts et suivre les √©carts r√©el vs pr√©vision. REACH acc√©l√®re fortement et ce r√¥le peut rapidement √©voluer :

 Devenir Growth Strategist avec la gestion directe de comptes strat√©giques. Manager √† terme une √©quipe de 5+ personnes Prendre des responsabilit√©s dans Reach Ventures (holding M&A) pour contribuer √† le growth de nouvelles marques DTC (horizon 2026). 

√âtapes de recrutement :

 Entretien vid√©o via Workable pour avoir plus d‚Äôinformations sur ton parcours et ton profil. Appel de 30 minutes avec Anne-Ga√´lle (Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist) afin de valider les attentes.Appel de 1 heure avec Jordan (Head of Growth) afin de tester tes comp√©tences techniques avec un cas pratique, et valider un fit humain. Entretien de 30 minutes avec Alessandro (CEO), pour discuter de ton background, tes ambitions et r√©pondre √† tes questions. Caf√© avec Jordan (Head of Growth) et Alessandro (CEO) pour valider le fit final et cadrer la collaboration.

description.text:
DIRECTOR OF INTERNATIONAL SALES ‚Äì BASED IN EUROPE
On behalf of our client, Power Technologies, we are seeking a results-driven Director of International Sales to join their team in Europe (remote position). The ideal candidate can speak either German or French (or both), and will have a demonstrated ability to set up distribution, lead channel development initiatives, manage partner relationships, and drive revenue growth through effective sales execution and team collaboration.
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Power Technologies designs and markets high-quality products that support the smart charging, network management, and security of mobile digital devices. Mobile devices are continuously evolving and transforming the workflows and operating models of every industry. Our products enable organizations to deploy critical digital tools to their teams with confidence that the devices are ready for use, resulting in increased performance and productivity. At Power Technologies, we bring technology and connection to life. Company website: https://powertechnologies.com/
POSITION OVERVIEW
Reporting to the Chief Sales & Marketing Officer, who is based in the U.S, this role is responsible for managing and expanding our international sales operations across distribution, reseller, and end-user channels within the Education and Commercial sectors (including manufacturing, logistics, and healthcare).This position includes direct management of the international sales team, providing leadership, coaching, and performance oversight to ensure alignment with international sales objectives. The Director will coordinate regional sales strategies, monitor team KPIs, and foster a high-performance culture across geographically dispersed markets. In addition, the role will oversee partner enablement, deliver ongoing training, and ensure consistent execution of go-to-market plans.This position has a requirement of having direct experience in the EdTech market, working with distributors and resellers.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide day-to-day leadership and direction to international sales team members, setting clear priorities, coaching for performance, and fostering a culture of accountability and collaboration in alignment with international sales goals.Translate high-level business strategy into measurable goals and KPIs, ensuring alignment across team members, partners, and internal stakeholders.Develop and execute international sales strategies and tactical plans aligned with annual revenue and profit targets, to expand distribution, reseller, and end-user partnerships, with a strong emphasis on EdTech, ICT, and commercial markets.Manage the international sales and expense budget, tracking performance monthly and adjusting tactics to stay on target.Plan and conduct regular business reviews with distribution partners, ensuring alignment on product updates, brand strategy, marketing activities, and performance metrics.Collaborate with distribution leadership and sales reps to ensure effective lead capture, deal closure, and account management that supports market share growth.Design and implement regional sales and marketing plans, tailored to international markets, to increase visibility and penetration within value-added distributor networks.Ensure the sales team and channel partners are fully trained and equipped with product knowledge, application expertise, and the ability to effectively communicate value to customers and partners.Identify and drive cross-sell and upsell opportunities within the distribution channel to maximize revenue per account.Partner with marketing teams to co-develop impactful campaigns, track ROI, and apply insights to optimize future initiatives.Manage the end-to-end order process, including reviewing WSD purchase orders and coordinating with internal teams to ensure timely fulfillment and communication.Provide weekly report of pipeline, forecast, and activities within NetSuite CRM, including but not limited to sales-driven activities and communication associated with channel partners and end users, forecast, manage, and report on ongoing sales and pipeline activity.Leverage regional data and analytics to understand international customer behavior and refine sales strategies accordingly.Identify and communicate regularly with CSMO on new business and product opportunities within international education and commercial markets, contributing to product development and innovation.Deliver compelling product demonstrations and presentations, showcasing technical knowledge and market-specific benefits of the Power Technologies product line.Represent the company at international trade shows and exhibitions, supporting brand visibility and lead generation efforts.Support the creation of tailored sales tools and presentations, enabling partners to effectively position and sell Power Technologies solutions.Coordinate cross-functionally with internal departments (Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, Finance) to ensure seamless execution of sales initiatives and customer satisfaction.Participate in building and reinforcing company culture consistent with company purpose and values.Hold self and others accountable to conduct business in a manner compliant with Power Technologies‚Äô policies and procedures and internal controls applicable to their role.Other duties as assigned.
CANDIDATE PROFILE:
The successful candidate will bring energy, initiative, and a collaborative mindset to the role. We are looking for a confident, competitive, and goal-oriented professional with a track record of building strong partnerships, managing remote teams, and delivering measurable results. This role requires a proactive approach to business development, with a focus on expanding global channel relationships and supporting the growth of the company‚Äôs product lines in international markets.
EXPERIENCE AND REQUIREMENTS
BA, BS degree is required.5+ years related sales or experience leading multi-person, multi-region international sales teams with demonstrated ability to navigate complex reseller and distributor organizations, build distribution through Warehouse Stocking Distributors and Resellers specifically within EdTech market is required.Excellent sales skills and sales leadership capabilities; exceptionally strong negotiation and consultation skillsAbility to deliver results against sales targets, with a proven record.Proven ability to engage in middle, senior, and C-level management structures.An articulate and effective communicator with demonstrated negotiation skills across multiple services and functions.Experienced in functioning effectively in an international environment.Ability to respond and work well under pressure and change.Proactive, highly organized, and detail-oriented with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.Demonstrated ability to prioritize effectively, supporting multiple channel partners.Excellent presentation skillsStrong computer skills ‚Äì specifically Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.CRM experience required; NetSuite experience is a bonus.Proficient in English and German, multilingual a plusAbility to travel up to 60% internationally.

description.text:
Ready to shape the future of pay? Join KF Pay, Korn Ferry‚Äôs cutting-edge compensation platform, and help global organizations build fair, data-driven reward strategies that attract and retain top talent.
We‚Äôre looking for a Reward Consultant with 3‚Äì5 years of experience in compensation strategy, pay equity, benchmarking, and data collection. You‚Äôll work with top-tier clients across sectors, delivering insights that drive performance and equity.
What You‚Äôll Do:Deliver compensation benchmarking, pay equity analysis, and custom reward solutions.Collect and interpret pay data to support client strategy and database enrichment.Lead client workshops, training sessions, and implementation of KF Pay tools.Build strong client relationships and contribute to high renewal and satisfaction rates.Collaborate with internal teams to evolve our reward offerings and analytics.
What You Bring:3‚Äì5 years‚Äô experience in compensation, reward consulting, or HR analytics.Strong grasp of pay structures, job evaluation, and market benchmarking.Experience with pay equity audits and compensation strategy design.Confidence in presenting and training clients on reward tools and insights.A proactive, data-driven mindset and passion for client success.
Why KF Pay?KF Pay is Korn Ferry‚Äôs AI-powered, self-service compensation platform designed to help organizations make smarter, faster decisions about employee pay. It‚Äôs backed by the largest global pay database, with:Data from 32,000+ companies, covering 150+ countries and 31 million employeesReal-time access to compensation benchmarks, pay equity insights, and custom job gradingTools to link performance and pay, identify disparities, and design fair, equitable compensation strategiesSeamless integration with HRIS systems and intuitive analytics dashboards
Whether you're helping clients benchmark against the market or guiding them through pay equity audits, KF Pay empowers you to deliver insightful, impactful solutions that drive business success.

description.text:
At Gurobi Optimization, we're on a mission! 

A mission that focuses on mathematical optimization. We empower our customers to expand their use of mathematical optimization technology in order to make smarter decisions and solve some of the world's toughest and most impactful business problems. We're looking for passionate, dedicated, innovative game-changers to join our team and drive the future of Gurobi.

As an Account Executive at Gurobi Optimization, your role will involve engaging and inspiring potential customers and expanding our existing client base in your assigned region. This includes managing both outbound prospecting efforts to uncover new opportunities and inbound leads requiring thoughtful follow-up. You will implement a land-and-expand strategy to grow revenue within existing accounts while identifying new buying centers and leveraging your technical B2B software sales expertise. Your advanced skills in building partnerships and fostering cross-functional engagement will be crucial.

Additionally, we will rely on your knowledge of the SaaS industry to drive engagement in markets beyond our optimization space. By presenting our solver in a user-friendly manner, you will captivate new audiences and generate demand across various industries.

What you will be doing?

Drive outbound sales strategies, including prospecting and account-based marketing, to penetrate high-value enterprise markets. Execute a robust land-and-expand strategy, increasing account value through upselling and cross-selling initiatives. Manage complex, multi-stakeholder sales cycles with technical and executive-level engagement, ensuring client alignment and satisfaction. Act as a trusted advisor, delivering tailored solutions that meet client objectives while maximizing account potential. Maintain and grow a robust pipeline, qualify opportunities effectively to prioritize high-impact accounts and ensure efficient resource allocation. Attend trade shows and company training events to expand outreach and increase brand visibility. Coordinate and collaborate cross-functionally across our global organization to ensure smooth operations and maximize sales opportunities. Keep the CRM system up-to-date with accurate and relevant information about clients and prospects. Provide management with well-informed forecasts and reports on sales progress and future opportunities. Stay informed about best practices, competitive threats, and developments in the optimization space to maintain a competitive edge. Document and track your progress in the CRM system to ensure transparency and accountability. 


What experience and qualifications should you have?

5+ years of experience in B2B SaaS sales or enterprise account management with a proven ability to exceed revenue targets. A Bachelor's degree in a business or communication-related or equivalent work experience. Technical and engineering education is a plus.  Proficiency in both written and spoken English. Additional language skills are a plus. 


What skills and abilities should you have?

Ability to identify and develop analytics to increase awareness of Gurobi's offerings in the assigned region. Proficiency in delivering presentations and training sessions effectively. Expertise in negotiation to secure favorable outcomes for Gurobi and its clients. Strong conflict resolution skills to protect the customer experience and enhance Gurobi's image. Ability to create compelling value propositions for partners. Proficiency in strategic and analytical thinking to assess decisions' internal and external impact. Aptitude for using data to plan and execute strategies effectively. Comfortable working with international teams in a cross-functional capacity. Satisfaction and ability to operate effectively from a home office in a remote work environment. Willingness to travel as required according to the specified level. Ability to participate in meetings across different time zones within reasonable expectations. Motivated ambition to achieve assigned Objective Key Results (OKRs). Commitment to upholding company policies and procedures. 


What other requirements should you have? 

Advanced-level technical B2B SaaS sales experience: Demonstrated expertise and success in selling B2B software solutions in a technical environment. Fluency with macOS, Microsoft 365, and Power BI: Proficiency in using these tools to effectively manage and analyze data, collaborate, and deliver presentations. Comfortable with learning and utilizing Salesforce: Ability to quickly learn and leverage Salesforce, a widely used customer relationship management (CRM) platform, to effectively manage sales activities and customer interactions. Comfortable working in an international setting and with a US-based company. Where applicable, a valid passport and the ability to obtain necessary international travel documents. 


Your Alignment with our Gurobi Core Values: 

Customer Focus: Verbal & written communication skills that bring clarity and build trust.‚ÄØ Power of the Team: Motivated with a team-oriented mindset that aims to both inspire and be inspired by others. Innovation: The courage to bring ideas forward and see yourself as an integral part of our global team.‚ÄØ Dedication: Organized and agile, focusing on meeting professional objectives while promoting a healthy work/life balance.‚ÄØ Integrity: Promise to uphold honesty as your compass and conduct all business practices with an ethical mindset and fiscal responsibility. 


Gurobi Optimization is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Gurobi Optimization is an E-Verify employer. As part of our hiring process, we utilize the federal E-Verify program to verify the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees. For additional information regarding E-Verify, please visit www.e-verify.gov.

description.text:
Simple Life is the #1 AI-powered health coaching app for adults who want to lose weight and enjoy a healthier lifestyle‚Äîwithout the stress or extremes. Our mission is to empower people to feel their best every day. By challenging traditional, restrictive approaches, Simple offers a more sustainable method grounded in ease, personalization, and real-life support.Simple has had over 17 million downloads and more than 300,000 5-star reviews, having helped millions lose weight successfully and sustainably. Simple has earned recognition as Best Virtual Coach and one of the Top 100 AI companies ‚Äî all thanks to a dedicated global team driving real impact.With SIMPLE as a partner in their pocket, users feel cared for and empowered to embrace ‚Äî and stick to ‚Äî new healthy habits. To learn more, visit simple.life.We are seeking a high-energy, results-driven Influencer Marketing Manager to handle and scale our influencer campaigns across the US & UK markets.This is a remote, full-time position. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a can-do attitude, and can manage high volumes of influencer partnerships, we'd love to hear from you!What You'll do:Develop and execute high-volume influencer campaigns.Manage large-scale influencer collaborations, ensuring strong content performance and brand alignment.Negotiate influencer partnerships, securing the best rates and ROI-driven deals.Track and analyze key performance metrics to optimize campaigns.Foster positive, long-term relationships with influencers for ongoing collaborations.Ensure attention to detail in contracts, content approvals, and campaign execution.Stay ahead of social media trends, algorithm updates, and high-performing content formats.What we look for:Proven experience managing high-scale influencer campaigns in the US & UK markets.Ability to handle multiple influencer activations simultaneously.Strong negotiation skills to secure high-impact partnerships.Data-driven mindset, with the ability to analyze and optimize campaign performance.Positive energy & can-do attitude, thriving in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.Excellent communication and relationship-building abilities.Understanding of social media algorithms.Knowledge of weight loss products or health & wellness is a plus.Nice to Have:Experience with Looker Studio, Superset.Experience with whitelisting and paid social amplification.Familiarity with influencer marketing platforms and tools.


Join us at Simple and make a real impact in the world of health and wellness!

description.text:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: We acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. Thus, our strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

A few examples of your responsibilitiesOwn. Take full ownership of your product‚Äôs marketing strategy. You‚Äôll lead user acquisition end-to-end, from setting goals to launching campaigns and scaling what works to maximize performance.Create. Generate new ad concepts and out-of-the-box growth-hacking ideas, formulate testable hypotheses, coordinate implementation across channels like Google, Meta, and TikTok, and provide sharp feedback to continuously raise the bar.Analyze. Monitor performance through BI dashboards and campaign data. Ensure acquisition efforts achieve target KPIs, and turn insights into bold, data-driven decisions that fuel growth.Collaborate. Work closely with the product team to understand user motivations and help shape monetization and growth strategies that align with user behavior and long-term success.

What we look forReasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offerIncredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.An exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of ¬£66,779 in the UK and ‚Ç¨63,965 elsewhere. For a candidate that we assess as possessing considerable relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between ¬£110,389 and ¬£149,636 in the UK, and ‚Ç¨105,737 and ‚Ç¨143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They‚Äôre challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities‚Äîjust let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you‚Äôve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîto a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It‚Äôs the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We‚Äôll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you‚Äôre welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries‚Äîdepending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you‚Äôre excited to give your best, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to meet you.
