description.text:
With over 30,000 customers, including a third of Fortune 500 companies, Tempo is trusted by organizations across the globe to make their workflows work better.

We create a suite of integrated solutions for time management, resource planning, budget management, roadmapping, program management, reporting and more. We create the tech that enables the modern team to deliver ‚Äì for every step from first vision to value.

Since our beginning in 2007 as a project to make a time-tracking tool to help a client ‚Äì Tempo has expanded to become the #1 time management add-on for Jira, and we have developed and acquired a multitude of tools to become one of the most trusted names in the Atlassian ecosystem.

We want everyone to work better ‚Äì but we also want to be a tech company with a heart. Join us as we continuously innovate our award-winning products, create new solutions, and help the world work smarter, not harder.

About The Role

As an Enterprise Customer Success Manager at Tempo, you‚Äôll be a strategic partner to our largest customers, helping them drive value from our SaaS products that work together as part of an integrated suite of solutions.

In this role, you‚Äôll own direct customer relationships, leading them through adoption and renewal. You‚Äôll work closely with leaders on strategic planning, prioritization, and execution alignment‚Äîwhile also engaging users to ensure effective usage and measurable outcomes. You'll be accountable for commercial performance, including Gross Revenue Retention (GRR) and Net Revenue Retention (NRR), and play a key role in identifying success stories and expansion opportunities.

This is a high-impact role for someone who can move comfortably between executive-level discussions and product-focused adoption work, thrives in fast-changing environments, and has a strong sense of ownership and urgency.

What You‚Äôll Do

Own the post-sale customer lifecycle across a portfolio of enterprise accounts.Lead strategic conversations with stakeholders around planning, prioritization, and value realization using Tempo‚Äôs integrated suite of SaaS products aligned to customer success criteria.Drive GRR and NRR by managing renewals, surfacing expansion opportunities, and proactively mitigating risks.Facilitate regular business reviews and outcome-focused success planning sessions directly with customer champions and decision makers .Work closely with operational users‚Äîsuch as project and program managers, Jira admins, and agile team leads‚Äîto guide adoption and remove friction points in the user base.Deliver best practices aligned to personas, industry and desired future states in portfolio, project and resource management workflows.Accurately forecast renewals and lead commercial discussions in partnership with Sales.Document customer goals, usage trends, risks, and outcomes with discipline and clarity on a continuous basis.Collaborate with Product and Sales to ensure a seamless and unified customer experience.Identify and help craft customer stories and case studies with the goal of highlighting their successes and raising awareness of our solutions.

Who You Are

5+ years SaaS Customer Success or Account Manager with experience managing enterprise customers and owning commercial outcomes.Strong communicator with the ability to persistently and continuously engage both senior business leaders and technical or operational users.Comfortable leading success planning, executive reviews, and renewal negotiations.Knowledge of key personas such as Project/Product/Program Managers, Agile Coaches, Jira Admins, and PMO leaders.Highly organized, proactive, and motivated by customer outcomes and long-term value creation.Embraces change and thrives in a fast-scaling, cross-functional environment.

Why Join Tempo?

Impact: Work on meaningful products that empower enterprise users and improve productivity.Innovation: Be part of a culture that values creativity and innovation, with opportunities to make a real impact.Collaboration: Join a supportive, collaborative UX team that values openness, communication, and a continuous learning environment.Growth: Opportunities for professional development, including conferences, courses, and mentorship.

What's In It For You (Org-wide) -

Remote First work environmentUnlimited vacation in most of our locations!!Great benefits including health, dental, vision and savings plan.Perks such as training reimbursement, WFH reimbursement, and more.Diverse and dynamic teams with challenging and exciting work.An opportunity to have a real impact on our business.A great range of social activities (both in person and virtual).Optional in person meet-ups and the ability to travel to our international officesEmployee referral programAnd so much more!

Note: As our hiring teams are global, please submit your resume in English only

Apply today to join the Tempo team and help shape the future of enterprise productivity software.

Join us at Tempo Software, where we proudly foster an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

jobs.description:
With over 30,000 customers, including a third of Fortune 500 companies, Tempo is trusted by organizations across the globe to make their workflows work better.

We create a suite of integrated solutions for time management, resource planning, budget management, roadmapping, program management, reporting and more. We create the tech that enables the modern team to deliver ‚Äì for every step from first vision to value.

Since our beginning in 2007 as a project to make a time-tracking tool to help a client ‚Äì Tempo has expanded to become the #1 time management add-on for Jira, and we have developed and acquired a multitude of tools to become one of the most trusted names in the Atlassian ecosystem.

We want everyone to work better ‚Äì but we also want to be a tech company with a heart. Join us as we continuously innovate our award-winning products, create new solutions, and help the world work smarter, not harder.

About The Role

As an Enterprise Customer Success Manager at Tempo, you‚Äôll be a strategic partner to our largest customers, helping them drive value from our SaaS products that work together as part of an integrated suite of solutions.

In this role, you‚Äôll own direct customer relationships, leading them through adoption and renewal. You‚Äôll work closely with leaders on strategic planning, prioritization, and execution alignment‚Äîwhile also engaging users to ensure effective usage and measurable outcomes. You'll be accountable for commercial performance, including Gross Revenue Retention (GRR) and Net Revenue Retention (NRR), and play a key role in identifying success stories and expansion opportunities.

This is a high-impact role for someone who can move comfortably between executive-level discussions and product-focused adoption work, thrives in fast-changing environments, and has a strong sense of ownership and urgency.

What You‚Äôll Do

Own the post-sale customer lifecycle across a portfolio of enterprise accounts.Lead strategic conversations with stakeholders around planning, prioritization, and value realization using Tempo‚Äôs integrated suite of SaaS products aligned to customer success criteria.Drive GRR and NRR by managing renewals, surfacing expansion opportunities, and proactively mitigating risks.Facilitate regular business reviews and outcome-focused success planning sessions directly with customer champions and decision makers .Work closely with operational users‚Äîsuch as project and program managers, Jira admins, and agile team leads‚Äîto guide adoption and remove friction points in the user base.Deliver best practices aligned to personas, industry and desired future states in portfolio, project and resource management workflows.Accurately forecast renewals and lead commercial discussions in partnership with Sales.Document customer goals, usage trends, risks, and outcomes with discipline and clarity on a continuous basis.Collaborate with Product and Sales to ensure a seamless and unified customer experience.Identify and help craft customer stories and case studies with the goal of highlighting their successes and raising awareness of our solutions.

Who You Are

5+ years SaaS Customer Success or Account Manager with experience managing enterprise customers and owning commercial outcomes.Strong communicator with the ability to persistently and continuously engage both senior business leaders and technical or operational users.Comfortable leading success planning, executive reviews, and renewal negotiations.Knowledge of key personas such as Project/Product/Program Managers, Agile Coaches, Jira Admins, and PMO leaders.Highly organized, proactive, and motivated by customer outcomes and long-term value creation.Embraces change and thrives in a fast-scaling, cross-functional environment.

Why Join Tempo?

Impact: Work on meaningful products that empower enterprise users and improve productivity.Innovation: Be part of a culture that values creativity and innovation, with opportunities to make a real impact.Collaboration: Join a supportive, collaborative UX team that values openness, communication, and a continuous learning environment.Growth: Opportunities for professional development, including conferences, courses, and mentorship.

What's In It For You (Org-wide) -

Remote First work environmentUnlimited vacation in most of our locations!!Great benefits including health, dental, vision and savings plan.Perks such as training reimbursement, WFH reimbursement, and more.Diverse and dynamic teams with challenging and exciting work.An opportunity to have a real impact on our business.A great range of social activities (both in person and virtual).Optional in person meet-ups and the ability to travel to our international officesEmployee referral programAnd so much more!

Note: As our hiring teams are global, please submit your resume in English only

Apply today to join the Tempo team and help shape the future of enterprise productivity software.

Join us at Tempo Software, where we proudly foster an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

description.text:
We are looking for a Partner / CEO to help develop our mission and grow the company.
B3Data is a digital construction startup building an online platform to create and update 3D BIM models and securely store building data with AI support. Our goal: make construction and property management more efficient, sustainable, and accessible.
What You'll DoShape vision, strategy, and partnerships in construction and smart citiesSupport product growth and adoption of our platformBuild relationships with stakeholders across the industryAdvance our social mission: workforce inclusion through digital innovation
Who We're Looking ForWe welcome everyone ‚Äî from motivated students to experienced professionals. What matters most is your drive to innovate and collaborate.Experience in BIM, CAD, AI, data, or business development is valuable.
Why join?Be part of a mission-driven startupBuild the future of digital construction and smart citiesWork in a flexible, inclusive, and impact-oriented environment
Interested? Reach out at contact@b3data.com

description.text:
Budget: 700

About Us

Marble is a fintech infrastructure startup, backed by VCs and Hexa.

We build a groundbreaking open-source decision engine for banks, payment service providers and marketplaces.

The Opportunity: Your Mission

As our first dedicated Product Designer, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the user experience of a powerful, data-rich platform from the ground up. Your mission is to translate the complexity of fraud detection and investigation into a simple, intuitive, and powerful interface for our users. You'll work directly with the founders to set the design vision and create a product that not only looks good but empowers financial institutions to make critical decisions with confidence.

What You'll Do

Own the end-to-end design process, from wireframes and user flows to high-fidelity mockups and interactive prototypes.Design intuitive dashboards, complex data visualizations, and streamlined workflows for new and existing features (approx. 2/3 of your time).Elevate and unify our existing product experience, focusing on improving navigation, usability, and overall UX.Build, maintain, and extend our Design System in Figma to ensure consistency and accelerate development.Collaborate closely with the CEO, CTO, and two front-end developers in a tight feedback loop, balancing user needs, technical constraints, and business goals.

Who We're Looking For: Skills & Experience

A Proven B2B/SaaS Designer: You have a strong portfolio with a proven track record of designing complex, user-facing web applications. Experience with enterprise software, analytics dashboards, or the fintech/banking sector is a significant plus.A UX Strategist: You excel at making the complex simple. You design interfaces that don't just look good but feel intuitive, and you obsess over edge cases to create a robust user experience.A Figma Pro: You are highly proficient with modern Figma practices, including auto-layout, variants, and creating scalable Design Systems.A Pragmatic Collaborator: You thrive working hand-in-hand with developers. You know how to communicate design decisions clearly, give and receive constructive feedback, and find pragmatic solutions.Detail-Oriented: You can design for a range of screen sizes (desktop-focused) and are mindful of challenges like internationalization.Team Player: You're willing to occasionally assist with visual assets for our website or blog to ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints.

How We Work At Marble

We are a small, lean team of seasoned industry experts with the ambition to remake anti-fraud from the bottom up.We plan for the long game but focus on fast value. We choose the simplest solution and iterate quickly. We compromise on feature breadth rather than security or usability.We are opinionated, but set our ego aside. We discuss, commit, execute.We are pragmatic and we execute fast on our decisions. We are perseverant when facing challenges but review plans if we hit a roadblock.We excel at our job but work beyond our field of expertise. No task is below us.We always take ownership - but also know when to share it.We value output over input. We allow for flexibility and optimize for focus time.

The Details

Engagement: Part-time freelance contract, starting at 2 days/week.Duration: 6+ months, with the potential to increase to 3+ days/week as we grow.Location: Remote, within a UTC+0 to UTC+4 time zone (approx. +-2 hours from Paris).Compensation: We offer a competitive freelance rate based on your experience. Let us know your expectations.

Organization

We are looking for a part-time position, 2 days a week, for 6 months+.Depending on team growth, we may need to increase to 3 days+/week in the medium term.We are ok for remote work for this part-time position, at +- 2 hours of Paris time.Compensation based on experience and region

Hiring Process

Portfolio Review: We'll review your application and portfolio.Introductory Chat (30 min): A call with our CTO to discuss your experience, our mission, and the role.Paid & Practical Work Assignment (~3 hours): A small, well-defined design task that reflects our daily challenges. We respect your time and expertise, so this assignment is compensated.Final Discussion & Offer.

You know how to communicate design decisions clearly, give and receive constructive feedback, and find pragmatic solutions.Detail-Oriented: You can design for a range of screen sizes (desktop-focused) and are mindful of challenges like internationalization.Team Player: You're willing to occasionally assist with visual assets for our website or blog to ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints.

How We Work At Marble

We are a small, lean team of seasoned industry experts with the ambition to remake anti-fraud from the bottom up.We plan for the long game but focus on fast value. We choose the simplest solution and iterate quickly. We compromise on feature breadth rather than security or usability.We are opinionated, but set our ego aside. We discuss, commit, execute.We are pragmatic and we execute fast on our decisions. We are perseverant when facing challenges but review plans if we hit a roadblock.We excel at our job but work beyond our field of expertise. No task is below us.We always take ownership - but also know when to share it.We value output over input. We allow for flexibility and optimize for focus time.

The Details

Engagement: Part-time freelance contract, starting at 2 days/week.Duration: 6+ months, with the potential to increase to 3+ days/week as we grow.Location: Remote, within a UTC+0 to UTC+4 time zone (approx. +-2 hours from Paris).Compensation: We offer a competitive freelance rate based on your experience. Let us know your expectations.

Organization

We are looking for a part-time position, 2 days a week, for 6 months+.Depending on team growth, we may need to increase to 3 days+/week in the medium term.We are ok for remote work for this part-time position, at +- 2 hours of Paris time.Compensation based on experience and region

Hiring Process

Portfolio Review: We'll review your application and portfolio.Introductory Chat (30 min): A call with our CTO to discuss your experience, our mission, and the role.Paid & Practical Work Assignment (~3 hours): A small, well-defined design task that reflects our daily challenges. We respect your time and expertise, so this assignment is compensated.Final Discussion & Offer.

description.text:
About Remote

Remote is solving modern organizations‚Äô biggest challenge ‚Äì navigating global employment compliantly with ease. We make it possible for businesses of all sizes to recruit, pay, and manage international teams. With our core values at heart and future focused work culture, our team works tirelessly on ambitious problems, asynchronously, around the world. You can find Remoters working from 6 different continents (Antarctica left to go!) and all of our positions are fully remote.

We encourage every member of the Remote team to bring their talents, experiences and culture to the table to help us build the best-in-class HR platform.

If you are energetic, curious, motivated and ambitious, be part of our world. Apply now and define the future of work!

What you bring

A solid understanding of payment networks, the mechanics behind payments settlement andExperience working within the bounds of regulatory and compliance requirementsExperience integrating third party payment service providersDemonstrated ability to operate effectively in intense startup or scale-up environments, navigating ambiguity and driving clear outcomesStrong track record of influencing and improving company-wide business metrics through strategic product decisions.A flair for user experience design - you build things beautifully, and they delight customersExecution-oriented, ambitious, and ready to scale your career with RemoteA high agency, low ego mindsetWrites and speaks fluent EnglishIt's not required to have experience working remotely, but considered a plus


Key Responsibilities

Develop and optimize global payroll payments solutionsCollaborate with Design and Engineering to create intuitive and user-friendly payment flowsWork with product teams across Remote to ensure salary payments happen on time, every timeEnsure seamless integration with third-party payment providers.Partner with compliance and legal teams to ensure all payment features meet regulatory requirementsFunction effectively across teams, working closely with stakeholders in Operations, Risk, Tax, Legal


Practicals

You'll report to: Group Product ManagerTeam: Payments - Payroll PaymentsTeam size:Location: For this position we welcome everyone to apply, but we will prioritise applications from the following locations as we encourage our teams to diversify: EMEA, APACStart date: As soon as possible


Remote Compensation Philosophy

Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

The base salary range for this full-time position is $45,750 - $128,650. USD. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

Application process

Interview with recruiterInterview with future managerInterview with team members (no managers present)Bar Raiser InterviewPrior employment verification check 


Remote's Total Rewards philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased compensation and fair equity pay along with competitive benefits in all locations in which we operate. We do not agree to or encourage cheap-labor practices and therefore we ensure to pay above in-location rates. We hope to inspire other companies to support global talent-hiring and bring local wealth to developing countries.

At first glance our salary bands seem quite wide - here is some context. At Remote we have international operations and a globally distributed workforce. We use geo ranges to consider geographic pay differentials as part of our global compensation strategy to remain competitive in various markets while we hiring globally.

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location, and our job titles may span more than one career level. The actual base pay for the successful candidate in this role is dependent upon many factors such as location, transferable or job-related skills, work experience, relevant training, business needs, and market demands. The base salary range may be subject to change.

At Remote, we foster internal mobility as a key element of our culture of employee growth and development, supported by a compensation philosophy that guarantees pay equity and fairness. Therefore, all compensation changes associated with an internal move will be reviewed by the Total Rewards & People Enablement team on a case by case basis.

The annual salary range for this full-time position is

$45,750‚Äî$128,650 USD

Benefits

Our full benefits & perks are explained in our handbook at remote.com/r/benefits. As a global company, each country works differently, but some benefits/perks are for all Remoters:

work from anywhereflexible paid time offflexible working hours (we are async)16 weeks paid parental leavemental health support servicesstock optionslearning budgethome office budget & IT equipmentbudget for local in-person social events or co-working spaces


How You‚Äôll Plan Your Day (and Life)

We work async at Remote which means you can plan your schedule around your life (and not around meetings). Read more at remote.com/async.

You will be empowered to take ownership and be proactive. When in doubt you will default to action instead of waiting. Your life-work balance is important and you will be encouraged to put yourself and your family first, and fit work around your needs.

If that sounds like something you want, apply now!

How To Apply

Please fill out the form below and upload your CV with a PDF format.We kindly ask you to submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardised language we use here at Remote.If you don‚Äôt have an up to date CV but you are still interested in talking to us, please feel free to add a copy of your LinkedIn profile instead.


Not only do we encourage folks from all ethnic groups, genders, sexuality, age, abilities, disability status and any other under-represented group to apply, but we prioritize a sense of belonging. We have 4 ERGs (Women, Disability, Queer, Minorities in Tech) who meet regularly with the People team. During your interviews and beyond, we ask & encourage anybody who needs an accommodation to request one from their recruiter.

We will ask you to voluntarily tell us your pronouns at interview stage, and you will have the option to answer our anonymous demographic questionnaire when you apply below. As an equal employment opportunity employer it‚Äôs important to us that our workforce reflects people of all backgrounds, identities, and experiences and this data will help us to stay accountable. We thank you for providing this data, if you chose to.

At Remote, we embrace AI as a valuable tool while prioritizing human creativity and authenticity. We look forward to meeting candidates who balance innovation with genuine expertise and experience. To learn more about Remote's AI guidelines check see here.

Please note we accept applications on an ongoing basis.

description.text:
About the Company:CGK Linens is a leading US-based eCommerce company specializing in high-quality bedding products. With a strong commitment to delivering exceptional customer experiences, we manage complex international logistics operations to ensure our products reach customers worldwide efficiently.
About the Role:We are looking to hire an experienced and motivated Amazon PPC Manager to lead our digital advertising initiatives. The ideal candidate will bring a unique blend of a strategic mindset, analytical acumen, and a hands-on approach to Amazon advertising. If you are a results-oriented PPC professional with a passion for driving digital success while thriving in a fun and fast-paced work culture, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity to shape the future of our company‚Äôs growth.
This role is a Full-Time remote position.
We are looking for an Amazon PPC Manager, specifically with these requirements:Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.Proven experience of 2-3 years successfully managing Amazon PPC campaigns and paid advertising.Comfortable working in a fast-paced e-commerce environment.Expertise in Amazon Seller Central.Experience with Amazon PPC Bulk Operations.Excellent analytical skills and ability to interpret data.Prior experience managing large budgets (500k min monthly ad spend).Prior experience managing large catalogs (500 SKUs minimum).Strong understanding of KPIs and online marketing.Must be available to work full-time (9 am - 5 pm EST - or similar).Availability to meet the team when needed.
Your responsibility will include (but not be limited to):Manage and optimize Amazon PPC campaigns to achieve business goals.Conduct keyword research and analysis to identify high-impact keywords.Monitor campaign performance and make data-driven decisions to maximize ROI.Deep understanding of all ad types.Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in Amazon advertising.Incredibly organized and self-motivated.
Growth Opportunities/Perks:Paid Holidays (will vary depending on country of residence).Paid Time Off.Location independent/fully remote role.Be part of a team that has a lot of freedom for people to be left to their own devices and perform great work.
This Position Is Perfect For You If‚Ä¶
You're an Analytical and Detailed-Oriented Problem Solver.Possesses robust analytical skills with a meticulous approach to problem-solving. Demonstrates a keen attention to detail, adept at identifying inefficiencies in strategies, and excels in crafting creative solutions based on thorough analysis and observations.
You're an Excellent Communicator.Possesses exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal skills. Demonstrates the ability to articulate complex topics clearly and concisely, ensuring effective communication and delivering the highest level of service to our clients.
You‚Äôre a Team Player.Radiates positivity and friendliness, embodying an optimistic outlook. Enjoys collaboration and excels in communication across various platforms, including regular weekly video calls. Possesses the ability to self-motivate and inspire the team to strive for excellence and achieve outstanding results.
Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time to a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

basic_info.title: Responsable D√©veloppement R√©seau National | Head of Development ‚Äì Pizza Hut France

description.text:
About Us

With over 60 years of history and 18,000+ restaurants in 100+ countries, Pizza Hut is the world‚Äôs largest pizza brand - and we‚Äôre still growing.

In France, we‚Äôre entering an exciting new chapter. With 124 restaurants already operating and a bold five-year expansion plan underway, we‚Äôre scaling fast and reinventing how we serve modern French customers - through delivery, dine-in, and innovative formats like the Slice Model.

Pizza Hut France is part of the International Operating Markets (IOM) cluster, alongside the UK, Ireland, and Canada. That means we operate with the agility of a local business, while benefiting from global strategy, tools, and investment. Our model is built around franchise partnerships, and we work hand-in-hand with our operators to grow sustainably and strategically.

As a proud member of Yum! Brands - alongside KFC, Taco Bell, and The Habit Burger Grill - we‚Äôre backed by the world‚Äôs largest restaurant group and united by a shared purpose: to unlock unmatched customer experiences, wherever people choose to eat.

Job Purpose

We‚Äôre looking for a bold, strategic development leader to take Pizza Hut‚Äôs growth in France to the next level. You'll shape our national expansion, roll out innovative formats like the Slice Model, and build a thriving network of high-performing franchise partners.

This role is known internally as Head of Development - Pizza Hut France and reports directly to the General Manager.

As Responsable D√©veloppement R√©seau National - Pizza Hut France, you will be at the forefront of our transformation journey - defining and executing the development strategy to unlock sustainable growth in one of Pizza Hut‚Äôs top-priority international markets.

You‚Äôll combine the autonomy and agility of a scale-up with the backing of Yum! Brands, the world‚Äôs largest restaurant group. This is a rare opportunity to drive real impact, fast-track innovation, and shape the future of an iconic global brand in a French market ripe for disruption.

Key Responsibilities

Development Strategy & Execution


Define and lead Pizza Hut France‚Äôs long-term restaurant development roadmap, aligned to brand vision, market dynamics, and consumer trends.Build and deliver a robust pipeline of new restaurant openings across priority growth zones, ensuring capital efficiency and brand compliance.Own the annual development plan and performance targets, driving cross-functional accountability for results.


Format Innovation - Including the Slice Model


Lead the rollout of innovative restaurant formats (e.g., Slice Model, delivery/takeaway-only, small-box), ensuring strong commercial, operational, and customer outcomes.Collaborate with local and global teams across Operations, Marketing, and Design to optimize formats and accelerate scalable growth.


Franchisee Growth & Business Development


Build and nurture a strong network of franchise partners to drive accelerated growth across core and emerging territories.Lead the recruitment, onboarding, and development of new franchisees who align with Pizza Hut‚Äôs values and growth ambitions.Act as a strategic advisor to franchise partners - supporting site selection, investment decision-making, and long-term portfolio planning.


 Market Planning & Real Estate Development


Lead strategic market planning using data, geospatial insights, and trade area analysis to identify high-potential locations.Oversee site selection and approval processes across all formats, balancing speed, ROI, and long-term market fit.Partner with real estate and construction teams to ensure timely, cost-effective delivery of new sites.


Cross-Functional & Commercial Leadership


Collaborate closely with Finance, Legal, Franchising, Construction, and Operations to deliver seamless development execution.Lead commercial deal-making and investment case development where needed, ensuring alignment with franchise business models and capital planning. 


Candidate Profile


Senior-level experience in restaurant, retail, or franchise development, ideally within QSR or multi-site environments.Proven success in network expansion and format innovation.Strong knowledge of the French real estate market, including property acquisition, lease negotiations, and zoning frameworks.Commercial acumen and ability to build compelling investment cases.Fluent in both French and English, with experience operating in matrix or global organizations.Customer-first, brand-savvy, and innovation-driven.Leadership Capabilities 
Strategic Vision: Sees the big picture and charts bold pathways for national brand expansion.Entrepreneurial Drive: Takes ownership, thrives in ambiguity, and leads with agility.Collaborative Leadership: Builds strong relationships across internal teams and external partners.Customer-First Mindset: Obsessed with delivering modern, accessible, and high-impact guest experiences.Growth Enabler: Invests in franchisee capabilities, building for long-term market success.

Preferred Experience


Background in a franchise-led business or working with franchise partners.Familiarity with Yum! system or large-scale QSR operations.Experience scaling non-traditional formats such as delivery/carryout, small-box, or hybrid restaurant models.


Working Relationships


Line manager: General Manager, France Other RSC Departments UK, Germany and Canada Development teamsPizza Hut Global Development teams UK & European Franchisee Partners 


Work Environment

Flexible working with regular travel expected to Paris (La Defense) and priority development markets.

Pizza Hut France is at a transformational moment. Backed by the global scale of Yum! Brands and empowered by a refreshed French strategy, we are expanding our footprint, rethinking our formats, and growing with the right franchise partners. As Responsable D√©veloppement R√©seau National, you will be at the center of this journey - driving growth strategy, launching scalable innovation like the Slice Model, and shaping the brand‚Äôs national presence.

We offer the agility of a scale-up with the backing of a global powerhouse, making this the ideal role for a strategic builder ready to lead visible, lasting impact in the French market.

Beware of fake job postings using Yum! and/or our brand logos -- KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell and Habit Burger & Grill -- on fraudulent sites. Yum! Brands only posts jobs on official career pages and never asks for money during onboarding. Avoid unsolicited contacts via Telegram, WhatsApp or similar social apps.

Pizza Hut France is at a transformational moment. Backed by the global scale of Yum! Brands and empowered by a refreshed French strategy, we are expanding our footprint, rethinking our formats, and growing with the right franchise partners. As Responsable D√©veloppement R√©seau National, you will be at the center of this journey - driving growth strategy, launching scalable innovation like the Slice Model, and shaping the brand‚Äôs national presence.

We offer the agility of a scale-up with the backing of a global powerhouse, making this the ideal role for a strategic builder ready to lead visible, lasting impact in the French market.

Beware of fake job postings using Yum! and/or our brand logos -- KFC, Pizza Hut, Taco Bell and Habit Burger & Grill -- on fraudulent sites. Yum! Brands only posts jobs on official career pages and never asks for money during onboarding. Avoid unsolicited contacts via Telegram, WhatsApp or similar social apps.

description.text:
Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.

At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We're not just any public company ‚Äì we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.

As a Work Anywhere company, we support your flexibility to work from home or in the office, so you can thrive in your ideal environment.

Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

Business Consulting at Veeva is a unique group fusing strategy and technology inside a company at the forefront of digital innovation in Life Sciences; establishing a leading Business Consulting practice is a strategic priority for Veeva, with high visibility within the company and to leaders of the wider Life Sciences industry.

As a Principal Consultant, you will help grow this practice in Europe, with a focus on building our brand in the market, developing our customer network, and identifying and selling new projects to support our customers to deliver on their more complex and strategic business issues.

Opportunities are available across Europe for this role as this is a remote position. here is no work location requirement if a candidate is in proximity to an airport and able to meet travel requirements. ualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the EU (for EU locations) and the UK (for UK based candidates).

What You‚Äôll Do

Lead business development opportunities ‚Äì identify and generate new project opportunities, clarify the customer‚Äôs issues and needs, be able to develop a compelling, differentiated proposal to solve these issues, and win new workLeverage your network to identify opportunities and, develop our business, and build new relationshipsBe the business consulting lead on one of our top enterprise accounts Build strong, trusted relationships with customers, serving as a primary contact for strategic questionsSupport in the creation of new campaigns, offerings, and thought leadership that differentiate Business Consulting in the marketLead multiple project engagement teams ‚Äì empowering the team to plan and manage all aspects of delivery, from scope to quality assurance 

Requirements

Significant management and strategy consulting experience (at least ten years)Experience in the Health and Life Sciences, particularly in the Commercial and Medical areaAn extensive network of stakeholders within leadership positions in Top 20 Life Science companiesCredibility and experience to operate and engage at Senior levels with our Life Sciences customersProven track record of developing new, high-value customer engagementsDemonstrated experience in designing and implementing digital transformation and commercial improvement programsDeep understanding across the entire Commercial value chain with recognized mastery in two or more of the following areas: Brand strategy, product launch, go-to-market strategy, commercial model design, key account planning and management, segmentation and targeting, multi-channel strategy and optimization, insight, and analytics 

Nice to Have

Fluency in multiple European languages (German, French, or Spanish) in addition to English Experience with digital technologies ‚Äì channels, analytics tools, emerging techGood understanding of Veeva's broader platforms and solutions and how these can be leveraged and enhanced by commercial consulting servicesExperience working with SaaS solutions

Perks & Benefits

Highly competitive remunerationOpportunity for rapid progressionHealth & wellness programs

BCCommStrategy

Veeva‚Äôs headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.

As an equal opportunity employer, Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams.

If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

basic_info.title: Charg√©e de Marketing Op√©rationnel Rabanne Americas - H/F

description.text:
Description du poste :

 The International Operational Marketing Executive facilitates the operational & strategic integration between the brand & the markets, ensure flawless communication between the brand & the markets. He promotes the perspectives of growth for the brand in markets.  Scope: Americas Ce que vous aurez √† faire 1. Contribute to Marketing Plan elaboration
- Have in-depth knowledge of brand performance in the markets to provide starting discussion point with the International marketing development team and assess brand needs
- Follow monthly brand net revenues & sell-out performance for markets
- Elaboration of Annual Brand Performance Book 
- Provide feedback & challenge the brand & markets for the next year Marketing Plan
- Help Brand to gather specific market analysis on specific business issues (competition range extensions, retail trends), in order to contribute to resolve marketing plan key decisions (on Promo, GWPs, sets‚Ä¶)
- Responsible for developing Brand and Launch guidelines

 2. Manage the worldwide brand animation: 
- Gather local marketing plans for all markets to have general view of the brand¬¥s activities
- Support Local teams in the elaboration and implementation of their landed marketing plans & launch strategies. And follow-up of the local media plans.
- Propose and coordinate tailor-made/tactical local projects, in a test & learn approach to be then roll-out in other markets
- Contact point for IMR approvals and requests that are under Brand Team responsibility 
- Manage the local requests and assures rest of brand‚Äôs team collaboration / validation when required
- Insure the global coherency for all the elements of a 360¬∞ strategy (Retail, Digital, communication, development teams)
  3. Communication and Coordination 
- Coordinate with all internal departments all deliverables related to Marketing plans (Annual Brand book, Launch book, tailor-made animation guidelines, mock-ups, lab samples etc‚Ä¶) to assure accuracy, homogeneity and deadlines 
- Send Brand communications to markets about Marketing plans, Launch plans updates and retailer‚Äôs presentations 
- Guarantee market alignment and knowledge exchange by proactively contacting local marketing teams and sharing relevant information

 4. Insights and Best Practices
- Produce Launch Reports: consolidating individual reports into a single document 
- Cross-Region fertilization (best practices or special requests) amongst markets 
- Aware of specific needs per region (retailer profile, legal restrictions)   
5. Operations oriented activities 
- CPS analysis: challenge consolidated region figures vs brand expectations. Back & forth with internal teams (marketing development & engineers).
- CPS analysis: referent participant of CPS meeting
- Catalogue maintenance: product line by market and exceptions
- Define Launch guidelines retro-timing, in accordance with CNP: deadlines and responsibilities 
6. Retail Expertise
- Gather retail trends & shopping experience analysis on a regular basis (competition best practices, innovation, art of gifting, animation trends‚Ä¶), to improve brand‚Äôs visibility & shopping experience
- Follow-up of brand‚Äôs distribution & permanent visibility template with key markets informatio   

Description du profil :

 Experience: 
At least 2-3 years of experience in operational or trade marketing, in international or local positions, ideally acquired in the beauty industry. 
Education:
Master Degree, major in Marketing ideal
 
Languages:
French and English fluent, Spanish would be a plus.
 
 Competencies:
- Strong knowledge of USA/LATAM markets and trends 
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with strong leadership
- Ability to manage operational project keeping a very strategic and logn-term vision
- Result-oriented, self-starter personality with an interest to propose and test new ideas
- Very curious, polyvalent and autonomous
- Strong analytical and project management skills;
- Flexible and reactive, good management of stress
- Olfactive, Fashion and/or Design sensibility  

Nous proposons :

 An entrepreneurial, creative and welcoming work culture Opportunities for learning and development An international company with many opportunities for career development Competitive compensation and benefits

description.text:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.

The Team:

Celonis Services is a strategic services organization that focuses on the technical aspects of our customers' journeys, which includes Consulting Services, Academy and Customer Support. We are thought leaders with deep product, technical and domain expertise and focus on delivering Celonis implementations and driving product adoption for our customers. We achieve this by bringing together our best practices, delivery experience, award-winning enablement, and support expertise.

The Role:

As a Senior Project Manager at Celonis, you will lead the end-to-end delivery of complex, high-impact projects for our largest customers. You will partner closely with Sales, Value Engineering, and Product & Engineering teams to deploy our platform, identify and frame business value opportunities, create tailored solutions, and enable sustainable value realization for our customers.

From early pre-sales discussions through the full project lifecycle, you will ensure the quality and impact of our work -pushing for continuous innovation including through the adoption of AI-driven capabilities- while managing execution and aligning stakeholders. You‚Äôll play a critical role in delivering outcomes that matter and ensuring every project contributes to customers satisfaction and long-term success.

The work you‚Äôll do:

Structuring and planning end-to-end projects, including scope, timeline, resources and deliverables, based on Celonis value-driven methodologiesOrganizing and monitoring project execution, coordinating contributions across Celonis teams, ensuring on-time delivery at the right quality levelManaging relationships with client teams as the primary point of contact (senior executives, project managers, process owners and technical teams‚Ä¶), securing a progressive handoverLeading project governance, reporting on progress, risks and value opportunities, facilitating decision-making by Celonis management and client sponsorsProviding guidance and mentoring to the Services team to ensure delivery consistency and consultants developmentSupporting pre-sales efforts by contributing to opportunity framing, defining implementation approaches, and co-writing proposals and statements of workDriving internal continuous improvement by feeding field learnings back into Celonis Services delivery templates, methodologies, and best practices

The qualifications you need:

A minimum of 6 years' experience managing complex projects with both business and technical dimensions, in a consulting or professional services environmentProven ability to manage multiple workstreams, onshore/offshore teams, and various clients stakeholder groups, from executive to operational levelsStrong track record of ‚Äúcontent-oriented‚Äù project management, delivering measurable outcomesDemonstrated expertise in pre-sales collaboration, opportunity qualification and proposal developmentRelevant certifications (e.g., Agile/Scrum, PMP, Prince2, Lean Six Sigma) and a passion for driving operational excellenceExperience in core business transformation, supply chain optimization, and AI-based performance improvement is highly appreciatedNative level of French

What Celonis Can Offer You:

Pioneer Innovation: Work with the leading, award-winning process mining technology, shaping the future of business.Accelerate Your Growth: Benefit from clear career paths, internal mobility, a dedicated learning program, and mentorship opportunities.Receive Exceptional Benefits: Including generous PTO, hybrid working options, company equity (RSUs), comprehensive benefits, extensive parental leave, dedicated volunteer days, and much more. Interns and working students explore your benefits here.Prioritize Your Well-being: Access to resources such as gym subsidies, counseling, and well-being programs.Connect and Belong: Find community and support through dedicated inclusion and belonging programs.Make Meaningful Impact: Be part of a company driven by strong values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future.Collaborate Globally: Join a dynamic, international team of talented individuals.Empowered Environment: Contribute your ideas in an open culture with autonomous teams.

About Us:

Celonis makes processes work for people, companies and the planet. The Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses industry-leading process mining and AI technology and augments it with business context to give customers a living digital twin of their business operation. It‚Äôs system-agnostic and without bias, and provides everyone with a common language for understanding and improving businesses. Celonis enables its customers to continuously realize significant value across the top, bottom, and green line. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.

Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.

Celonis Inclusion Statement:

At Celonis, we believe our people make us who we are and that ‚ÄúThe Best Team Wins‚Äù. We know that the best teams are made up of people who bring different perspectives to the table. And when everyone feels included, able to speak up and knows their voice is heard - that's when creativity and innovation happen.

Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis‚Äô Accessibility and Candidate Notices

By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.

Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

description.text:
Join Hostinger and we‚Äôll grow fast! üöÄ

Is there a limit to growth? Not at Hostinger.

We‚Äôre constantly reaching new heights. With a team of 900 professionals, we are behind the success of over 4 million clients in 150 countries, helping them launch their e-shops, blogs, portfolios, businesses, and passion projects.

Our mission: To build world-class solutions for anyone to easily succeed online

Our culture: Guided by 10 company principles

Our formula for success: Customer obsession, innovative products, and talented teams.

Your role at Hostinger

Country manager in the international growth team. As part of Hostinger's international growth team, you'll be responsible for growing Hostinger‚Äôs market share in the France. Your skills and experience:


Proven experience and a deep understanding of the France marketSkilled in analyzing customer needs, market trends, and the competitive landscapeProficient in setting country-level goals, evaluating opportunities, and formulating market entry or expansion strategiesExperienced in managing budgets, optimizing LTV/CAC, ROAS, and ensuring profitabilityAdept at identifying effective channels, driving revenue growth, and executing go-to-market strategiesCapable of overseeing execution, managing cross-functional teams, and ensuring operational efficiencyExperienced in building partnerships, collaborating with internal and external stakeholders, and managing contractsSkilled in navigating market challenges, regulatory changes, and business uncertaintiesEffective at presenting ideas, aligning teams, and advocating for business prioritiesProficient in leveraging analytics and insights to enhance business performance

üöÄ 360 Growth: We provide limitless learning opportunities: access to platforms like Reforge and Scribd, global conferences, feedback culture, digital libraries and industry-leading subscriptions. With a home office budget, you can elevate your workspace. Enjoy the flexibility to manage your schedule while bringing your ideas to life in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentüí™Wellness Simplified: Your health comes first with company-provided sick days, 20 paid suspension days, and recharge leave. description.text:
Job Opportunity: Marketing Director ‚Äì Global Pharma (Life Sciences)
Sector: Life Sciences | Specialization: Pharmaceutical Manufacturing / Contamination ControlAre you a strategic marketing leader with a passion for innovation in the pharmaceutical industry?
An established global player in the Life Sciences sector is seeking a Marketing Director ‚Äì Global Pharma to lead its international marketing strategy for contamination control solutions in pharmaceutical manufacturing environments.
This is a high-impact leadership role, perfect for a results-driven professional who thrives at the intersection of strategy, innovation, and execution. You'll shape global go-to-market strategies, oversee portfolio development, and lead a high-performing team across key regions.
What You‚Äôll Do:As Marketing Director ‚Äì Global Pharma, you will:üåç Strategic LeadershipDevelop and execute long-term marketing strategies for the global pharmaceutical segment in alignment with executive leadership.Define customer segmentation, market positioning, and competitive differentiation.Identify inorganic growth opportunities (e.g., partnerships, M&A) to support market expansion.üß™ Portfolio & Innovation ManagementOversee the global portfolio of contamination control solutions for pharmaceutical manufacturers.Drive the innovation pipeline in collaboration with R&D, Regulatory, and Technical teams.Manage the full product lifecycle, including global launches, phase-ins/outs, and updates driven by compliance.üöÄ Commercial ActivationCollaborate with Sales, Regional Marketing, and Communications teams to drive brand awareness and lead generation through effective campaigns and customer engagement strategies.Ensure a consistent value proposition and aligned messaging across all markets.üìä Customer & Market InsightMaintain deep knowledge of customer workflows, market dynamics, and the competitive landscape.Lead market research and customer insight initiatives.Build strategic relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and support thought leadership efforts.üë• Team LeadershipLead and develop a global team of 8+ marketers, fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and innovation.Provide mentorship and drive cross-functional alignment between Portfolio, Commercial, and Segment teams.What You BringAdvanced degree (MBA or MSc in Marketing, Chemistry, Microbiology, or related field).10+ years of experience in the pharmaceutical or life sciences manufacturing industry.8+ years in marketing or related leadership roles, with proven success in global B2B environments.Experience managing large, diverse, and international teams.Ability to turn complex strategy into clear, actionable plans with measurable outcomes.Strong commercial acumen, with a track record of leading successful product launches and market expansions.Outstanding communication, analytical, and cross-functional collaboration skills.Comfortable in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with a strong sense of ownership and urgency.
Why Join?Shape global strategy in a critical growth area of the life sciences industry.Join a mission-driven organization focused on supporting safe medicines and cleaner production environments.Work in a collaborative environment with strong support from sales, technical, and digital teams across multiple global hubs.Make a measurable impact on a rapidly growing segment and develop your leadership career on an international stage.
Ready to lead the future of pharma marketing on a global scale?
Apply now to take the next bold step in your career.
All applications will be handled in strict confidence.

basic_info.title: Head of Marketing (EMEA, United Kingdom, Ireland)

description.text:
About The Role

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity‚Äîand a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we‚Äôve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people‚Äôs lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many. This is a future with more voices rather than fewer.

About The Role

We are searching for a marketing leader to drive our up-market growth across the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region. As the Head of Marketing, EMEA, you will lead marketing's contribution to our regional business goals.

This is a pivotal leadership role. You will sit on the EMEA Senior Leadership Team (SLT), serving as the voice of marketing and a key architect of our regional strategy. You will lead through a combination of direct team management and cross-functional influence to ensure Marketing exceeds its overall pipeline goals. Your mission is clear: build a world-class marketing function that delivers predictable, scalable pipeline and drives revenue.

What You'll Do

Set the Regional Strategy: As a member of the EMEA SLT, co-own the regional revenue targets and develop the overarching marketing strategy to drive market penetration and meet our growth goals.Lead & Develop Your Team: Directly lead, coach, and inspire a high-performing regional team focused on Account-Based Marketing (ABM) and local campaigns, fostering a culture of accountability and impact.Represent Marketing Results: Take accountability for total regional marketing performance. You'll do this by building exceptional partnerships with global functional teams‚Äîincluding Partner, Events, Brand, and Performance Marketing‚Äîto rally the cross-functional team behind EMEA‚Äôs strategic priorities.Immerse in the Data: Hunt for funnel insights to refine marketing strategies for distinct customer segments and countries. Conduct frequent analysis on program performance to scale efforts, ensure an efficient marketing mix, and achieve KPIs.AI Reflexivity: You lead the team from the front when it comes to pushing the boundaries of AI usage to drive efficiency and impact.Communicate & Influence: Communicate insights, learnings, results, and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels on a regular cadence, ensuring alignment and celebrating progress.Be the Voice of the Region: Translate our global brand campaigns into locally resonant "expressions" that connect with customers across EMEA, providing critical market feedback back into global teams.


What You'll Bring

A significant track record of B2B marketing leadership within the EMEA technology or SaaS sector, with a clear history of exceeding pipeline and revenue targets.Deep expertise in building demand generation engines, particularly with Account-Based Marketing (ABM) programs, working in close partnership with Sales and Partnerships groups.A tendency to lead from a position of being in the work, with the team, as a deep craft expert.A talent for building, coaching, and inspiring high-performing teams. You are a leader who develops leaders.An ability to thrive in chaos, resolve ambiguity, and be solutions-oriented. You have a proven ability to juggle multiple high-impact projects and rally teams behind solutions.Mastery of leading in a matrixed environment. You excel at driving results through both direct reports and high-leverage, cross-functional influence.Deeply proficient in modern marketing technology and data systems.


Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyone.Excel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowth.Keep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter).Be resilient and resourceful in the face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) change.Bring critical thought and opinion.Use AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflow.Embrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forward.Work digital-first for your daily work.


About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we‚Äôve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people‚Äôs lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many, is a future with more voices rather than fewer, and is creating more choices instead of an elite option.

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity‚Äîand a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyoneExcel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowthKeep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter)Be resilient and resourceful in face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) changeBring critical thought and opinionUse AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflowEmbrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forwardWork digital-first for your daily work

Since 2006, we‚Äôve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people‚Äôs lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many. This is a future with more voices rather than fewer.

About The Role

We are searching for a marketing leader to drive our up-market growth across the Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA) region. As the Head of Marketing, EMEA, you will lead marketing's contribution to our regional business goals.

This is a pivotal leadership role. You will sit on the EMEA Senior Leadership Team (SLT), serving as the voice of marketing and a key architect of our regional strategy. You will lead through a combination of direct team management and cross-functional influence to ensure Marketing exceeds its overall pipeline goals. Your mission is clear: build a world-class marketing function that delivers predictable, scalable pipeline and drives revenue.

What You'll Do

Set the Regional Strategy: As a member of the EMEA SLT, co-own the regional revenue targets and develop the overarching marketing strategy to drive market penetration and meet our growth goals.Lead & Develop Your Team: Directly lead, coach, and inspire a high-performing regional team focused on Account-Based Marketing (ABM) and local campaigns, fostering a culture of accountability and impact.Represent Marketing Results: Take accountability for total regional marketing performance. You'll do this by building exceptional partnerships with global functional teams‚Äîincluding Partner, Events, Brand, and Performance Marketing‚Äîto rally the cross-functional team behind EMEA‚Äôs strategic priorities.Immerse in the Data: Hunt for funnel insights to refine marketing strategies for distinct customer segments and countries. Conduct frequent analysis on program performance to scale efforts, ensure an efficient marketing mix, and achieve KPIs.AI Reflexivity: You lead the team from the front when it comes to pushing the boundaries of AI usage to drive efficiency and impact.Communicate & Influence: Communicate insights, learnings, results, and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels on a regular cadence, ensuring alignment and celebrating progress.Be the Voice of the Region: Translate our global brand campaigns into locally resonant "expressions" that connect with customers across EMEA, providing critical market feedback back into global teams.


What You'll Bring

A significant track record of B2B marketing leadership within the EMEA technology or SaaS sector, with a clear history of exceeding pipeline and revenue targets.Deep expertise in building demand generation engines, particularly with Account-Based Marketing (ABM) programs, working in close partnership with Sales and Partnerships groups.A tendency to lead from a position of being in the work, with the team, as a deep craft expert.A talent for building, coaching, and inspiring high-performing teams. You are a leader who develops leaders.An ability to thrive in chaos, resolve ambiguity, and be solutions-oriented. You have a proven ability to juggle multiple high-impact projects and rally teams behind solutions.Mastery of leading in a matrixed environment. You excel at driving results through both direct reports and high-leverage, cross-functional influence.Deeply proficient in modern marketing technology and data systems.


Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyone.Excel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowth.Keep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter).Be resilient and resourceful in the face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) change.Bring critical thought and opinion.Use AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflow.Embrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forward.Work digital-first for your daily work.


About Shopify

Opportunity is not evenly distributed. Shopify puts independence within reach for anyone with a dream to start a business. We propel entrepreneurs and enterprises to scale the heights of their potential. Since 2006, we‚Äôve grown to over 8,300 employees and generated over $1 trillion in sales for millions of merchants in 175 countries.

This is life-defining work that directly impacts people‚Äôs lives as much as it transforms your own. This is putting the power of the few in the hands of the many, is a future with more voices rather than fewer, and is creating more choices instead of an elite option.

About You

Moving at our pace brings a lot of change, complexity, and ambiguity‚Äîand a little bit of chaos. Shopifolk thrive on that and are comfortable being uncomfortable. That means Shopify is not the right place for everyone.

Before you apply, consider if you can:

Care deeply about what you do and about making commerce better for everyoneExcel by seeking professional and personal hypergrowthKeep up with an unrelenting pace (the week, not the quarter)Be resilient and resourceful in face of ambiguity and thrive on (rather than endure) changeBring critical thought and opinionUse AI tools reflexively as part of your fundamental workflowEmbrace differences and disagreement to get shit done and move forwardWork digital-first for your daily work

description.text:
At Matter Labs, we believe freedom drives progress and prosperity. We don‚Äôt see ourselves as a company, but as a team aligned around a single mission: to advance personal freedom for all (see ZK Credo).

To achieve this goal, we‚Äôre building zkSync ‚Äî a credibly neutral, fully open source technology stack and network on top of Ethereum, which is owned and governed by its community. We use advanced cryptography called zero-knowledge proofs to scale Ethereum infinitely without compromising on security or decentralization. With a world-class team, a community of over 1M supporters across Twitter + Discord, and hundreds of millions $ in funding, we have abundant resources to accomplish the mission.

The Role

We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to lead the product marketing function for Matter Labs by owning end-to-end GTM for ZKsync, covering messaging, competitive insights, sales enablement, and developer education. Produce technical content (white papers, tutorials, videos) and maintain a continuous feedback loop with pilots and the community. Establish and track key metrics to optimize campaigns and expand the ZKsync ecosystem.

What You Will Be Doing

Go-to-Market Strategy: Design and execute comprehensive GTM plans for ZKsync product and feature launches, covering messaging, outreach playbooks, developer education programs, and ecosystem partner coordination.Competitive & Market Insights: Conduct ongoing competitive analyses, market intelligence, and end-user research to inform product positioning, feature prioritization, and technical content strategy.Sales Enablement: Build and maintain up-to-date sales collateral: one-pagers, datasheets, verticalized slide decks (e.g., ‚ÄúBlockchain for Payments,‚Äù ‚ÄúPrivate Transactions for Institutions‚Äù), case studies, and competitor battle cards, so BD and sales teams can articulate value and close deals.Messaging & Positioning: Develop concise, differentiated product messaging tailored to each target segment (developers, enterprises, DeFi users), and ensure consistent technical messaging across all channels.Educational Resources: Lead creation of high-impact developer-focused content such as videos, tutorials, white papers, implementation guides, sample code repositories, and case studies that demonstrate ZKsync‚Äôs value proposition to technical decision-makers.Customer & Community Feedback Loop: Gather and synthesize insights from pilots, early adopters, and developer communities, then channel them back into product and marketing priorities.Metrics & Reporting: Define, track, and report on key metrics such as developer sign-ups, integrations, MQLs, conversion rates, documentation usage, on-chain activity, churn, and community growth to measure marketing impact and continuously optimize campaigns.

What We Look For In You

Technical Marketing ExcellenceProven ability to translate complex, unique features into clear value propositionsExperience creating technical documentation and developer education programsTrack record of successful Web3 or Web2 enterprise product launches and developer activationsTechnical UnderstandingSolid grasp of blockchain technologyAbility to understand and explain technical products to non-technical audiencesFamiliarity with Web3 development tools and frameworksCompetitive Analysis & PositioningStrong product marketing fundamentals and GTM strategy developmentAbility to identify and articulate competitive differentiationProficiency in benchmarking product capabilities against competing solutions.Data-driven approach to measuring engagement and content effectivenessCross-functional LeadershipStrong collaboration skills with engineering, product, marketing and communications teamsAbility to coordinate complex launches across multiple stakeholdersExperience working in fast-paced technical environmentsContent CreationDistill complex blockchain concepts into concise, audience-appropriate value statementsExcellence in creating technically-oriented marketing materials and documentationUse data, benchmarks, and real-world examples to reinforce credibility and impactAbility to develop compelling educational content and presentation materialsAgility & AdaptabilityPivot strategies and tactics based on early feedback or new informationMake clear decisions in ambiguous contexts, surfacing risks and contingency optionsRealign cross-functional plans under tight deadlines and changing requirements
Working at Matter Labs

At Matter Labs, you have the freedom to work how you want, when you want, and from where you want. All positions are 100% remote (with optional travel to team and/or industry events). We operate in lean and nimble teams, with no time tracking and minimum bureaucracy. We move fast. Only results matter. We will provide you with everything you need to learn, grow, and be productive.

Our results-only environment means anyone who believes in our mission can join us, regardless of background, sexual orientation, race, gender, and age. Both our team and community are made up of people from diverse backgrounds. That's why, out of politeness and respect, we refrain from opinions on politics, religion, or sex at the workplace.

We designed our culture around the tenants of freedom and ownership. This ethos will underpin our positive-sum community as we evolve toward full decentralization.

What We Offer

 Competitive compensation Equity and token package Premium coverage for health, dental and vision insurance 16 weeks of parental leave Flexible paid time off Company closure weeks 1-2x per year $2000 USD work equipment stipend $300 USD monthly co-working allowance Company offsites 1-2x per year $500 USD learning & development stipend 401k plan for US Employees

Don't meet every single requirement? That's ok. At Matter Labs, we think big with a long-term view and encourage you to apply even if you don't think you check every box in the job description.

If this role resonates with you, please apply now.

Read more about working at Matter Labs here.

Important: We are remote-first, operating in the timezones between UTC-5 (Latam and Atlantic Coast) to UTC+7 (South-East Asia).

Please click here for our applicant privacy notice.

To all recruitment agencies: Matter Labs does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Matter Labs employees, or any other organisation location. Matter Labs is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Read our full policy here.
