basic_info.title: Director of Marketing Intelligence & Research Integrity

description.text:
Location: Remote AnywhereReports to: Executive Director/CCODepartment: Executive Leadership ‚Äì Research & Intelligence
Collectivus Holdings oversees the most prestigious brands in the Collecting, Trading Card Game, and Hobby industries. With a century of combined expertise in pioneering products, delivering exceptional quality, and enhancing customer experiences, Collectivus is synonymous with excellence. Our portfolio includes Beckett, Dragon Shield, Southern Hobby, and Merchant Guild‚Äî four brands with decades of expertise and dedication to elevating the collecting experience for enthusiasts and businesses alike.
About Us:Welcome to Merchant Guild, where passion meets purpose!We are a consulting and support agency dedicated to empowering the trading card game (TCG) and tabletop gaming industry.Our mission is not just to grow sales but to ignite the spirit of adventure within the hobby ecosystem, helping local game stores thrive.Through tailored strategies, market insights, and hands-on support, we equip retailers, distributors, and publishers to embrace the exciting future of gaming.Join us in shaping an industry where collaboration, creativity, and opportunity drive lasting success.
Role OverviewThe Director of Market Intelligence & Research Integrity is a senior executive responsible for setting the vision, strategy, and execution of Merchant Guild‚Äôs global research, analytics, data quality, and service pricing structure. This role merges the strategic foresight of market insight collected through the Retail Consultant network with the rigorous oversight of research integrity, while also driving the pricing strategy for Merchant Guild packages and pricing its services for maximum industry impact based on a strong insight into the global competitive landscape.
As the Guild‚Äôs top authority in market intelligence, this leader ensures that every data-driven product ‚Äî from market reports to custom research engagements ‚Äî delivers high-value insights built on uncompromising accuracy. At the same time, they develop and manage a pricing framework that aligns Merchant Guild‚Äôs offerings with industry demand, competitive positioning, and revenue objectives.
Key Responsibilities
Strategic LeadershipDefine and execute Merchant Guild‚Äôs research, analytics, and pricing strategy, ensuring alignment with long-term organizational goals.Collect information from the Retail Consultant to identify market trends, industry shifts, and competitive landscapes.Lead the production of flagship reports, market forecasts, and member intelligence briefings.
Market Insights & AnalyticsDirect the design of market research projects, including quantitative, qualitative, and hybrid methodologies.Oversee predictive analytics, scenario modelling, and competitive benchmarking.Ensure insights are effectively visualized, communicated, and actionable for varied audiences.
Research Quality & IntegrityEstablish and maintain rigorous quality assurance standards for all research outputs.Audit methodologies, validate data sources, and oversee peer review processes.Ensure compliance with ethical research practices and relevant data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA).
Pricing Strategy & Commercial OversightDevelop and maintain a dynamic pricing framework for Merchant Guild‚Äôs research products, memberships, and consulting services.Conduct market-based pricing analysis to ensure competitive positioning while maximizing value and revenue.Collaborate with partnership managers to tailor pricing for custom projects, partnerships, and tiered service offerings.Monitor pricing performance and adjust strategies based on market feedback, demand trends, and profitability targets.
Qualifications8+ years in research operations, data governance, or analytics quality assurance.Strong track record in methodological design, data validation, and compliance.Strong understanding of pricing models, elasticity analysis, and value-based pricing approaches.Expertise in statistical techniques, sampling, and error mitigation.Familiarity with international data privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA) and ethical research practices.Exceptional attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.Proficiency with analytics tools and quality-checking processes.
Performance Metrics & Success Indicators
Research & Insights Delivery98%+ on-time delivery rate for research projects and reports.Zero critical accuracy errors in published research outputs.Stakeholder satisfaction scores of 8/10+ for relevance, clarity, and actionability of insights.
Data Quality & IntegrityAnnual methodology audit pass rate of 100% with no compliance breaches.Reduction in data discrepancies and errors year-over-year.Full compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and internal ethics standards.
Pricing & Revenue ImpactRevenue growth from research services of X% YoY (target set annually).Pricing model adoption rate across at least 90% of product/service lines.

#LI-Remote

description.text:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

At Revolut, we do Ops differently. Our hyper-talented operations experts don‚Äôt just keep things ticking over. They‚Äôre given the most complex, hard-to-solve problems in the business. Then they create elegant, scalable solutions that keep pace with our ambitious growth plans.

We're looking for a Lead Product Strategy & Operations Manager to help us solve the toughest problems in our global fintech. Someone to roll up their sleeves and dive into every area of our business to help millions of customers worldwide.

Watch this video from our team members about what goes into being a Strategy & Operations Manager at Revolut. If you want to gain unparalleled experience at a leading fintech company, let‚Äôs get in touch.

What You'll Be Doing

Optimising scalable processes to support operational efficiency in Western EuropeLeading and executing core infrastructure projectsExploring and defining project priorities for the teamSetting timelines to reach goals efficientlyIdentifying opportunities to improve existing featuresProposing new features to address customer needsManaging critical vendor relationships to ensure service qualityBuilding systems to track vendor performance metricsDeveloping strategic supply chain partnerships and negotiating commercial terms

What You'll Need

A 2:1 degree or higher in a relevant field5+ years of work experience in a fast-paced environmentProficiency in coding with SQL, Python, or RA solid track record of taking ownership and leading complex projects end to endAn analytical mindset to deconstruct complex problemsExperience working with data-driven solutionsA proactive mindset with a focus on delivering data-driven impactExperience in presenting to C-Suite executivesAn interest in the financial industryLeadership capabilities

Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.

 Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment. Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.

We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

basic_info.title: Professional Service Consultant - Woman / Man / Non Binary

description.text:
üåÄ The Company

Filigran, founded in October 2022, stands out in the cybertech ecosystem for its commitment to revolutionizing cyber threat management with a proactive approach. Its mission is to develop innovative open-source solutions designed to anticipate cyber threats, identify security gaps, and strengthen organizational security posture.

Filigran solutions are now trusted by over 6,000 public and private organizations worldwide.

üéØ The Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Customer Training Consultant to join our Customer Success team and play a key role in designing and delivering our training programs.

In this role, you‚Äôll focus on creating impactful learning experiences for our customers, developing training materials, and delivering both standard and tailored sessions. You‚Äôll work closely with our Content Manager, Revenue, and Product teams to scale training initiatives and ensure customers can confidently and effectively use our platforms OpenCTI and OpenBAS.

üíº Your Responsibilities

Design and build a scalable library of training content (agendas, slide decks, demo datasets, hands-on workshops) for OpenCTI and OpenBAS. Deliver training sessions to customers (remotely and on-site). Continuously improve training content based on platform updates and feedback. Document training delivery processes and propose scalable models for future services. Develop learning paths and certification programs to support different user profiles and maturity levels. Contribute to building a customer education strategy that scales with our growing community. 

ü§ù Who You‚Äôll Work With

Reporting to: Head of Customer SuccessCollaboration with: Content Manager, Revenue, and Product teamsClose interactions with: Public and private sector customers globally, including cybersecurity and threat intel teamsEnvironment: Fully remote, async-friendly, and collaborative

üß¨ Profile We‚Äôre Looking For

Proven experience in Cyber Threat Intelligence (CTI), SOC, or adjacent cybersecurity rolesStrong communication and presentation skills, ideally with experience in delivering trainingComfortable working in both strategic and technical contextsAutonomous, structured, and curious mindsetFluent in English (French is a plus)Bonus: Experience building training path and educational content in a tech/SaaS environment

üåç What We Offer

A unique opportunity to build a function from scratch with direct impact on customer successA collaborative, open-source-driven culture with real-world mission impactFlexible work environment (fully remote)The chance to work with major cybersecurity teams across the globe ‚Äî public institutions, critical infrastructure, and strategic enterprises

üå± Why Join Filigran? More than just a job.

We‚Äôre a fast-growing, global, and fully remote company on a mission to empower defense teams to be proactive ‚Äî through open-source solutions that uncover threats and drive action.

‚≠ê What we believe

We believe we do work that matters ‚Äî uniting defenders into a global community to make security more open, resilient & collaborative.

üíª How we work

That belief fuels how we work ‚Äî with focus, clarity and high standards. Always with care and respect, never with ego.

üß≠ What guides us

That focus and care is grounded in our CORE values: Cohesion, Openness, Responsibility, and Equity ‚Äî the compass that guides our decisions, collaborations, and growth, even when no one‚Äôs watching.

üí∞ Compensation & Benefits

Competitive pay + equity ‚Äî everyone shares in our successRemote-first, flexible, and balanced ‚Äî work that fits your lifeYour setup, your choice ‚Äî pick the gear that works for you

üåç Equal Employment Opportunity

We enable cybersecurity through inclusion ‚Äî from code to culture.

At Filigran, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of our people make our products and our team stronger. We welcome talent of every background, identity, and lived experience ‚Äî regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

What matters here is what you bring ‚Äî not what you look like, where you‚Äôre from, or how you identify.

üöÄ Ready to Join Us?

Apply now and help us build the future of the cybersecurity ecosystem ‚Äî together.

üåÄ The Company

Filigran, founded in October 2022, stands out in the cybertech ecosystem for its commitment to revolutionizing cyber threat management with a proactive approach. Its mission is to develop innovative open-source solutions designed to anticipate cyber threats, identify security gaps, and strengthen organizational security posture.

Filigran solutions are now trusted by over 6,000 public and private organizations worldwide.

üéØ The Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Customer Training Consultant to join our Customer Success team and play a key role in designing and delivering our training programs.

In this role, you‚Äôll focus on creating impactful learning experiences for our customers, developing training materials, and delivering both standard and tailored sessions. You‚Äôll work closely with our Content Manager, Revenue, and Product teams to scale training initiatives and ensure customers can confidently and effectively use our platforms OpenCTI and OpenBAS.

üíº Your Responsibilities

Design and build a scalable library of training content (agendas, slide decks, demo datasets, hands-on workshops) for OpenCTI and OpenBAS. Document training delivery processes and propose scalable models for future services. Develop learning paths and certification programs to support different user profiles and maturity levels. description.text:
GLOBAL NETWORK PARTNER@INSECOGO¬Æ (m/f/d) remote in Europe, Middle East and Africa!
Excellent Opportunities and outstanding Perspectives! ‚Ä¶ for top
‚è© Executive/Business Consultants,‚è© Interim Experts/Managers,‚è© Headhunters/Executive Search, and‚è© Trainers/Coaches!
We are a Group of Companies active in three business fields in top HR & Management Consulting, developed from over 20 years of highly specialized and international experience in organizational and process optimization as well as in the development and management of complex companies & groups of companies. Our headquarter is in the Dusseldorf/Cologne region in Germany.
With our brand INSECOGO¬Æ we are a worldwide Partners Network of legally independent and qualified partners in their respective countries in the business segments Worldwide Interim Experts & Managers, Headhunting and Executive & Business Consulting. With our two other brands, we are mainly active in the German-speaking countries (Germany, Austria, Switzerland): with INSEMACO¬Æ in the Headhunting/Executive Search, Interim Experts & Managers as well as Personal Expert & Leader Branding business segments and with INQIMACO¬Æ in the Leadership and HR Management Consulting & Development business segments.
In addition to our high standards of professional consulting, the DNA of our group also includes our high social & ethical standards. We want real sustainability in terms of business in harmony with people, nature and animals, which we promote!
This makes our ‚Äûwe-brand‚Äù concept unique worldwide, innovative and successful, with a real USP.
We are the original worldwide. We are THE 1st ADVISORY & ETHICS GROUP¬©
This and much more makes us one of the 1st Addresses when it comes to top Experts and Executives for cross-generational solutions!
In the course of our rapid development we are looking for further professionally and personally highly qualified Global Network Partners@INSECOGO¬Æ (m/f/d) remote in Europe, Middle East and Africa.
YOUR EXPERTISE & QUALIFICATIONSProfessional Executive/Business Consultant, Interim Expert/Manager, Headhunter or Trainer/Coach (m/f/d),entrepreneurial and self-employed in your country,degree and additional qualifications,very good English language skills,expertise in industries, functions and methods,many years of consulting experience,experience as an expert and executive in top positions (C-level) on the client side,task understanding and solution skills,high quality of verifiable references,winning personality with sovereignty, communication and sales strength,passion for high quality and for working in contact worlds and networks,sympathetic, humorous and authentic person, as well asidentifications with our high quality, performance and social standards as well as our social commitment.
YOUR ADVANTAGES & ADDED VALUES as GLOBAL NETWORK PARTNER@INSECOGO¬ÆWe live entrepreneurship, responsibility and community on the basis of a value system that is binding for us. Our corporate culture is characterised by trust, partnership, professionalism, passion, diversity, variety of skills and ideas, etc.We use one of the world's leading AI-powered software solutions in HR consulting and invest in state-of-the-art system technologies required for top performance.Our leopard is our brand motif. We associate it with self-image, positioning, added values and uniqueness. It fascinates and inspires us. It is probably the most persecuted big cat in the world. That is why we also support leopards in particular.You get an extremely lucrative partner model with excellent future prospects.You are an entrepreneurial and self-employed network/affiliated Partner at eye level in a network with USP.Each Partner has his/her specialisations in certain sectors, functions, search methods, etc.With your individual specialisations, you are exclusively the 1st contact person for your clients in your country resp. your region.The individual entrepreneurial performance of each Partner is protected in the best possible way for him/her.You are split-fee Partner for international cross-border projects.The Partners involved in a cross-border project divide the fee between themselves into a share for the acquiring Partner and a share for the implementing/placing Partner in the respective country.You will receive synergies through our group of companies and our partnerships, such as specialised knowledge and innovative approaches to solutions, cross-selling of a comprehensive portfolio of the group, etc.We only work exclusively (as the only personnel consultancy) for our clients.We only offer top quality: each Partner only accept a project if he/she or we have the necessary skills to carry out the project successfully.We offer our clients sustainability as well as the highest quality, performance and social standards, with guarantees and an excellent price-performance ratio.In case of Headhunting/Executive Search we only work with retainer fee.Each Partner is exclusively and professionally presented and positioned on the INSECOGO¬Æ website in the near future.Every active Partner is supported with our social media marketing and selling to secure and increase his/her contacts and turnover.Each Partner influences its success through its own activities with clients and within our partnership and group of companies.
All this makes INSECOGO¬Æ an ideal Partner when it comes to professional international projects.
And besides all professionalism, we want to be sympathetic and humorous people.
We will be happy to tell you more about the advantages and added values of a partnership with us in a personal and confidential conversation.
Professionalism and absolute discretion are a matter of course for us!
YOUR PERSONAL CONTACTThomas Timoth√© BehnckeCEO/Managing Partner
He looks forward to hearing resp. reading from you. Please send him your message with your profile/CV, in English language, here on LinkedIn.
BECOME PART OF THE SUCCESS!
For future-oriented information, thoughts and ideas, please simply activate the "bell" at the top right of Thomas Timoth√© Behncke's LinkedIn profile.
BE A PERSONALITY OF THE 21TH CENTURY!¬©#personality21century
For reasons of better legibility, the simultaneous use of gender-specific language forms is dispensed with.

description.text:
Who are we?

At Finastra, we are a dynamic global provider of open finance software solutions, dedicated to expanding access to financial services. Our innovative applications span Lending, Payments, Treasury and Capital Markets, and Universal Banking. Proudly serving over 8,000 customers, including 45 of the world's top 50 banks, we aim to boost financial inclusion for all. Join us and be part of a vibrant company that embraces diverse perspectives, and is committed to doing well by doing good.

Working as part of the Europe regional team, your primary role will be to manage and execute on the Field Marketing plan for Europe and be a key interface to the sales and customer facing organisation. This role will report to the Global Head of Marketing for the Treasury and Capital Markets (TCM) Business Unit.

In your role as a Field Marketing Specialist, your primary objective will be to generate qualified leads in line with the Finastra TCM business plan. You will contribute to building the strategic plan, identifying and analyzing customer demand, building regional campaign programs and executing on the plan.

Purpose of Role

The primary objective is to generate qualified leads in line with the Finastra business plan. The remit of the role will encompass strategic planning, identifying and analyzing customer demand, developing the annual marketing plan, building campaign programs and managing allocated budget.

Strategic Goals & Deliverables

Responsible for the development of qualified pipeline, driving Europe sales objectives for lead generationIdentify opportunities across Europe, for generating MQLs and SS2s, which have high probability of converting along the sales funnel to closed deals.Raising the quality of marketing activities year on year, to ensure improved stats on customer engagement of marketing communications and campaigns, and year on year improvement on customer attendance at key events.

Accountabilities

Plan and execute a high quality, Europe wide, marketing plan for TCMDeliver pipeline for Europe, aligned to target set for the regionEnsure high quality of leads within the pipeline, to create strong conversion rates to closed won dealsResponsible for directing Sales Development Reps detailing forthcoming campaigns, identify and provide suitable marketing materials to ensure clear communication to prospects via phone or email and monitor dailyEnsure continuous focus on lead follow up across marketing campaigns and eventsWork with Business Development Managers to ensure accurate targeting of existing customers and prospects.Collaborate and partner with core marketing teams on campaign concept, messaging, content, creative, promotion and optimisation to ensure effectiveness for your programsIdentify the most effective marketing channels, value proposition and calls to action for personas and key accounts in your region.Engage Marketing and Sales colleagues, both pre- and post-events, to optimise results in terms of awareness, inquiries, and revenue.Execute region-specific marketing programs that will ultimately drive demand and build the sales pipeline.Build an appropriate mix of integrated campaign tactics, including events, round tables, email, webinars, telemarketing, social media, etc, to deliver the regional campaign goals within the budget allocation.Report on KPIs, track results, manage the lead qualification and handover process to Inside Sales

Qualifications And Experience

5+ year‚Äôs experience in B2B Marketing in Field Marketing and Demand GenerationExcellent communication skills with both internal stakeholders, colleagues and peers, to influence and persuade for buy-in for involvement across campaignsFamiliar with marketing automation platform and CRM systems (Marketo and Salesforce)Strong negotiating skills with external vendors to get the best deals and deliver high quality events within budgetStrong analytical skills to review performance and ensure targets are being metStrong organisational skills to execute all elements of the plan to deadlineKeen eye for detail and focus on high qualityResults orientatedTech savvy ‚Äì able to work and understand purpose of various marketing tools and platformsDegree in Marketing, Business or Communications or equivalent experienceExperience within B2B Software and/or Financial Services technologies (FinTech) is preferredFluent in English and French, other European languages a bonus

Benefits

We are proud to offer a range of incentives to our employees worldwide. These benefits are available to everyone, regardless of grade, and reflect the values we uphold:

 Flexibility: Enjoy unlimited vacation, based on your location and business priorities. Hybrid working arrangements, and inclusive policies such as paid time off for voting, bereavement, and sick leave. Well-being: Access confidential one-on-one therapy through our Employee Assistance Program, unlimited personalized coaching via our coaching app, and access to our Gather Groups for emotional and mental support. Medical, life & disability insurance, retirement plan, lifestyle and other benefits* ESG: Benefit from paid time off for volunteering and donation matching. DEI: Participate in multiple DE&I groups for open involvement (e.g., Count Me In, Culture@Finastra, Proud@Finastra, Disabilities@Finastra, Women@Finastra). Career Development: Access online learning and accredited courses through our Skills & Career Navigator tool. Recognition: Be part of our global recognition program, Finastra Celebrates, and contribute to regular employee surveys to help shape Finastra and foster a culture where everyone is engaged and empowered to perform at their best.Specific benefits may vary by location.

At Finastra, each individual is unique, bringing their own ideas, thoughts, cultural beliefs, backgrounds, and experiences together. We learn from one another, embrace and celebrate our differences, and create an environment where everyone feels safe to be themselves.

Be unique, be exceptional, and help us make a difference at Finastra!

basic_info.title: Head of Sales, Europe West & South

description.text:
We do things differently around here.

We built ClearBank on the belief that banking infrastructure would no longer slow down progress. Instead, it would be a catalyst that unlocks the potential to innovate. It would adapt to different needs so a new era in financial services could begin. We‚Äôre here to challenge the status quo in banking, are you?

We all know that transforming banking forever is not an easy mission, but we‚Äôre more than ready to rise to that challenge. We all do it every day; navigating new, unexpected and sometimes even daunting challenges. But we believe in ourselves and trust we can do it.

Want to innovate? Go for it. Push for a better way? You Can. If you think you have it in you, this is Where You Can.

What You Can Expect

ClearBank is a place where you can do things differently and challenge the status quo. We will give you a high level of autonomy and transparency, and we trust you to make the right decisions for the bank.

If that excites you, how about joining our European Sales team as a Head of Sales, Europe West & South? Reporting to EU Chief Executive Officer and Group Chief Revenue Officer, you will focus on creating sustainable revenue growth, supported by top-grade sales execution.

This is initially a fully remote position, but we are specifically seeking someone based in France to help us build strong local foundations and serve as cornerstone for our future growth in the market.

You will be responsible for developing and executing the Europe West & South (France, Italy, Spain, Portugal, and Mediterranean countries) sales strategy to achieve revenue targets and other key performance indicators (KPIs). Additionally, you will be directly responsible for originating sustainable new business opportunities and client prospects for ClearBank Europe, and achieving new client logo wins and revenue growth.

This role involves close collaboration with the CEO and the senior management team of ClearBank Europe, as well as the Group Chief Revenue Officer, to drive sales and success across your region. You will apply a leadership-level of expertise to the planning, creation and execution of growth and sales strategies. Decisions made will have a very high impact on the image, success and growth of ClearBank Europe.

In This Position You Will

Devise and gain senior management approval for a sales plan, to include targets and KPIs, which drives the growth of ClearBank Europe in Europe West & South ‚Äì positioning the company as a long-term business partner to potential clients, challenging the status quo and creating momentum for change.Implement the approved sales plan to achieve short, medium and long-term revenue growth, as well as other KPIs.Take the lead in sales campaigns and owning the end-to-end sales cycle ‚Äì marshalling internal resources, driving consensus for change and negotiating client contracts to achieve business objectives and to maximize revenues.Embed and manage world-class processes to provide a solid platform to support the growth of the company in Europe West & South ‚Äì particularly to include sales processes (forecasting, pipeline management, territory management, account planning etc.).Play a lead role in developing senior-level contacts on a multi-stakeholder basis in major clients, potential clients and partners to drive market traction.Develop and manage the partner ecosystem to enhance ClearBank Europe‚Äôs sales effectiveness in Europe West & South.Recommend pricing and sales strategies to the leadership team in order to maximise long-term value.Contribute to the overall leadership of ClearBank Europe, working closely with cross-functional teams to support management of existing clients and to provide market feedback and input into the development pipeline of new products and services.After initial success in building sales pipeline and winning new client contracts and as required by the business: build, develop, coach and lead a top-class Europe West & South sales team capable of driving the business forward, providing strong leadership and creating a positive and high-performing team culture.

What You‚Äôll Bring

To excel in this role, you‚Äôll also need:

B2B sales and client management experience in the Banking or Fintech sectors: You have extensive experience in successfully selling and managing high-value complex solutions to clients on a multi-stakeholder basis and over long sales cycles.Sales strategy: You have experience of developing commercial strategies and plans to achieve revenue goals and KPIs.International experience: Preferably you have extensive international experience gained elsewhere in EuropeLanguage skills: Excellent English and French skills. Fluency in another European language (such as Portuguese, Italian or Spanish languages) is a plus.Proactive attitude and leadership mentality: A proactive approach to sales and achieving targets; a pioneering spirit; takes the lead and uses initiative. An inclusive and collaborative approach; a team player who engages with and brings the wider team together; consults and listens; engages constructively.Energy and Dynamism: A creative and dynamic self-starter; action-oriented; enthusiastic with a positive approach.Drive and Ambition: Motivated to succeed, meet targets, and exceed them; driven by making a difference and challenging the status quo.Resourcefulness and flexibility: Utilizes the wider team‚Äôs skills to maximize sales growth for the whole business; able to work autonomously and create momentum; prioritizes effectively while remaining focused on target and the highest value deliverables; thrives in a fast-changing environment and performs under pressure while remaining calm; creative and not afraid to innovate. Commercially focused, market-oriented, and data-driven in driving business; leverages network for commercial gain.Personal Qualities: Organized; reliable; trustworthy; high-integrity; detail-oriented; resilient; determined; open; transparent; calm.

Regretfully we are not able to sponsor applicants for immigration purposes at the current time.

A little bit more about us!

ClearBank Is Where You Can Belong

At ClearBank we think about Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DE&I) a lot. Not because we think we should. But because we know we should ‚Äì how else can we build a happy workforce and be successful as a business. We‚Äôre committed to making sure our teams reflect society. And we put energy and effort into making this a place where everyone feels at home, where they‚Äôre given the trust and encouragement to do their very best work. Here are some of the things we‚Äôre most proud of:

42% of our senior management roles are held by women Our enhanced family leave policiesLaunching our partnership with Code First Girls Increasing awareness of neurodiversity in the workplace through our partnership with the Inclusive Group 

Our Hiring Process And What You Can Expect

Application: a member of our talent acquisition team will review your application against the key requirements for the role and let you know within two weeks whether you‚Äôre moving forward to the next stage;

Screening: You‚Äôll spend 30-45 minutes speaking to one of our recruiters learning more about the role and ClearBank, and we‚Äôll get it know more about you, your experience and how your skills align with the role (this will be via phone or Teams video call). You can expect to hear back from us within seven days following this meeting (if things are taking longer than expected, we‚Äôll let you know that too);

First Interview: You‚Äôll spend one hour with a member of our hiring team focusing on your skills, competencies and your ways of working at the same time we‚Äôll give you time to ask more questions about the role, the team and learn more about the ClearBank culture. This will be via Teams.

Second Interview: This will be a competency-based interview with one or more members of our team.

Final Stage: You will have a final meeting with the Head of Department. This will be around 45-60 minutes.

Offer: Congratulations! Get ready to transform banking forever!

Our Commitment To You As a Candidate

We will always try our best to get back to you within seven days of your interview whether you‚Äôve been successful or not and provide you with feedback. Sometimes things take a little longer, so we may not have a decision to share but we will get it touch to let you know we need a little more time.

We‚Äôre unable to provide specific individual feedback at the application or screening stage but know that your application was reviewed and considered carefully.

We wish you the best of luck with your application and maybe we‚Äôll be celebrating your new role at ClearBank soon!

Equal Opportunities

ClearBank is committed to ensuring equal opportunities throughout every stage of the recruitment process. ClearBank recognises that diversity is vital to the long-term success of the business in the communities and markets in which it operates. ClearBank is also a firm believer that an inclusive culture fosters greater employee engagement and collaboration.

ClearBank strives for diversity and inclusion of all forms, including (but not limited to): gender, age, educational and professional background, disability, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or maternity, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief and sexual orientation.

As part of the Company‚Äôs commitment to equal employment opportunity, we provide reasonable adjustments, to candidates during the recruitment process, including to individuals with disabilities. We want to create a safe space that welcomes everyone so please let us know how we can accommodate you. In case you have any accessibility requirements you can share that with our Talent Acquisition team prior to your interview stage, if applicable.

The legal bit

By submitting your CV to ClearBank Limited you are providing your consent for us to use the information you provide for recruitment purposes. For more information on how we manage your data go and check out our Candidate Privacy Notice on the ClearBank website to see how we process, manage and look after your data. You are also allowing us to communicate with you by email and telephone for recruitment purposes.

detailed_info.title: Head of Sales, Europe West & South

jobs.description:
We do things differently around here.

We built ClearBank on the belief that banking infrastructure would no longer slow down progress. Instead, it would be a catalyst that unlocks the potential to innovate. It would adapt to different needs so a new era in financial services could begin. We‚Äôre here to challenge the status quo in banking, are you?

We all know that transforming banking forever is not an easy mission, but we‚Äôre more than ready to rise to that challenge. We all do it every day; navigating new, unexpected and sometimes even daunting challenges. But we believe in ourselves and trust we can do it.

Want to innovate? Go for it. Push for a better way? You Can. If you think you have it in you, this is Where You Can.

What You Can Expect

ClearBank is a place where you can do things differently and challenge the status quo. We will give you a high level of autonomy and transparency, and we trust you to make the right decisions for the bank.

If that excites you, how about joining our European Sales team as a Head of Sales, Europe West & South? Reporting to EU Chief Executive Officer and Group Chief Revenue Officer, you will focus on creating sustainable revenue growth, supported by top-grade sales execution.

This is initially a fully remote position, but we are specifically seeking someone based in France to help us build strong local foundations and serve as cornerstone for our future growth in the market.

You will be responsible for developing and executing the Europe West & South (France, Italy, Spain, Portugal, and Mediterranean countries) sales strategy to achieve revenue targets and other key performance indicators (KPIs). Additionally, you will be directly responsible for originating sustainable new business opportunities and client prospects for ClearBank Europe, and achieving new client logo wins and revenue growth.

This role involves close collaboration with the CEO and the senior management team of ClearBank Europe, as well as the Group Chief Revenue Officer, to drive sales and success across your region. You will apply a leadership-level of expertise to the planning, creation and execution of growth and sales strategies. Decisions made will have a very high impact on the image, success and growth of ClearBank Europe.

In This Position You Will

Devise and gain senior management approval for a sales plan, to include targets and KPIs, which drives the growth of ClearBank Europe in Europe West & South ‚Äì positioning the company as a long-term business partner to potential clients, challenging the status quo and creating momentum for change.Implement the approved sales plan to achieve short, medium and long-term revenue growth, as well as other KPIs.Take the lead in sales campaigns and owning the end-to-end sales cycle ‚Äì marshalling internal resources, driving consensus for change and negotiating client contracts to achieve business objectives and to maximize revenues.Embed and manage world-class processes to provide a solid platform to support the growth of the company in Europe West & South ‚Äì particularly to include sales processes (forecasting, pipeline management, territory management, account planning etc.).Play a lead role in developing senior-level contacts on a multi-stakeholder basis in major clients, potential clients and partners to drive market traction.Develop and manage the partner ecosystem to enhance ClearBank Europe‚Äôs sales effectiveness in Europe West & South.Recommend pricing and sales strategies to the leadership team in order to maximise long-term value.Contribute to the overall leadership of ClearBank Europe, working closely with cross-functional teams to support management of existing clients and to provide market feedback and input into the development pipeline of new products and services.After initial success in building sales pipeline and winning new client contracts and as required by the business: build, develop, coach and lead a top-class Europe West & South sales team capable of driving the business forward, providing strong leadership and creating a positive and high-performing team culture.

What You‚Äôll Bring

To excel in this role, you‚Äôll also need:

B2B sales and client management experience in the Banking or Fintech sectors: You have extensive experience in successfully selling and managing high-value complex solutions to clients on a multi-stakeholder basis and over long sales cycles.Sales strategy: You have experience of developing commercial strategies and plans to achieve revenue goals and KPIs.International experience: Preferably you have extensive international experience gained elsewhere in EuropeLanguage skills: Excellent English and French skills. Fluency in another European language (such as Portuguese, Italian or Spanish languages) is a plus.Proactive attitude and leadership mentality: A proactive approach to sales and achieving targets; a pioneering spirit; takes the lead and uses initiative. An inclusive and collaborative approach; a team player who engages with and brings the wider team together; consults and listens; engages constructively.Energy and Dynamism: A creative and dynamic self-starter; action-oriented; enthusiastic with a positive approach.Drive and Ambition: Motivated to succeed, meet targets, and exceed them; driven by making a difference and challenging the status quo.Resourcefulness and flexibility: Utilizes the wider team‚Äôs skills to maximize sales growth for the whole business; able to work autonomously and create momentum; prioritizes effectively while remaining focused on target and the highest value deliverables; thrives in a fast-changing environment and performs under pressure while remaining calm; creative and not afraid to innovate. Commercially focused, market-oriented, and data-driven in driving business; leverages network for commercial gain.Personal Qualities: Organized; reliable; trustworthy; high-integrity; detail-oriented; resilient; determined; open; transparent; calm.

Regretfully we are not able to sponsor applicants for immigration purposes at the current time.

description.text:
üõ•Ô∏è Who we are
Click&Boat is the leading European boat rental platform. Our marketplace aims to make boating accessible around the world, and to provide private and professional boat owners with additional income from boat rentals.
So far, we are opened for business in more than 50 countries and 600 destinations, and we are also a diverse team of 200 employees from 20 different countries.
Our headquarters are based in Paris on a barge moored on the Seine River, and we also have a second office of 100 people based in Barcelona.
ü§ò How do we do it?
At Click&Boat, we believe in empowering our developers to build the company's strategy and shape the future of boating. People joining Click&Boat are always delighted by our innovative working method. We have a set of cultural values that guide our approach to work, such as:
Product-Focused: Our focus is on delivering exceptional products that truly benefit our users.Data-Driven: We prioritize data-driven decisions to ensure our products meet user needs.Tech for Purpose: We believe technology is a means to solve real problems, not an end.Full Empowerment: Our developers are not just coders; they are strategic partners who have a direct impact on our product roadmap and company objectives.Full Transparency: You'll have access to the entire company strategy and be a key player in achieving our OKRs.Boring architecture: we are always seeking the simplest solution for our complex challenges‚Ä¶ and that is not simple! (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=msnQbIQFsw4 if you want to know more).Diversity : We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace, where all individuals are valued and respected.
‚≠êÔ∏è The Engineering Team ‚≠êÔ∏è
Our engineering team is composed of 4 agile squads, each responsible for a functional scope. We build the infrastructure, interfaces, and applications to provide first-class service to our users (boat owners, customers renting boats, and Click&Boat internal teams).
By joining Click&Boat, you‚Äôll meet a team of talented, committed, and passionate engineers with a lot of product interactions. You'll have the opportunity to take ownership of projects quickly, whilst being mentored by talented senior engineers who have made significant contributions at renowned companies like Doctolib (VP of Engineering, Engineering Director & Principal Engineer) and ManoMano.
We move fast, with a lot of ownership, and are proud to tackle big problems! Being a developer at Click&Boat means more than just coding. Our developers are also responsible for preparing their features, collaborating with product managers and designers, monitoring and validating features once in production.
Our stack includes up-to-date Angular, PHP, MySQL, Symfony, and we push to production twice a day!
Click here if you to know more about us!https://www.welcometothejungle.com/fr/companies/click-and-boat-group/teamhttps://www.linkedin.com/company/click-&-boat/posts/?feedView=videos
‚≠êÔ∏è Are you the one we‚Äôre looking for? ‚≠êÔ∏è
To support the opening of a new squad, we are looking to recruit an experienced engineering manager.
You're a Great Fit at Click&Boat if:You enjoy delivering features that impact the company's KPIs ;You have solid experience delivering high-quality feature ;You have at least 2 years of experience managing a technical team ;You enjoy supporting and coaching your individual contributors, providing regular feedback to help them grow in line with company-wide objectives ;You feel comfortable working with various stakeholders across the company ;You‚Äôre a clear and effective communicator with your teammates.
What We Value :Customer Focus: Understanding our customers and fully embracing our mission will make your journey with us exciting and fulfilling.Curiosity Acumen: We seek individuals who are curious and eager to learn.Diversity and Inclusion: We value and actively promote gender diversity and inclusion. We appreciate candidates with diverse backgrounds.Boat Interest: We appreciate candidates with a background or interest in boating. If you share our passion for the industry, it's a significant advantage.
Make sure to highlight these qualities during your interviews.
üôå Perks & Benefits
At Click&Boat, we believe that enjoying your work is essential. This is why Click&Boaters are provided with a stimulating environment and perks ensuring they are happy and efficient, and spend only high-quality time with co-workers.
Therefore, we offer:Remote policy: As a developer, you'll have the opportunity to embrace remote work with our remote-friendly policy. To foster team synergy and maintain strong connections, we request that developers come to our Paris houseboat for three consecutive days each month.Competitive Salaries: We believe in recognizing and rewarding the talent and dedication of our team members.Professional Growth: Beyond technical skills, we'll support your growth as a strategic thinker and decision-makerBoating Perks: We offer a free boat license and often organize boat trips with the team.Benefits: Enjoy lunch vouchers (Swile), private insurance (Alan), and 8 extra days off.Have Fun at Click&Boat: we make the most of our in-office days by enjoying meals together on our fabulous houseboat, organizing after-work events, and holding annual team-building events. It‚Äôs not a coincidence that we have been awarded the ‚ÄúHappy at Work!‚Äù badge.
Ready to take the helm and drive our success? Join Click&Boat and be part of a team where your voice truly matters. Let's navigate the future of boating together!

It‚Äôs not a coincidence that we have been awarded the ‚ÄúHappy at Work!‚Äù badge.

description.text:
At Bending Spoons, we‚Äôre striving to build one of the all-time great companies. A company that serves a huge number of customers. A company where team members grow to their full potential. A company that functions at unparalleled levels of effectiveness and efficiency. A company that creates value for shareowners at an extraordinary rate. And a company that does so while adhering to high ethical standards.

To achieve this objective, we execute the following strategy: First, we acquire a digital business with untapped potential and make it as successful as we can by leveraging our platform‚Äîwhich comprises our expertise, technologies, data, brand, talents, and company culture. Then, we invest the proceeds into making our platform more powerful, and into acquiring new businesses. This strategy sees us combine an investor‚Äôs attention to capital allocation with the hands-on approach of an operator.

For a talented, driven, and collaborative individual, working at Bending Spoons is an opportunity to learn, make an impact, and progress their career at an exceptionally high rate. That‚Äôs our promise to such a candidate.

After an intensive training period of six to twelve months, you‚Äôll take on a leadership role‚Äîeither as the sole leader or co-leader‚Äîof a business unit generating revenue in the tens of millions of dollars at a minimum, with the potential to increase your level of responsibility to the hundreds of millions over time. You‚Äôll report directly to our CEO.

This leadership position is open to individuals with an outstanding track record of performance and growth, even without a decade of experience. We‚Äôre looking for candidates who have previously led high-performing teams, and have backgrounds in entrepreneurial ventures, investment banking, or technology. Excellent references from highly reputable professionals will be essential.

A few examples of your responsibilitiesDrive strategy. Develop and execute bold, data-informed strategies that are laser-focused on unlocking new levels of value for the company.Lead an outstanding team. Lead a high-performing team composed of some of the most talented professionals you‚Äôll ever encounter. Where necessary, make tough decisions to uphold excellence.Operate at the sharp end of the industry. We‚Äôre one of the highest-rated employers in tech and finance, and our products have hundreds of millions of users. Our sights are set on greatness, and yours (and your team‚Äôs) must be, too.

What we look forLeadership. You have some years of outstanding work experience in highly challenging roles and environments, and have demonstrated exceptional performance and outlier growth in your role.Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offerAn exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Our pay packages are designed to attract and retain top professionals. This job has a competitive, top-of-industry salary, and is reviewed every December. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may be eligible for a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK).

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They‚Äôre challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities‚Äîjust let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you‚Äôve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîto a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It‚Äôs the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We‚Äôll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you‚Äôre welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries‚Äîdepending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you‚Äôre excited to give your best, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to meet you.

Develop and execute bold, data-informed strategies that are laser-focused on unlocking new levels of value for the company.Lead an outstanding team. Lead a high-performing team composed of some of the most talented professionals you‚Äôll ever encounter. Where necessary, make tough decisions to uphold excellence.Operate at the sharp end of the industry. We‚Äôre one of the highest-rated employers in tech and finance, and our products have hundreds of millions of users. Our sights are set on greatness, and yours (and your team‚Äôs) must be, too.

What we look forLeadership. You have some years of outstanding work experience in highly challenging roles and environments, and have demonstrated exceptional performance and outlier growth in your role.Drive. You‚Äôre extremely ambitious in everything you do‚Äîand your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high‚Äîand rising‚Äîbar.Reasoning ability. Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.Team spirit. You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You‚Äôre reliable, honest, and transparent.Proficiency in English. You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.

What we offerAn exceptional opportunity for growth. We go to great lengths to hire individuals of outstanding potential‚Äîthen, our priority is to put them in the ideal position to thrive. Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you‚Äôve got what it takes, you‚Äôll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.Incredibly talented, entrepreneurial teams. You‚Äôll work in small, result-oriented, autonomous teams alongside some of the brightest people in your field.Competitive pay and access to equity in the company. Our pay packages are designed to attract and retain top professionals. This job has a competitive, top-of-industry salary, and is reviewed every December. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may be eligible for a 50% tax cut.All. These. Benefits. Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.

Commitment & contract
Permanent. Full-time.

Location
Milan (Italy), London (UK).

The selection process
If you pass our screening, we‚Äôll ask you to take on a few tests designed to assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. They‚Äôre challenging and may take several hours to complete. If you‚Äôre successful with those, we‚Äôll invite you to a series of interviews.

We set the bar high and won't extend an offer until we're convinced we've found the right candidate. This is why a job may stay open for months or be reposted several times.

Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn‚Äôt a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and provide reasonable accommodations for an individual with disabilities‚Äîjust let us know through this form.

Before you apply
If you‚Äôve applied before but didn't receive an offer, we recommend waiting at least one year before applying again.

Bending Spoons is a demanding environment. We‚Äôre extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves‚Äîand one another‚Äîto a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.

To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It‚Äôs the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We‚Äôll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance. After that, you‚Äôre welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries‚Äîdepending on what we agree at the offer stage.

If the role speaks to you and you‚Äôre excited to give your best, we‚Äôd love to hear from you. Apply now‚Äîwe can‚Äôt wait to meet you.

description.text:
Company DescriptionCompany is a global leader developing and manufacturing high value added aluminium products and solutions for a broad scope of markets and applications, focusing on Aerospace, Automotive & Packaging. We design, develop and engineer products / solutions in partnership with our customers. With approximately 12,000 employees worldwide, Constellium operates 28+ manufacturing sites in North America, Europe and China with reported 2024 sales of ‚Ç¨ 7,3 billion.
Key points‚Ä¢ Sales profitability tool replacement Project (Atlas)‚Ä¢ CRM tool (Sales Force): adoption and further leverage (stability and then expansion)
Leadership competencies, technical skills requirements
‚Ä¢ Proven successful project management experience, ideally of a CRM system implementation.‚Ä¢ Experience in sales and industrial controlling is a must.‚Ä¢ Proficiency in business intelligence systems with appetite for digitalization / automation tools. Good experience with SAP. Good practice of Excel, PowerPoint.‚Ä¢ Good ability to understand business levers in an industrial context with intra-BU flows.‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.‚Ä¢ Proven ability to think creatively and drive successful change management initiatives.‚Ä¢ High level of autonomy, reliability, transparency and accountability. Strong attention to detail. Ability to work under pressure.‚Ä¢ Language fluency in English and French.‚Ä¢ Travel up to 20%.5+ Years of Experience

Aspire Sphere Global Services is a leading global provider of recruitment and talent management solutions, specializing in the UAE and European markets. We partner closely with our clients to identify, attract, and retain top-tier professionals across diverse industries and geographies. Our team combines deep domain knowledge, local market insights, and global sourcing capabilities to address complex hiring challenges. Aspire Sphere customizes solutions to fit each client's unique culture, goals, and challenges, ensuring long-term success. We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and ethical hiring practices.

description.text:
Who You‚Äôll Work With

Nike Energy Marketing drives connections with those that are culturally impacting today‚Äôs most discerning youth communities and puts forward new ideas to explore with them the intersections of sports and culture (fashion, music, art, design‚Ä¶).

As part of the Paris Energy team, you will work fluidly across the Paris/France Marketing Team, to foster strong relationships with cultural talents in the city/country. You will also work cross-functionally in the Paris office with key partners such as the Nike Brand Team and Sports Marketing in service of our athletes. You will work closely with the EMEA Energy Marketing Team and the Men‚Äôs/Women‚Äôs Consumer Construct (Marketing) teams in EHQ.

Who We Are Looking For

We are looking for a talented experienced marketing expert who is extremely well connected with Parisian youth cultural emerging scene and with a strong connection to fashion and a strong network with the community. An inventive marketing talent with an ability to imagine stories that can inspire the next generation to move, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, find new strategic approaches as well as lead end-to-end project and keen to partner with crucial marketplace partners to turn their ideas into a reality on the ground.

A marketing talent willing to move forward in an experimental approach, capable of considering his/her functions as a laboratory, a testing ground to push the limits strategically, incubate, test and learn to imagine and build a new space for Nike and sport, when others do not see the looming opportunity. A collaborator with interest, open-mindedness and limitless passion, translating visionary language into something unique in its modernity.

What You‚Äôll Work On

As the Lead Professional, Energy Marketing Runway, Paris/France, you will be a part of the Paris/France Marketing Team, reporting directly to the Director, Energy Marketing, Paris/France. This role will be responsible for balancing relationship management & marketing execution through our key talent relationships across the Paris cultural ecosystem.

Specifically, You Will Be Responsible For

Identifying and managing a network of cultural catalysts in Paris to boost the brand priorities and create the future of sport, in alignment to our global strategyProviding exceptional service and brand management to all talent relationshipsCreating visionary marketing concepts aimed at pushing the intersections of sports and culture through creativity with strong resonance among the youth in ParisLeading product collaborations projects with external partners & Global teamsFeeding relevant key catalyst relationships strategically into Geo & Global campaigns work to advance our position within our key sports territories Driving key Energy campaigns through pinnacle marketplace ecosystem in collaboration with our store partnersBriefing and managing external agencies Identify, gather and formulate structured insights about forward-thinking customers to enable us to better serve creative youth on the ground in Paris, and providing feedback to EMEA/Global teams to support long-term concepts 

All roles in our organisation will need to be agile to some extent. This will ensure that in an ever-changing landscape we always have enough resource to ensure pinnacle execution of our most key priorities.

WHAT DO YOU BRING TO NIKE?

A successful candidate will be expected to clearly demonstrate and articulate experience of the below essential requirements in order to be considered.

Essential Requirements

Solid experience in brand and/or brand functional management, with a strong focus on cross-functional marketing.Experience in cultural marketing in Paris and a demonstrable understanding of the visionary and forward-thinking customer, the city and Nike's position within it with credentials in strategic decision-making in this environment.Proven experience identifying, owning and managing external relationships with thought leaders in Paris - with a strong focus on fashion, aligned with Nike's strategic objectivesPrior marketing experience and a demonstrable understanding of the consumer, Paris and Nike‚Äôs position within it, with a track record of making strategic marketing decisions within this environment.A background and strong network within fashion and lifestyle is desirable.A desire and willingness to work in an agile fashion as neededProficiency in French and English

The closing date for this position is 1 September 2025. Relocation is not offered for this role.

Design and deliver learning experiences that help a fully remote team grow, upskill, and collaborate better ‚Äî async-first.
HiCareer is supporting a remote-first SaaS company in hiring a Learning & Development Specialist. The company has grown to 200+ employees across Europe and North America, and now wants to take a more structured approach to learning and professional development.This role is about making learning work in a distributed environment: building training content, enabling managers to coach effectively, and creating engaging async learning formats.
üìö What You‚Äôll DoDesign and run learning programs for remote employees (onboarding, leadership, upskilling)Build self-paced, async-first training modules that fit distributed work stylesSupport managers with tools and guidance for coaching their teamsOrganize knowledge-sharing sessions and peer learning initiativesPartner with People Ops to align learning with company goals
üåü What Success Looks Like in 6 MonthsA refreshed onboarding program that helps new hires ramp up fasterClear learning paths for at least two core skill areas (e.g. leadership, product knowledge)Async training modules in place that employees actually use and enjoyManagers feel supported with coaching frameworks and materials
‚úÖ What They‚Äôre Looking For3+ years in L&D, HR, or training design (remote or international orgs a plus)Strong understanding of digital/async learning methods and tools (LMS, Notion, Loom, etc.)Able to design engaging content (slides, docs, videos) for self-paced learningExcellent communicator in English; facilitation skills for live sessions also valuedCuriosity and adaptability to work across different functions and cultures
üåç The SetupRemote-first, employees across Europe and North AmericaPeople team of 5, working closely with managers in Product, Engineering, and SalesCET ¬±3h preferred working hours

description.text:
Overview

Overview

The Manager, Professional Services is responsible for overseeing the successful delivery of billable professional services engagements, leading and developing a high-performing team, and ensuring the financial health and growth of the services portfolio. This role is accountable for customer satisfaction, operational excellence, and achieving key financial metrics, while driving strategic initiatives and continuous improvement across the portfolio.

Working at Atlassian

Atlassians can choose where they work ‚Äì whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.

Responsibilities

Customer Delivery & Engagement

Oversee the end-to-end delivery of professional services projects, ensuring high-quality, on-time, and within-budget outcomes for customers.Serve as an executive sponsor for key accounts, building trusted relationships with customer stakeholders and ensuring alignment with their business objectives.Drive customer satisfaction and referenceability through proactive engagement, issue resolution, and value realization.


Team Management & Leadership

Lead, mentor, and develop a team of services managers, consultants, and project managers, fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous learning.Set clear performance expectations, provide regular feedback, and support career development for team members.


Financial & Operational Management

Own the P&L for the services portfolio, including revenue forecasting, margin management, and resource utilization.Monitor and report on key financial KPIs such as billable utilization, backlog, project profitability, and revenue growth.Implement best practices for project governance, risk management, and operational efficiency.


Strategic Leadership

Develop and execute the portfolio strategy in alignment with company goals, identifying new service offerings and market opportunities.Collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Product, and Customer Success to drive integrated solutions and customer outcomes.Lead change management initiatives to scale delivery capabilities and improve customer experience.


Qualifications

Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Technology, or a related field required; Master‚Äôs degree or relevant certifications (e.g., PMP, PgMP) preferred.Experience: Minimum of 10 years of experience in professional services, consulting, or a related field, with at least 5 years in a leadership role managing large-scale, billable services portfolios and teams.Language: Proficiency in at least 1 EMEA South language (French, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese) with a strong preference for French.Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead, mentor, and develop high-performing teams, including direct people management and fostering a culture of accountability and growth.Financial Acumen: Proven track record of managing P&L, driving revenue growth, optimizing resource utilization, and achieving financial KPIs for a services portfolio.Customer Focus: Strong background in building and maintaining executive-level customer relationships, driving customer satisfaction, and delivering outcome-based solutions.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Experience partnering with Sales, Customer Success, Product, and Engineering to deliver integrated customer solutions and drive business outcomes.Strategic Thinking: Ability to develop and execute portfolio strategies, manage change, and scale delivery capabilities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Communication: Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels and present complex information clearly.Industry Knowledge: Deep understanding of SaaS, cloud technologies, and professional services best practices.


Benefits & Perks

Atlassian offers a wide range of perks and benefits designed to support you, your family and to help you engage with your local community. Our offerings include health and wellbeing resources, paid volunteer days, and so much more. To learn more, visit go.atlassian.com/perksandbenefits .

About Atlassian

At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team. Our software products help teams all over the planet and our solutions are designed for all types of work. Team collaboration through our tools makes what may be impossible alone, possible together.

We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

To provide you the best experience, we can support with accommodations or adjustments at any stage of the recruitment process. Simply inform our Recruitment team during your conversation with them.

To learn more about our culture and hiring process, visit go.atlassian.com/crh .

jobs.description:
Overview

Overview

The Manager, Professional Services is responsible for overseeing the successful delivery of billable professional services engagements, leading and developing a high-performing team, and ensuring the financial health and growth of the services portfolio. This role is accountable for customer satisfaction, operational excellence, and achieving key financial metrics, while driving strategic initiatives and continuous improvement across the portfolio.

Working at Atlassian

Atlassians can choose where they work ‚Äì whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.

Responsibilities

Customer Delivery & Engagement

Oversee the end-to-end delivery of professional services projects, ensuring high-quality, on-time, and within-budget outcomes for customers.Serve as an executive sponsor for key accounts, building trusted relationships with customer stakeholders and ensuring alignment with their business objectives.Drive customer satisfaction and referenceability through proactive engagement, issue resolution, and value realization.


Team Management & Leadership

Lead, mentor, and develop a team of services managers, consultants, and project managers, fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous learning.Set clear performance expectations, provide regular feedback, and support career development for team members.

basic_info.title: Sales & Marketing Specialist / Growth Strategist  $35‚Äì$100/hr‚Äì Remote EU

description.text: Sales & Marketing ExpertRemote | Hourly Contract | $35 ‚Äì $100 per hourRole OverviewExperienced Sales & Marketing professionals are invited to join a collaboration with a top AI research lab. The role focuses on training, evaluating, and refining advanced AI systems designed to replicate real-world sales and marketing workflows.This is a hands-on opportunity to apply your expertise in strategy, campaigns, and customer engagement to shape AI agents that can perform at an enterprise level.Key ResponsibilitiesEvaluate AI-generated sales and marketing outputs for quality, accuracy, and alignment with best practices.Calibrate AI decision-making in tasks such as campaign creation, performance analysis, and strategy planning.Develop practical assets including onboarding playbooks, interview guides, campaign concepts, and customer journeys.Collaborate asynchronously with AI researchers and product teams to improve workflows and system outputs.Ideal QualificationsRequired: 3+ years of professional experience in Sales, Marketing, or Advertising OR graduate-level education.Preferred: Background at an elite consulting firm or technology company, education from a top-tier institution, or senior-level industry role.Demonstrated experience in building sales/marketing strategies and running campaigns.Strong ability to create customer-facing assets, playbooks, and campaign materials.Excellent analytical, writing, and presentation skills.Project TimelineStart Date: July 26Duration: ~6 weeksCommitment: ~20 hours/week, part-timeSchedule: Fully remote and asynchronous (flexible working hours)Compensation & ContractHourly Rate: $35 ‚Äì$100, depending on experience.Status: Independent contractor.Payment: Weekly via Stripe Connect.Application & Onboarding ProcessSubmit resume and application form.Participate in a 30-minute AI interview to assess your ability to train models within your area of expertise.Complete a paid work trial (a short assessment, a few hours, compensated).
