basic_info.title: Head of Sales West and Southern Europe

description.text: Head of Sales, Europe West & SouthOur client is a fast-growing banking infrastructure provider that challenges the status quo in financial services. They empower businesses with the tools to move money efficiently and securely, and are now looking for a Head of Sales, Europe West & South to drive growth across France, Italy, Spain, Portugal, and other Mediterranean markets.Reporting to the EU Chief Executive Officer and Group Chief Revenue Officer, you will develop and execute the regional sales strategy, achieve revenue targets, and deliver new client wins. This is a fully remote role, though our client is specifically seeking someone based in France to establish strong local foundations for future growth.Key Responsibilities:Devise and secure senior management approval for a sales plan with targets and KPIs, positioning the company as a long-term partner to potential clients and creating momentum for change.Implement the approved sales plan to achieve short-, medium-, and long-term revenue growth, as well as other KPIs.Lead sales campaigns and manage the end-to-end sales cycle, including resource coordination, negotiation, and contract closing.Establish world-class sales processes (forecasting, pipeline management, account planning, etc.) to support growth in Europe West & South.Build senior-level relationships with clients, prospects, and partners to drive traction in the market.Develop and manage the partner ecosystem to enhance sales effectiveness in the region.Recommend pricing and sales strategies to leadership to maximise long-term value.Contribute to overall leadership, working closely with cross-functional teams to support existing clients and provide market feedback for product and service development.After initial success, build and lead a top-class sales team in Europe West & South, fostering a high-performance culture.What you‚Äôll bring:B2B sales and client management experience in banking or fintech, including selling and managing high-value complex solutions with long sales cycles.Sales strategy expertise, with proven experience developing and executing plans to achieve revenue goals and KPIs.International experience, ideally across Europe.Language skills: Excellent English and French; fluency in Portuguese, Italian, or Spanish is a plus.Proactive attitude and leadership: takes initiative, collaborative, and able to unite teams.Energy and dynamism: creative, enthusiastic, action-oriented.Drive and ambition: motivated to exceed targets, challenge the status quo, and make an impact.Resourcefulness and flexibility: able to prioritise, work autonomously, and perform under pressure in a fast-changing environment.Personal qualities: organised, reliable, high integrity, detail-oriented, resilient, and open.

description.text:
At Accelerant, we‚Äôre transforming the way capacity is distributed to specialist MGAs across Europe, UK, US and Canada. We help our partner MGA‚Äôs growth through high-quality capacity, strategic advice, streamlined processes, and exceptional service. We value innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach to create lasting success for our partners.
The RoleTo be successful in this role you will need significant experience of insurance and MGA operations/binder management. You also need to be a comfortable leader.
We are seeking a French-speaking Insurance Professional to join our growing team of experts. The Member Relationship Director lead MGA onboarding, relationship management, and operational delivery for our MGA Members across Europe. This is a high-impact role where you will be the key link between our Members, Brokers, Underwriters, and internal teams ‚Äî ensuring exceptional service and strategic growth opportunities.
What You'll DoLead onboarding for new MGA Members, from due diligence to operational go-live.Manage relationships with existing MGA Members, ensuring ongoing satisfaction and growth.Identify strategic and tactical opportunities to support MGA Member success.Oversee and improve operational processes for greater efficiency.Ensure compliance with local and European regulatory standards.Act as an escalation point for operational issues, audits, and credit control matters.Coordinate with TPAs, Brokers, and Underwriters for smooth and timely information flow.
What You BringStrong knowledge and understanding of MGA operations and binder management.Experience in insuranceFluency in French and English (additional European languages are a plus).Proven experience managing MGA or delegated authority business relationships.Strong understanding of European insurance market regulations.Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.Self-starter mindset with the ability to work in a geographically diverse team.
Why Join UsBe part of a fast-growing, innovative company redefining delegated underwriting.Work alongside industry experts in an international, collaborative environment.Opportunity to shape and improve processes with measurable impact.Competitive compensation.
Enjoy our comprehensive benefits package designed to meet your diverse needs and support your well-being:
Work-life balance: We believe that taking time to rest and recharge makes us all better. That‚Äôs why we offer flexible time off and encourage our team to take the time they need to prioritize their health and well-being.
Health and wellness: We offer high-quality health, dental, and other benefits to ensureour team members have access to the care they need.
Remote work: Work where you‚Äôre most productive and fulfilled. This position is open to remote candidates across Europe who have the flexibility to work with our teams distributed across Europe and North America. Most cross-team collaboration happens in the mornings of the Eastern Time Zone.
Travel: We value face-to-face connections and believe that in-person interactions can enhance collaboration and build stronger relationships. Travel could be a small part of your role, with opportunities to connect with your team and our members in person.

About Accelerant:Accelerant is a data-driven risk exchange connecting underwriters of specialty insurance risk with risk capital providers. Accelerant was founded in 2018 by a group of longtime insurance industry executives and technology experts who shared a vision of rebuilding the way risk is exchanged ‚Äì so that it works better, for everyone. The Accelerant risk exchange does business across more than 20 different countries and 250 specialty products, and we are proud that our insurers have been awarded an AM Best A- (Excellent) rating. For more information, please visit www.accelerant.ai
Ready to join us? Apply now and help us deliver exceptional service to our MGA Members across Europe.

basic_info.title: Senior Privacy Specialist | EMEA (Germany, UK, France)

description.text:
Degreed is the upskilling platform that fuels growth and innovation through lifelong learning. We bring together everything you need to learn and advance: LMSs, courses, videos, articles, projects, and real-world skill insights, matching you with opportunities that align with your skills, role, and goals.

For businesses, Degreed helps build a culture of learning that attracts, develops, and retains top talent, driving both individual and company success.

We believe learning is the key to unlocking opportunities. Our mission is to discover, empower, and celebrate the next generation of global expertise.

Join us in shaping the future of learning and workforce development!

The Senior Privacy Specialist will be part of Degreed‚Äôs privacy team and involved in managing our organization's privacy and AI compliance programs, ensuring compliance with applicable regulations, such as the GDPR and the EU AI Act.

Key Skills

Proven experience as a Privacy Specialist, Data Protection Office or a similar role, with a strong understanding of GDPR and mature privacy programs (3-5 years).Fluent English is required, knowledge of French, German or Portuguese are an advantage. Recognized privacy or AI governance certifications (e.g. IAPP, other national associations) are an advantageBachelor's degree in Law, Information Technology, or a related field is desirable, but not requiredExperience in implementing ISO frameworks (ISO 27001 or ISO 42001) is an advantage In-depth knowledge of data protection laws, regulations, and best practices.Knowledge of applicable AI regulations/frameworks or a willingness to quickly upskillStrong analytical and problem-solving skills.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.

Key Responsibilities

Inform, advise on and monitor compliance with existing and developing privacy and AI regulations applicable to Degreed, with a focus on, but not limited to GDPR and the EU AI ActDevelop, implement, and maintain privacy policies, procedures, and guidelines.Provide expert advice and guidance on data protection impact assessments (DPIAs) and privacy by designOversee the development and implementation of AI systems, ensuring compliance with the EU AI ActReview and negotiate any contractual terms related to privacy and AI, including but not limited to DPAs or AI addendums.Support the DPO in performing all relevant DPO tasksStay up-to-date with developments in data protection and AI laws and regulations, and advise the organization on necessary adjustments.

Compensation

We are committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.

Actual compensation packages are based on several factors that are unique to each candidate, including but not limited to: skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location.

Benefits



We take care of our people with a comprehensive benefits package designed to support your well-being, growth, and success.

View the full details here: https://px.sequoia.com/globalcompanybenefits

At Degreed, We Value

üåç Diversity & Inclusion ‚Äì We celebrate diverse perspectives and backgrounds, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and contribute.

üìà Growth Mindset ‚Äì Learning is at the heart of what we do. We empower our employees to continuously develop their skills and grow their careers in alignment with their unique strengths and aspirations.

ü§ù Collaboration ‚Äì The best ideas come from working together. We cultivate a culture of open communication, teamwork, and shared success.

By joining Degreed, you‚Äôll be part of a community that values learning, collaboration, and meaningful impact. If you‚Äôre passionate about driving change through upskilling and workforce transformation, we encourage you to apply and contribute to our mission.

Work Environment & Physical Demands

Degreed offers flexible work arrangements tailored to each role. Some positions are fully remote, while others follow a hybrid model for employees near an office. Please check the job details for role-specific requirements.

For remote and hybrid roles, you‚Äôll collaborate virtually using tools like Zoom and Slack. This role may require prolonged computer use and stationary work, with the ability to interpret written and verbal communication effectively.

We are committed to creating an inclusive and adaptable work environment that enables every team member to thrive and do their best work.

Additional Information

Degreed is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a workplace free from discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including recruitment, hiring, career development, compensation, and training.

üí° Accessibility & Accommodations ‚Äì We are dedicated to full inclusion and will provide reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. If you need assistance, please let us know.

üîç Fair Hiring Practices ‚Äì In compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

üìÑ E-Verify Participation ‚Äì Degreed participates in the E-Verify employment verification program.

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates & Applicants

If you‚Äôre applying from specific regions, your personal data may be processed in line with applicable privacy laws, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA).

To understand how we handle applicant data, please review our Global Data Privacy Notice and related policies:

Global Privacy NoticeGDPR Compliance Details

By submitting your application, you acknowledge and agree to our use and processing of your data in compliance with applicable laws.

Fraudulent Recruitment Warning üö®

Beware of fraudulent recruitment scams using the Degreed name. Scammers may impersonate our company, website, or hiring team.

Degreed will never:

‚ùå Conduct recruitment via WhatsApp, Telegram, or direct-messaging platforms.‚ùå Request sensitive personal or financial information in unsolicited communications.‚ùå Offer jobs requiring upfront payments or promising unrealistic returns.

‚úÖ Official Degreed communications will always come from a @degreed.com email address or phone number during the hiring process.

If you encounter suspicious activity, please report it immediately. Stay vigilant and protect yourself from fraud.

description.text:
Job Description

Position: Deepfield Software Engineer Co-op

Number of Position(s): 1

Duration: 3 Months

Date: September - December 2025

Location: Ann Arbor, MI - remote or hybrid.

Educational Requirements

Currently a candidate for a bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field at an accredited school in the US.

How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn

Write clean, scalable, maintainable, and testable codeParticipate in code reviewsContribute to architecture/design discussionsContribute to positive organizational growthTriage, debug, and fix defects 

Key Skills And Experience

Solid awareness of development in a Linux environment.Familiarity with networking concepts.For frontend-focused applicants.Exposure to scripting languages such as JavaScriptExperience or coursework using React is a plus.For backend/test-focused applicants.Experience working with both compiled and scripting languages.Python experience preferred. 

It would be nice if you also had:

A team-oriented mindset and eagerness to contribute to a growing team.Ability to iterate quickly, learn fast, and take initiative.

About Us

 Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work

What we offer

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:

 One of the World‚Äôs Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere  Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg  Workplace Pride Global Benchmark 

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia‚Äôs employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

Additional Information

US/Canada Nokia Offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes but is not limited to:

 Corporate Retirement Savings Plan  Health and dental benefits  Short-term disability, and long-term disability  Life insurance, and AD&D ‚Äì Company paid 2x base pay  Optional or Supplemental life and AD&D insurance (Employee/Spouse/Child)  Paid time off for holidays and Vacation  Employee Stock Purchase Plan  Tuition Assistance Plan  Adoption assistance  Employee Assistance Program/Work Life Resource Program 

The above benefits exclude students. Disclaimer for US/Canada

Nokia Maintains broad annual base salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience and market conditions, and with consideration to internal peer equity.(Check the salary ranges in the job info section for this role)

All North America job posts will post for a minimum of 7 calendar days and up to 180 days or until candidate/s identified.

About The Team

The pandemic has highlighted how important telecoms networks are to society. Nokia‚Äôs Network Infrastructure group is at the heart of a revolution to bring more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise.

description.text:
Our client is a global leader in surgical innovation, focused on advancing technologies that improve outcomes for both patients and providers. They are seeking a Senior Regional Marketing Manager to drive downstream marketing strategy and execution across the region.
In this role, you will be responsible for developing marketing strategies, leading product launches, supporting field execution, and ensuring the commercial success of a highly technical product portfolio.
The position requires a balance of strategic thinking, hands-on execution, and cross-functional collaboration with sales, product management, and clinical teams.

Key responsibilities Develop and implement comprehensive downstream marketing strategies and tactics aligned to business objectives and commercial targets, based on market research and competitor analysisLead regional product launches in close collaboration with upstream product management, driving launch strategies, generating marketing materials, and executing commercialization programs including sales readiness trainingPartner with Marketing Communications to manage and enhance brand presence through marketing campaigns, convention strategy, and tailored collateral with clear product positioning and messagingProvide strategic and prioritized direction to the sales organization through marketing plans, training presentations, and ongoing communicationStay connected to customer needs and market trends by building relationships with KOLs, customers, and industry stakeholders to inform product launch plans and regional strategiesDevelop and deploy customer engagement programs, including advocacy initiatives, congress activities, and experience eventsCollaborate with cross-functional teams including sales, professional affairs, market development, and regulatory affairs to drive market expansion strategiesAct as a subject matter expert on the product portfolio, championing and communicating the value proposition internally and externallyEnsure marketing activities comply with industry regulations and company standardsTravel to customer sites to support clinical cases, training programs, and key industry eventsManage the departmental budget, ensuring efficient resource allocation
Key Requirements Minimum of five years of product marketing, clinical or marketing, or field sales experience within medical devices or capital equipment with highly technical productsProven experience in downstream marketing including scaled product launchesStrong ability to analyze market and financial data and translate insights into actionable strategyAbility to establish credibility quickly with customers, KOLs, and internal stakeholdersExcellent communication, presentation, and influencing skillsCustomer-focused mindset with a strong drive for resultsTrack record of working effectively in cross-functional and multidisciplinary teamsTravel across Europe ~20%
What Our Client OffersA mission-driven culture with a clear focus on improving surgical outcomesCollaborative colleagues who value teamwork and integrityThe chance to work on breakthrough technologies that directly impact patients‚Äô livesOpportunities to develop your strengths, follow your passion, and advance your careerA flexible, engaging work environmentA competitive benefits package
If you‚Äôre interested in learning more please apply below!

description.text:
Founded in 2014 by Jerome Jacques Marie Mage, Jacques Marie Mage is a Los Angeles-based producer of limited-edition designer goods specializing in the micro-production of luxury eyewear for a clientele of discerning tastes.

With each new collection, JMM embraces a unique palette of precious materials, rich colors, and striking geometric forms, which cleverly reference and beautifully reconfigure the striking individuals, artistic movements, and world events of previous centuries. All JMM eyewear is ethically sourced and produced with the utmost respect for industry partners' environment and wellbeing.

Role Overview

Reporting to the Global VP of Sales, the Head of Resale will manage the process and workflow of JMM‚Äôs buy-back program.

Key Responsibilities

 Your responsibilities are ‚Äì but are not limited to: 

 Create, oversee, and manage development of E-Commerce platform to be used for buying and selling of previously owned Jacques Marie Mage pieces.  Work alongside cross functional partners to source and buy second hand Jacques Marie Mage pieces including establishing pricing strategy to meet profitability targets.  Review and maintain product data files while tracking and identifying needs.  Design and develop secondary market strategy in alignment with Jacques Marie Mage‚Äôs business and growth objectives and take full ownership of its execution.  Maintain and update product information, inventory, and pricing.  Analyze and review data and metrics to enhance selling features, identify gaps between demand and our assortment.  Work alongside Head Curator and VP of Global Sales to develop and build out a consignment program.  Able to identify market trends to serve as pricing expert.  Identify and manage business opportunities/risks within existing/new agreements.  Develop negotiation strategies for supply agreements aligned with business goals. 

Key Requirements

 Relevant bachelor‚Äôs degree (preferred) or equivalent experience  3+ years of experience in luxury retail consignment with major business functions including product management, merchandising, or pricing.  Industry knowledge, serve as market expert for this business area.  Proven ability to grow a category and bring creativity and passion to market.  Must have good written and oral communication skills across multiple disciplines  Have the ability to handle multiple projects concurrently while meeting aggressive deadlines.  Exhibit a can-do attitude, be self-motivated and assist other cross-functional roles within the organization  Strong follow-through and teamwork skills  Experience in consumer products is a plus  Growth mindset and enthusiasm for learning new tools and problem solving. 

Additional Information

Jacques Marie Mage is a company that respects the uniqueness of each employee and offers everyone the means to find their place and thrive. We promote initiatives aimed at supporting professional equality for everyone. We strive to go above and beyond purely symbolic measures by building a culture focused on meaningful strategies aimed at creating an inclusive workforce.

basic_info.title: Recruiter Search Consultant Entry Level Remote

description.text:
gpac offers an excellent work-life balance in a fast-paced work environment. There is tremendous earning potential with no cap. As a part of our team, you will be surrounded by passionate teammates pushing each other to exceed their own goals. This is a position that allows you to help transform people's lives by placing them in their ideal positions with our clients while transforming your life as well.

We have a tried-and-true recipe for success that has allowed us to become an industry leader and one of the largest and most successful executive search firms in the country, with an extensive and ever-growing network of search consultants.

We do not require previous recruiting experience because we provide the proper training, tools, resources and support to reach your individual earning goals. We also have continuous coaching and guidance once you join our team.

REMOTE POSITION MX - This is a commission-driven position with the opportunity to earn between 15-75% of your production.

Key Areas Of Responsibility

basic_info.title: Senior Business Manager - Food Compliance Services

description.text:
Senior Business Executive ‚Äì Food Compliance Services (Continental Europe)
My client, an international regulatory consulting group, is looking for a Senior Business Executive to spearhead business development for their Food Division across Continental Europe. This is a key strategic hire, building the bridge between European clients and a well-established global team, with a focus on supporting companies navigating novel food ingredients and regulatory compliance.
The Food Division is one of the fastest-growing areas of the business, with global flagship projects spanning GRAS notices, EU novel food applications, Chinese NHC registrations, South Korean submissions, and regulatory pathways in Australia and New Zealand. In this role, you‚Äôll be responsible for identifying new opportunities, securing high-level client engagement, and driving tailored compliance solutions across the European market.
The role You‚Äôll take ownership of expanding market presence by:Defining and executing clear plans for European growth in food compliance and novel food ingredients.Building relationships with senior decision-makers, understanding their regulatory challenges, and converting these into long-term partnerships.Acting as a trusted consultant to clients on food compliance, regulatory, and testing requirements.Enhancing visibility in the market through conferences, industry events, and targeted networking.Collaborating with an experienced global team to deliver end-to-end client solutions.
What you bringDegree in food science, biology, microbiology, or a related discipline.5+ years of experience in food regulatory compliance or business development within the novel food ingredients sector.Strong knowledge of global food regulations, ideally with direct exposure to novel food frameworks in the EU or internationally.Excellent communication skills in English; fluency in another European language is a plus.A proactive, solution-driven approach with the ability to shape and deliver strategic market initiatives.
Why joinA pivotal role in expanding a global consultancy‚Äôs European footprint.Well-structured training and career development pathways.Exposure to cutting-edge areas of food regulation, including EU novel foods and FDA GRAS.Competitive package including salary, holiday bonus, pension, health insurance allowance, and team activities.Remote role with flexibility, ideally based in Germany, Netherlands, Belgium, or France.
Confidential application If you‚Äôre looking to make an impact in food regulatory affairs and want to drive growth across Europe, get in touch for a confidential discussion. You can also email Abid Kanji on a.kanji@nonstopconsulting.com

description.text: Location: Remote (Europe) | Travel Required: ~25‚Äì30%  Dragon Shield is a high-growth company, renowned for creating premium accessories that protect and elevate the games and collectibles we cherish. You probably know us for our card sleeves, the go-to choice for protecting trading card game decks around the world. Now, we're expanding our mission to support the backbone of the TCG community: local game stores (LGSs). We're launching a new direct-to-retailer sales program, and we‚Äôre looking for the right person to help us build it from the ground up.  About the RoleAs one of the first team members in this exciting new program, you‚Äôll work directly with hobby shops, LGSs, and event organizers to bring Dragon Shield products straight to the people who need them most. You‚Äôll be building relationships, sharing what‚Äôs new, and helping stores curate the perfect product mix for their community.  What You‚Äôll Be DoingHelp launch and scale our direct-to-retailer sales initiative across North America.Build and manage relationships with local game stores, hobby retailers, and event organizers.Introduce new product lines, share promotions, and offer merchandising/display recommendations.Collaborate with our internal sales team to develop outreach strategies, set targets, and refine tools and processes.Represent Dragon Shield at trade shows, conventions, and regional gaming events.Gather field feedback to help shape future products, promotions, and programs. Who You AreYou have experience in sales or account management, ideally in the gaming, toy, collectible, or lifestyle brand space.You‚Äôre a TCG fan at heart‚Äîyou know the difference between Commander and Standard, and you‚Äôve probably helped organize (or at least played in) a few events.You‚Äôre a great communicator, organized, and not afraid to pick up the phone, drop into a store, or follow up a few times. You‚Äôre a self-starter who thrives in a startup-like environment and can work independently.You‚Äôre based in North America and open to travel up to 30%. Bonus Points If You‚Ä¶Have worked in or with a local game store before.Already know (and love) Dragon Shield products.Speak more than one language (Spanish or Canadian French is a big plus!). What We‚Äôre OfferingCompetitive base salary plus commissionFlexible remote work environmentTravel opportunities and access to major events/conventionsFree product samples and employee discountsA real voice in shaping the future of Dragon Shield‚Äôs direct-to-retailer presence This is your chance to be part of something new and meaningful in the tabletop gaming world‚Äîwhile working with one of the most trusted brands in the industry.  #LI-Remote

description.text:
Title: Account Executive ‚Äì Aviation SoftwareLocation: Remote (Europe-based)Salary: Open and flexible depending on the right candidateJob Type: Full-time
Are you passionate about aviation and skilled in building long-term client relationships? We'relooking for an experienced Account Executive to manage and grow a portfolio of aviation customers across Europe. This is your chance to work with a high-growth group of aviation software businesses, delivering innovative solutions to top-tier clients.
About the RoleIn this key role, you‚Äôll be responsible for managing approximately 40 existing accounts in the aviationsector, driving retention, growth, and satisfaction. You'll play a strategic part in upselling and cross selling a suite of cutting-edge aviation software products across multiple business units. The role isremote, but candidates must be fluent in French and English, and based in Europe.
What We‚Äôre Looking For‚Ä¢ Must be fluent in both French and English, written and spoken.‚Ä¢ Must have a strong understanding of SaaS or aviation-related software.‚Ä¢ Must have solid aviation experience, ideally in maintenance or technical services.‚Ä¢ Demonstrated success managing complex, consultative accounts.‚Ä¢ Comfortable working remotely and across time zones.

description.text:
Customer Service Specialist (iGaming)
Salary: up to ‚Ç¨28k GrossWork Setting: 100% Remote, with rotational shiftsTimezone: EUContract: Self-Employed/B2B 
We are seeking a dedicated and professional Customer Service Agent to deliver exceptional support to players in a fast-paced online gaming environment. The ideal candidate will demonstrate excellent communication skills, a customer-first mindset, and the ability to work efficiently under pressure.
Key ResponsibilitiesProvide prompt and professional assistance to customers via live chat, email, and phone.Support players with account-related matters, including deposits, withdrawals, bonuses, and general gameplay queries.Deliver accurate guidance across both sportsbook and casino products.Handle customer complaints with empathy, escalating complex issues when necessary.Ensure compliance with responsible gaming practices and regulatory requirements.Maintain accurate records of customer interactions and follow-ups.Collaborate with internal teams to resolve issues and improve processes.Stay up to date with promotions, product updates, and company policies/procedures.Deliver a customer experience aligned with brand values and service standards.Contribute to a positive team culture and continuous improvement initiatives.
Role DetailsSchedule: 40 hours per week on a 24/7 rotational shift basis.Location: Fully remote, but candidates must be able to work within the EU time zone.Equipment: Candidates must provide their own laptop, headset, secondary monitor, and VPN (if required for system access).Language: Fluency in English (written and spoken) is mandatory.
Engagement TermsContract Type: Self-employed. Agents are responsible for their own taxes, social security, and related obligations.Requirements: An established B2B setup is essential; prior iGaming experience is preferred.

description.text:
DiasporArm is looking for a motivated and community-minded Ambassador / Media Monitor in France to help strengthen our global Armenian network. This volunteer role combines community outreach and media monitoring:
üîπ Responsibilities:‚Ä¢ Connect with Armenian individuals, student groups, organizations, and institutions across France.‚Ä¢ Identify and engage with Armenian-related media, news sources, and online platforms.‚Ä¢ Act as a bridge between DiasporArm and the Armenian community in France.
üîπ Ideal Candidate:‚Ä¢ Proactive, communicative, and passionate about the Armenian cause.‚Ä¢ Well-connected in the local community and attentive to current events.‚Ä¢ Organized and able to dedicate a few hours per week remotely.
Volunteering can last 3-6 months. At the end, a certificate and an award are given according to the work done.
üì© Interested?Send a short message to contact@diasporarm.org introducing yourself and explaining your motivation.

description.text:
About White Hat GamingWhite Hat Gaming is a state-of-the-art iGaming platform providing a secure, scalable and flexible modular Casino and Sportsbook Player Account Management solution.
We offer operators choice, from our proprietary Player Account Management (PAM) to a full white-label solution. WHG provides market-leading content including Kambi Sportsbook, CRM tools, all payment options, and more than 3000 games from 120 leading games providers.
With over 500 talented colleagues from around the world, we offer a dynamic, collaborative environment where your ideas can flourish alongside industry leaders. Join us and be at the forefront of iGaming innovation!
In Summary:
We need a Product Owner to join our growing team and help us to continue delivering exceptional Casino experiences across a range of devices. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in compliance within the gaming industry, particularly in B2C or B2B2C environments and will form part of the Product Team at White Hat Gaming.
As a Product Owner in the compliance space, you will play a key role in enhancing our compliance products and integrations, ensuring that our platforms adhere to industry regulations and standards.
Your day to day:Leading an Agile team in delivering and enhancing compliance products and integrations.Working closely with the Scrum Master in establishing and developing frameworks, processes, and tools to build and improve the focus on Iterative Product DevelopmentContinually prioritising and enhancing the Product roadmap, as part of WHG‚Äôs Company RoadmapConstantly prioritising incoming work to balance various regulatory, stakeholder and technical inputsDocumenting stories and requirements clearly, concisely and appropriately Being an active part of a Scrum team, consisting of Product Owner, Scrum Master, Developers, QA and Integrations Engineers; preparing for and contributing fully in all scrum ceremonies to ensure effective delivery of the roadmap 
What we are looking for:In-depth knowledge of compliance within the gaming industry, with particular focus on KYC/Verification regulations across UK, Europe, Canada and the USA.Experience working with Casino operationsA collaborative approach and used to working with different Product VerticalsStrong analytical skills to interpret complex regulatory requirements and translate them into actionable product features4 years plus of compliance experience within iGaming, preferably in the B2C spaceAbility to translate company and business strategy into the WHG product visionAbility to identify and mitigate compliance risks associated with product development and implementationA value-focused product approach with a focus on enriching the productsDriving innovation, encouraging creativity, and collecting ideas for new propositions to strengthen and develop the product portfolio for the assigned product area whilst also adding business value as well as meeting the customers‚Äô & market's needsAbility to translate B2C thinking, features and functionality into a packaged B2B offeringWorking together with other Product Owners, Product Managers and Head of Product to ensure alignment across various strategic dependenciesClearly communicate the product area strategies, roadmap, and planned deliveries to internal and external stakeholdersProvide insight to stakeholders and provide insights on key differentiatorsManage and own the profitability and commercial success of the designated product area
Nice to have:
Understanding of SDLC and, preferably, experience with provider integrationsKnowledge/experience of the Scrum frameworkExperience using Jira/Confluence and similar toolsFamiliarity with APIsProject or Product Management Certification (PMP, PSM or other)Experience and knowledge of Responsible Gambling regulations across UK, Europe, Canada, and the USA.
How we approach things:Dynamic Medium-Sized Environment: We have a can-do ethos, where innovation is encouraged, and action is valued.Core Values at Heart: We live by Teamwork, Innovation, Trust, and Integrity in everything we do.Results-Oriented Focus: We prioritize getting things done while supporting each other to reach both collective and individual goals.Open Collaboration: Our open-door policy fosters collaboration across all levels and departments, where ideas flow freely.Global Team: We are truly a global team with people from various counties and cultures contributing to our success.
What we offer:A remote and flexible working schedule. Generous time off varied based on the country of residence.Discretionary annual performance bonusTraining and other learning & development opportunities to support you through your career progression.Hardware & Software allowance or work equipment is provided to make sure you have all the right tools to get the job done.Various well-being programmes and initiatives.
Everything about WHG won't fit into a job ad, want to find out more about working with us? Apply to get the conversation started. 
We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, gender, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.
By submitting your application, you agree that we process your data in accordance with our Privacy Policy for the management of your candidature to any of the positions we offer.

description.text:
Job Description

trying to find a good LLM approach to organize and summarize all the insights of 450 blog posts. it would be great if the solution organized the content into a new web page where the content was grouped/clustered by topic.

basically i cant read 400 blog posts but thinking if content is grouped into a new website easier to read it all

description.text:
We‚Äôre seeking a results-driven Sportsbook Product Owner to work on a sports betting platform. You‚Äôll work with partners, development teams, and internal stakeholders to deliver innovative, compliant, and high-performing sportsbook features that delight operators and their players.
Responsibilities
Own the sportsbook product roadmap and prioritise features for maximum commercial and user impact.Translate partner requirements into clear user stories and acceptance criteria.Manage end-to-end delivery of sportsbook features, from concept through launch.Oversee integrations with data feeds, trading tools, payments, and risk management systems.Ensure compliance with regulations across multiple jurisdictions.Monitor performance and gather feedback to improve the product.Stay ahead of sports betting trends and competitor offerings.
Requirements3+ years‚Äô product experience in sportsbook or iGaming (B2B preferred).Strong knowledge of betting operations, markets, and integrations.Proven track record managing agile product backlogs.Understanding of compliance in regulated betting markets.Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

description.text:
Who We AreA niche recruitment consultancy passionate about advancing healthcare. We strive for more than transactional relationships, offering a unique, culture-centric approach to build high-performing teams. Our fast, agile, and reliable service has successfully placed over 200 med tech & biotech professionals worldwide.
The ClientSpencer Rigby is proud to be partnered with a global precision medicine innovator shaping the future of Companion Diagnostics. With strong expertise in genomics, bioinformatics, and regulatory science, this company partners with leading pharmaceutical organizations to deliver diagnostics that ensure the right patients receive the right therapies. Their mission is to accelerate personalized medicine adoption worldwide.
ResponsibilitiesLead global Companion Diagnostic (CDx) programs from concept to regulatory approval and commercialization.Define and implement CDx strategies aligned with precision medicine initiatives.Drive collaboration across R&D, Regulatory, Clinical, Bioinformatics, and Business Development.Build partnerships with pharmaceutical and diagnostic organizations.Support global regulatory submissions (FDA, IVDR, PMDA, NMPA) and validation strategies.
Qualifications8+ years in CDx development, biomarker strategy, or precision medicine.Proven success in advancing CDx programs through approval and partnerships.Strong knowledge of CDx regulatory frameworks (FDA & IVDR required; PMDA/NMPA a plus).Experience with analytical validation studies and regulatory submissions.Global program leadership (U.S. and EU minimum).Background in Clinical Diagnostics with pharma exposure, or Pharma with direct CDx involvement.Independent, results-driven, and comfortable influencing cross-functional teams.
